Reviews.Title: “Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: canary1313
Reviews.Content: The Grand Chateau worked great for us. It was quiet without a casino, and was within close walking distance to all the big strip hotels. We found that they had enough of a market in the lobby that we didn't need to do much food shopping in nearby Walgreens. The rooftop pool is small and has limited shade umbrellas so we didn't use it. Excellent hotel for someone not interested in casino games.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: amygrattan
Reviews.Content: We booked one night here before checking into a luxury hotel for a conference. Located a half block off the strip on a side street, the location was okay and it appeared to be a newer facility. We'd never been to a timeshare and thought the room would be a grade above a typical hotel room. Not our first choice, but we thought we'll rack up the Marriott points for the few hours we were there and move along. Mistake. The basic king room itself was clean and generous size, equipped with a microwave and refrigerator, seating area and breakfast table. Bath had a nice vanity and good lighting, lots of thick towels. HOWEVER, the king size bed was hard as a rock, the AC was loud and the walls were paper thin. I went up to the rooftop pool to relax after a long flight, and found the "pool" - 3 feet deep and approximately 10' x 10'. Crazy small, barely large enough for 10 people to stand in without touching. No laps here. The deck itself was wall to wall people drinking at a bar in the corner - a sidewalk atmosphere. NOT at all what I was expecting. In the morning, I was awakened at 7am when the bed shook several times as the door to the next room slammed. I could hear loud voices talking as if they were in my bathroom. A call to the front desk resulted in quiet 10 minutes later. When checking out I asked what the commotion was, I was told it was housekeeping in the next room. TOTALLY unacceptable. No apology, no offer to award extra points. When I walked outside to leave the property, I stood in the self serve (no doorman) taxi line for 20 minutes as cabs drove by within sight. The hotel driveway is accessed by an alley off a side street and apparently there is no taxi light to alert passing cabs. I was ready to walk the block and half to the strip and hail a cab on the corner myself when finally a cab appeared to discharge passengers. The entire stay was very frustrating. We stay at Marriott hotels 8-12 nights per month and this was the bottom of the barrel. stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lrmdell
Reviews.Content: 1 block off the strip good for walking- but even better after the novelty of the walk wears off , you can drive the back way (turn right out of the Marriott, then left, then second stop sign rutn left and park at Paris Las Vegas / Ballys in about 2 minutes. Perfect - especially at night. Typical Marriott timeshare hotel - everything done exactly right - well except the sign and there are no grounds. Staff is teriffic - always at least two staff to get your car, everyone friendly and knowledgable. We didn't even bother to go up and see the pool. Finding it if you've never seen it is problematic - so it's really off Harmon Street (east) and Planet Hollywood Drive, (see the picture). We drove past it coming in at night and then didn't know how to get to it. In the day light it would be no problem except even then you don't see the sign until you're on top of it. Maybe a sign on the building would do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent timeshare in a central location”
Reviews.Author: rdytogo1
Reviews.Content: I telecommute full time for my work. We had a week of our timeshare that we would lose if we didn't use it so thought we could work by day, play at night from this property. Pros I've stayed at many hotels on the planet and this by far has the most solid wifi. Rock solid all day. Short walk to Aria Cosmopolitan and most anything on the strip Drug store very very nearby Free shuttle to supermarket Spacious 1bedroom with full kitchen. 2 sinks in bath Well equipped gym Taxi service available Flat screen tvs in bedroom and living room Close to airport Cons Pool area on roof very small and crowded on weekend and no shade. It's a timeshare so you will get a call about attending presentation. We ignore all that so not an issue No cleaning services for the week. Extra charge if we wanted service It's Las Vegas so you may have some loudness in the hallways especially on the weekend Other notes Did not avail ourselves of concierge or other activities that are available No casino which is good or bad depending on your viewpoint

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but several major flaws”
Reviews.Author: ShakaUVM
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Chateau has a really nice layout - big villas, with kitchens(!), that can connect to other villas as well for additional space. (A 2 bedroom villa is basically a one bedroom connected to a one bedroom suite.) The place is nicely appointed, with tasteful decor throughout. The rooftop pool has some nice views, and a bar area for those so inclined. It's cheaper than the comparable MGM Signature (which doesn't come with kitchens, AFAIK). That said, there's several massive flaws in the design of the place that knocked it down from a 5-star to a 3-star property: 1) The place is a timeshare hotel, and the Marriott staff will hound you relentlessly about buying a timeshare, even if you're just there on a business trip, using it as a normal hotel. They'll pretend to be calling about something else, too, which is unusually deceptive for a company like Marriott. 2) The road access is terrible. There's a little driveway that gets completely clogged by cars and taxis, and people will cross into opposing traffic to get around the clogs, and then THEY get stuck, and then traffic backs up onto the street, and it's just a total nightmare. It can take 10-15 minutes from getting in your cab to getting onto the main street. Which is a distance of like 30 yards, total. 3) The front desk staff were surprisingly rude and unhelpful. (Again, very unusual for a Marriott.) They'd look at you and just ignore you, even after you'd been standing there trying to get their attention for 15 minutes - and it's not like there was a line or anything. 4) You might have to call for linens three or four times before they bring more towels up. And you need towels because they don't change them, apparently, even if they're all on the ground. 5) The kitchens don't vent. Cook anything in your room, and you'll be smelling it for the rest of your trip. This sounds sort of whiny in retrospect, but I stand by them all. I'm a pretty easygoing traveler (I spend a lot of time on the road for business trips like this), and it takes a lot to annoy me at a place, but these guys managed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the Heart of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: toteach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the strip, it is practically on the strip! It is a three minute walk to the strip - closer than some strip hotels that are set so far back. Clean, Marriott quality, hotel. No casino, which is a plus in my eyes (if you want a casino, trust me, you won't have a problem finding one). Complimentary wifi which is a huge savings when other hotels charge a ridiculous fee per device. Kitchenette in studio room was great, with fridge, micro, and toaster. All dishes and cutlery provided. Hotel secure after 6:30 - you have to use room key to access floor. Valet parking only. A little slow at times but nothing crazy. Always can get cabs easily. However, you can walk everywhere easily because you are in a great location. The only negative is the pool. When people say it is tiny, that is an understatement. A hotel this size should have something much bigger. It was probably smaller than most backyard pools - no word of a lie. However don't let this hold you back as you can always go spend the day at a neighboring hotel. There is no restaurant on site - true. But there are hundreds within steps of the place. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great space for families”
Reviews.Author: stewartfam87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 11-April 16. We were in a 3 bedroom suite, which is actually a 2 bedroom and a 1 bedroom. The party was my husband, myself, our two small children and my parents. It worked out perfectly. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the strip and is centrally located. Since I have small children (3 and 4), I wanted a non-gaming hotel. The rooms were extremely spacious with a full kitchen and washer / dryer. Anyone who has small children appreciates this. The staff was very friendly and more than happy to help with anything we needed. I had heard that the pool was quite small, but since we ended up having the coldest week in Las Vegas in years, we didn't use it. Also, there is no restaurant on property. We would have appreciated not having to go anywhere one of the nights we were there. Since my husband and I aren't the biggest gamblers, not having a casino as part of the hotel was not a problem, but I guess others would have an issue with this. Overall, we had a great experience at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Close to strip vacation ownership property”
Reviews.Author: hockeywriter
Reviews.Content: We own vacation property elsewhere so are familiar with this idea. You either get a room with a bed, sofa, fridge and microwave with some kitchen equipment or a unit with a full kitchen and separate bedroom. We were in the smaller room very similar to a regular hotel room. Everything was clean and nice but unless you like a hard mattress, this might not be the place for you. There is no restaurant on the property but they do have a 24 hour marketplace that sells more than just your usual snacks. Service was great. There is a small rooftop pool (think cruise ship) and lounging chairs. Our room was on the 30th floor facing the strip. The first night we heard a lot of music but not on the 2nd night. The hotel is right across the street from Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood Casino. It is one block off the strip. Closest hotels on the strip are the Cosmopolitan, Just up the block is the Harley Davidson BBQ place. About another block away is the Bellagio with it's fountain show every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TweetieTravels
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1-bedroom upper floor. We are on the 35th floor with a great view of the strip. Plenty of space to spread out and relax. It is located about a block off the Strip, a short walk from Planet Hollywood, Bellagio and the rest. The staff has been super friendly. We enjoy having the ability to prepare our own breakfast and snacks, and save the restaurants for great dinners. We have stayed at the Bellagio years ago and loved it, and this time we are trading points and this is a great option at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet, Safe”
Reviews.Author: Gowithyourgut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Thursday night to Monday morning, in a one bedroom suite, and I was very satisfied. Check in and check out was smooth, Valet service was excellent and quick (no call downs), bell-hops were kind and cautious with luggage, at night security was present(needed to show room key in order to go up), the room was big, the two shower heads were AWESOME, the king bed was muy comfortable, the kitchen was well equipped to cook or snack, the elevators worked and were quick, the gym was a decent size and had everything you needed for an effective and updated workout, the pool was nice but didn't use it as it was too cold. They have a market place inside the building which is very convenient and reasonably priced. The room has a safe, flat screen tv's coffee pot, black out curtains, ample seating and a gigantic tub (not jacuzzi) but big enough to lose yourself in. The building was clean as a whole. The only thing I will say that is slightly negative is that when calling the front desk you may have to call a couple of times in order to get through. Ohhh, it was vegas! The location is right across from the entrance of miracle mile (by the Brazilian steak house and seafood buffet). It is a safe, well-lighted walk back to the hotel. You are walking everywhere so this is a good location if you don't mind not having a casino in the hotel. It is near the Cosmo and another set of shops. This hotel can be strictly business or for the party goer who wants to be safe, secure and in a clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids...needs more amenities”
Reviews.Author: hessfamily
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Vegas for two nights on our way to the Grand Canyon for spring break. We have 4 kids, so we were worried about where to stay in Vegas with kids. This hotel was great because the hotel does not have a casino, so it is very quiet and not full of extra people. We loved having no crowds! The location is great, too! We were very disappointed with the pool! The kids were looking forward to a roof-top pool. But, it is very, very small, and so crowded, we couldn't even watch the kids properly. Also, it would be nice to have a restaurant and gift shop. There is a small store, where we bought milk and cereal. But, for a city known for luxury hotels, this one is just average.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - great space”
Reviews.Author: SkyHy
Reviews.Content: Well, we exchanged for this timeshare for spring break this year. It was perfect. A great location just off the strip, very central to many high-end casinos. Full kitchen, dining table, and a separate bedroom with a hot tub in the bedroom. Nice touches of granite, double shower head in the bath, and free WiFi. We found the condo to be very nice and new. Really quiet. Can't remember where I have stayed somewhere and not had to use ear plugs. No casino in-house which helps with it just being stylish and quiet. Be aware that parking is valet - but there is no extra charge for that - so it was a nice touch. Even giving a small tip each day - well worth it. The ONLY reason we do not give this 5 stars is the roof top pool. It is VERY small and lounge chairs are all jammed in. Really no view unless you are in the smoking area near the bar and can look over the wall. So we hoped to spend time up there, but did not. Otherwise a lovely place and perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The large suite was really awesome. Room was spotless, staff helpful. All the normal stuff receives top marks. I also appreciated the 24 hour snack shop in the lobby. I do have a couple issues that should be addressed: First, the nice flatscreen HDTVs do not receive any HD or digital signals. Second, the in-room condensor washer / dryer combo was incapable of getting my jeans dry. I had to carry them to a normal style dryer on a different floor. The normal dryer accomplished in 15 minutes, what the in-room dryer failed to do in many hours. Maybe it was an issue with the particular unit. If management's reading this, my room was 3202.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MatthewAsamoha
Reviews.Content: Great experience, excellent location. The maid service was surprising as this was supposed to be a time share ..I would definately recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location; Large and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: kbharvey
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've been more pleasantly surprised by a hotel...ever. I was staying in Las Vegas for only one night and was disappointed not to be staying in a casino on the strip. I expected this Marriott to be like every other Marriott - regular size room, nothing amazing. My first realization that this property was different (and better!) was when I pulled up to it in the car. It's a four or five minute walk to the strip - right at the intersection with the Bellagio, Paris and the Cosmopolitan. They also have complimentary valet parking, which was a very nice touch. I ended up in one of the villas, which was HUGE. Not sure on the exact square footage, but it was probably around 900 square feet - much larger than my last condo. The room had EVERYTHING you could want: a full kitchen with all the appliances, dishes, glasses, silverware, cutting knives, etc; a bathroom with a double-headed shower; a jacuzzi in the bedroom; a dining area; and a living area. I really enjoyed the fact that this hotel was quiet. After going to all the loud and smoky casinos, I think it would have been exhausting staying there. I didn't have the chance to use the gym or the pool on my short trip. If I come back to Vegas, I wouldn't think twice about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: JAC P
Reviews.Content: A short walk down Harmon, and we were in the middle of The Strip which extended roughly the same distance to the north and to the south. We did one day doing the south, and another doing the north. And, of course, Planet Hollywood and The Miracle Mile are just accross Harmon. Lots to do, see, shop, and eat there. We especially, enjoyed the food at P F Chang's. Were found the staff at the Chateau to be very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful, especially the at the concierge desk. The unit was well appointed (an update for a previous review: both TV's were flat-screen, LED sets). We used taxis only to get to and from the airport. Note: expect a long delay in getting a taxi at the airport. The line snakes back and forth like the most popular attractions and Disneyland! We used the free Marriott shuttle to go grocery shopping one day; another day we used the shuttle to the Fashion Mall to get to the north end of the strip, and then, worked our way back to the Grand Chateau. Ask about the free trams that can be used to hop between some of the resorts on the west side of the strip. Not only can you rest your feet, but you can avoid the crowds and hastle down on the sidewalks of The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1905
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Chateau over our kids' spring break (April 7 - 13, 2012), and we had a wonderful time. The reviews about the size of the pool being too small were right on, but knowing this going in to the reservation made it easy to handle. I look forward to the day they finish the other two towers and create a swimming pool to match the top-notch quality of the rest of the resort. The location was perfect, just off the strip, and right in the middle of everything. Right across the street was the Miracle Mile Mall, with affordable shopping, dining, and theatres. Plus, there is a stop for the Open Top Bus Tour - which we highly recommend - located right near the Mall doors. The rooms were large, clean, and comfortable. The full kitchen had everything you'd want to cook in; however, it's my vacation too, so I don't cook. LOVED the coffee, the Marketplace, and the beds. Very convenient to everything. Would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Calico610
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with friends in a 2-Bedroom/ 2-Bathroom Villa. Great service. Room was perfect for our group of 4. We enjoyed having the full kitchen to cook meals before going out. Only items that were not excellent: the pool area was too small. One day guests were all lined up on lounge beds and there was almost no room to walk. Plus no one was picking up dirty, abandoned towels so it was difficult to know if seats were available or taken. One day was so windy that the pool chairs were being blown across the floor. It would have been nice there were wind breaker walls. However these minor inconveniences did not dampen our stay at all. Overall a great stay. I have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: jordy12
Reviews.Content: Family of five stayed here for three nights & had a fantastic time. The 2 bedroom villa is spacious, clean, modern & we had strip views. The hotel is not even a five minute walk to the strip & is also quiet at night when you want to sleep. The staff are friendly & the valet parking awesome. Las Vegas was great to go shopping at the premium outlet & we saw the Cirque show Elvis at the ARIA. The villas offer king beds a dual bathtub & full kitchen & laundry with ASKO appliances. There was plenty of room for the five of us. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place.”
Reviews.Author: Therese H
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby. So easy to get to the new City center attractions. Large and well equipped kitchen. Marvelous beds. So close to everything. Just hop on the duce [double decker bus] that takes you up and down the strip and to Fremont street for a small flat fee good for on and off as many times as you want during a 24 hour period. Cheap roundtrip from and to airport. Free parking. Great concierge services to help you decide what to do!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY4092
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful. I have nothing but positive things to say about their suites. We were able to cook a St. Patty's Day dinner in their kitchen! Great size, beautifully decorated, nicely cleaned....I loved everything about this hotel. The valets quickly got us a cab when we needed to get to the airport, even at 5 in the morning. It was a pleasure to stay here and I would recommend it to anyone going to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: illinoistraveler9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because the couple we were with had points to use and got the room for free. The villa had one door in the middle that went into the kitchen/living area, then there were also doors from the hallway going into each room on either side of the living room, and doors to close off & lock the private bedrooms. So fun for 2 couples because we could all hang out & us girls could get ready together, but still had privacy when we wanted it. The main room had a hot tub in the room & nicer shower, both rooms had kitchenette. Very nice and clean, new and updated. Our bed was very hard & firm but still nice. We literally walked everywhere on the strip, just walk across the street to Planet Hollywood which is one of the best places to go anyway. Really close to Sugar Factory & Cabo Wabo & lots of restaurants in PH. We even walked all the way down to Bellagio and those hotels & back. Took a cab downtown one night was about $20 each way for that. The best part is the 24 hour shop downstairs with food and other items, danish was amazing! Also security checks cards & have to use room key to use elevator after 6PM so it felt pretty secure, not just anyone coming in. I loved it, no casino and pretty quiet, but steps away from all the nightlife. I would probably never stay in a casino hotel again after this! Pool on the roof was great, people were playing Bingo and having a good time, I think prize was free drinks. Lots of people up there laying out even on a 70 degree day & we got a great tan! Can't beat it...

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to the fun, but far enough for peace and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: MsJulicious
Reviews.Content: Make sure to enjoy the little pool area on the rooftop. The view is spectacular! Yes the pool is very little, but it's enough to plop your body into and cool off from the desert heat. It's pretty crowded, though. There's also a bar outside. Also ask the concierge about discounts. And if you have little ones, take them to do some of the activities the hotel offers. It's a very family friendly hotel. They have video games that you can play in the little rooms and lots of arts and crafts sessions. We did not have a suite, but the best part about this place was the fact that the room came with BOTH a microwave and a fridge. We stayed at MGM and it was lacking. We saved so much money eating leftovers. (Vegas is definitely not cheap.) There was only one actual bed in the room, but the couch turns into a fold out bed. I was nice and let my friend sleep on the soft cushiony bed. The fold out bed is not for light sleepers. It's not too comfy. No, there is no casino, and no restaurants or Cirque du Soleil inside. But the little marketplace thing stays open for 24 hrs. You can purchase groceries to cook your own food. The room came with actual dishes and cups and dish detergent. Lol. It was like living in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family and kids..........”
Reviews.Author: TANZANIA09Dc
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, friendly staff and family orientated. The only negative is the small pool. This hotel is not a couples retreat......I would definitely stay here agin with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, no extras”
Reviews.Author: SMSinHaslett
Reviews.Content: As an MVCI owner, I've stayed at quite a few properties. This one doesn't qualify as one of the best. The room was nice, we had a one bedroom that fit our family of four well. But there's no restaurant and the pool is a joke. Despite being on the roof, which might have added a cool factor, it's really a small kiddie pool. We ended up buying a day pass for the Planet Hollywood pool across the street to get something you can actually swim in. If you're just coming to Las Vegas to gamble, this is a good location and you won't mind the lack of amenities. If you're looking for more, I'd look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice rooms, but bring your own pillows”
Reviews.Author: RealOC
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent time...most everything was great except the pillows. For some reason they put three pillows across on a king sized bed so that the pillows were sofa sized instead of sleeping sized. I would have preferred two pillows that were sized for a king sized bed. The property had an excellent location and everyone on the staff was very nice. The apartment had everything needed, except fans in the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “On the 50 yard line!”
Reviews.Author: palacegang
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week at the Grand Chateau timeshare, during March madness and spring breaks! We had a fantastic time! We initially were placed on the 7th floor, which direclt overlooked the parking lot. We asked to switch and they gave us the same location a few floors higher. Now I don't usually do this, but since we would be there for 7 days, I really wanted a better view. So we returned to the front desk for the 3rd time. The staff were very gracious and, after checking with their manager, they gave us the 23rd floor. It was FABULOUS and worth the effort. The 50-yard-line location could not be better for us. Straight ahead, our street dead ended into the City Center, which was new to us and quite beautiful. Right across the side street from us was Planet Hollywood, their side door into the miracle mile was a great access to restaurants and shops. There was one young lady, CeeCee, on their concierge staff that was THE BEST! True to our request, she gave us great tips, for off-the-strip smaller, not so glitzy places to eat. (IE: Ellis Island - 2 blocks behind the Chateau (walkable) had great BBQ, although you have to be 21 to eat....which I still don't understand). Also - FAR less expensive prime rib meals at the Orleans (must drive to get there). We also found Fitgeralds down on Fremont had a great steak lunch that included their large salad bar for about $12; and 4 Queens (also on Fremont Street), upstairs cafe had a wonderful Hawaiian steak with rice and eggs (sounds odd, but it was really good) for about $10. We were a little worried about not being able to call ahead for your car, but the valet staff proved us wrong! We never waited more than 5-7 minutes, even with the huge crowds. By the time I would stop & talk to the concierge, the car would be delivered to my husband. They were very efficient and ready with directions. The pool on the 38th floors was nice although quite small. It was fine for hubby & I to go up in the mornings and soak in the hot tub, but as the kids showed up later in the day, it became quite crowded. It is also not deep, just 3 ft.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: uptownlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 16 - 23, 2012. I was in Tower 1 and read that this is the "renovated" rooms? I had a one bedroom and it was wonderful. Love the deep tub (no jets but fine). There is a rooftop bar with small pool and jacuzzi - did not use because a bit chilly during my stay. I'll say on hot day the max that can be in the pool is around 15 NO swimming just dipping and maybe floating if less than 8 in pool. Great view and bar staff friendly. Store in Lobby (believe it's 24hr) and you may print your boarding pass in the lobby and rooms have free wi-fi. Glad this hotel does not have a casino. Walk in through lobby and at elevator in less than 5 minutes. At night there is usually someone checking guests ID-card key. You need after 6PM to operate elevator. Always felt safe. My sister at Mirage it takes about 20 minutes or more to get through casino to elevator to room. Shuttle from airport was $7.00 and it took about 20 minutes - cab back was $15.00. There is a Shuttle that takes you to Albertson Supermarket (runs certain days last shuttle around 10 am?) then the shuttle runs down to Fashion Mall across from the Wynn the last at 6:30 PM. One evening raining and I and a few other guest were going to the LeReve show at the Wynn and the driver was kind enough to drop us directly at the Wynn. Excellent Show - no bad seat since theatre is round. Take you own snacks water is $5.00 small popcorn is $6.50. Across a Blvd you can walk directly into Miracle Mile Shops that is part of Planet Hollywood. There is an ABC shop inside to purchase inexpensive beer/wine/champagne and other snack and basic food items. There are many shops. restaurants, bars and even a theatre inside Miracle Mile Shops. You can also walk through to Las Vegas Blvd put near Paris that you can walk through to Bally. Down the street - two NY City blocks is the Harley Davis Restaurant and across the Blvd (via walkway) is City Center, Aria and Cosmopolitan. Nearby (Marketplace) is a Discount ticket seller - "Tkts 4 Half", most are generally seating but you may pay a little more for assigned? Go early if you want to see a specific show - there is another booth near MGM by the M&M store/large Coke bottle. If you are into Spas and want to have a Spa Day then I recommend Qua Spa at Ceasar's Palace. You can pay to be there for the day or if you have a treatment you can spend the day there - leave and come back. They have everything - steam, sauna, arctic room, jacuzzi, hot & cold baths, warm stone lounge, etc. Robes, slippers and lockers, snacks, drinks and all you need to get ready - toothbrush/paste, flat iron, dryer, curler and hair/body products... yes, I had a wonderful time. Look for monthly specials. Must try Wynn the next visit. Also nearby is "Kraze" that I believe have various show since the people on line varied and sometime very young people. A Walgreen is also on the corner across from Harley Davis.

Reviews.Title: “Week-end Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RLynnC
Reviews.Content: I went with 3 girlfriends, one of which used her Marriot Card to get us a great rate (not sure of the details). We had a suite with a full kitchen and a mini-suite with a microwave, mini-frig, coffee-maker. The suite had a living room with pull-out queen sofa bed that had a tempur-pedic mattress, large round glass table that seated six; huge bedroom with king bed, nice square tub and beautiful up-dated bathroom. The minisuite was equally as nice with a king bed and same sleeper sofa, and updated bathroom. The shuttle took us to the grocery store, and the mall. We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay, convenient to the casinoes, yet without the hassle of walking so far through a smoke-filled, loud casino to get to our beautiful accommodations. I hope I have the opportunity to stay there again. Thank you Marriot for a lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Marlee M
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Grand Chateau. Staff was friendly and open to help. We selected this hotel comparing other hotels on the strip and this was way more affordable when you only had to walk 200m to get there. The pool was ok (on the roof and small), but you have a great view of the strip and there's a smokers area, and I liked the Exercise room. They have a mini place to buy some things and the strip is right away to get anything you need. Bad thing? One night there were groups of people screaming and waking you up. But it was one night only (and we were on Vegas!)

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite home away from home in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Teamconcho
Reviews.Content: It is important to understand that the Marriott Grand Chateau is a vacation exchange (time share) property and not a regular hotel. It is right across the street from City Center and Planet Hollywood. There is a shuttle to grocery shopping on certain days and to areas of the Strip. The kitchen is nicely equipped and the facility is always well maintained. Warren is our favorite valet but they are all friendly and helpful. This is a busy facility, but there is rarely a wait at the front desk. Once my husband dropped his watch down the elevator shaft (don't ask) and the staff went to great lengths to retrieve it for him.. I would only advise that you not attend their timeshare presentation. It was the most aggressive, intrusive and offensive one we have ever gone to.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: MissMoorea
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a MVCI property as new MVCI owners/members. Had it been our first experience with MVCI, we would've NEVER invested in the program. The front desk staff for check-in and check-out were not helpful and rather indifferent. As new owners, we sort of expected a warm welcome (never got one) as well as an inquiry as to whether we enjoyed our stay at checkout (no one ever asked). We stayed for 4 days 3 nights and never saw housekeeping. Granted, the first day after arrival was understandable as we had the DND sign out but by day #3, our 1 BR villa really needed attention. We left our room at 10:30 am, no sign on the door, and returned by 4:30pm, only to find our villa was never cleaned. The hotel is well situated within close proximity to the Strip but so what? There's no restaurant, inflated prices in the Marketplace and customer service leaves something to be desired. There was a concerted effort, however, to engage us in attending a 90 min. on-site presentation during our short stay. Really, Marriott? You could do better than this. Not sure how all the other reviewers view this property so favorably but this was not our experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's Just Chateau! (Or shout Away)”
Reviews.Author: mccuney1
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is just right off the stirp. You are charged for everything that is normally complimentary when associated with great places to stay. The view to the other hotels are great to look at from your room. Huh! The valet's are bossy and rude. Rides to the airport are expensive and you have to wait a long time for a shuttle or a cab. No discounts with casinos, golf course or even restuarants (and for what we payed-wow). Try the Venetian and join Grazio. The Venetian is awesome from the time you enter the door to the last minute you leave. Another thing, this Marriot could learn a few things from all of its US sister hotels. I am a Marriot junkie, but not for the Chateau. We had more bad experience than I care to mention in this review.

Reviews.Title: “Qut of the mayhem!”
Reviews.Author: mbin8910
Reviews.Content: Close to the strip, out of the bedlam but close enough to quickly jump into the mix, the Grand Chateau is a nice change from a strip stay. We had the 3 bedroom apartment, although it is actually a 2 bedroom and a 1 bedroom with a common foyer. Being a vacation club property our unit had a washer - dryer, dishwasher and 2 full kitchens. It's a great family set up. The Miracle Mile shopping mall at Planet Hollywood is across the street, while city center is a block away. We were on the the 9th floor and the view was quite forgettable....obviously the higher you go the better while the 38th floor pool and bar offers a GREAT view of the Strip and surrounding city. Service was adequate, the "market" is meager and getting coffee in the morning is a challenge. While we didn't miss the casino, a restaurant or snack bar/coffee shop would be a great addition. Free valet parking. Overall a good place for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: km4life
Reviews.Content: The location is walking distance from the strip. Across the street from Cosmo, also within walking distance is fatburgers, movie theater, 24 hr. CVS and other great attractions. We stayed from March 5th thru March 9th. Amazing view of the strip from room 2617. My husband I shared this 2 bedroom suite with our friends, another couple. We had the guest room which was a nice size. The bed was extremely comfy. Which is importantant to us. I loved the mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom was a nice size. The staff was great. And I loved the complimentary valet service. Overall wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great lLocation”
Reviews.Author: imc410
Reviews.Content: Only 1/2 block off the strip , free valet ( and fast ) , still the great marriott quality. Nice and quiet however 1/2 block and ur back into the thick of Vegas energy. Harley cafe just steps away. Hard rock and kiss monster mini golf just couple blocks down Harmon. Planet hollywood just steps away. Nice friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “week in vegas”
Reviews.Author: ajmOttawa
Reviews.Content: It is hard to believe that this hotel is only a couple of walking minutes from the strip. It is so peaceful yet so close to the hustle and bustle of some of the major hotels on the strip. Across the street is the Planet Hollywood and in front is the Cosmopolitan and Belliago and to the left is the MGM. No need for a car if staying at this place although they do have free valet parking. The hotel is immaculate and has a no smoking policy except up on the penthouse bar/hot tub/pool. There is no gambling at this hotel. They cater only to your lodging. Most units have full kitchen facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Richmondcws
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Marriott Grand Chateau. The first time was for work, this time was for pleasure (bachelorette party). The location is great since it's not right on the strip, but not far off of it at all. The best view I have had of the strip is from the Sky Bar where they serve drinks in the afternoon through the evening. The suite we stayed is was awesome! Very spacious and great value. The full kitchen came in very handy being there for more than a few nights. The concierge associates were very helpful when making dinner reservations and seemed to be very knowledgeable. I would definitely stay here again when I return to Vegas :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: nalu24
Reviews.Content: perfect place to stay with your kids because it is a complete home and at a perfect place in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Clean with excellent view of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: kwhatley
Reviews.Content: Don't let the location of this place put you off. It was extremely clean, the people could not do enough to be helpful and they have a roof-top pool and bar! The pool is small but heated for the off season. The view of the strip from the roof is outstanding! Well worth the extra look!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: rumbadancers
Reviews.Content: Excellent spot to hit the hightlights of the Vegas strip! Walking distance to all you might want to see and do. All services were excellent from the valets to the front desk. The rooms were perfectly outfitted and quiet. The pool area leaves a bit to be desired, but there are plans to build 2 more towers and a new pool area. We can't wait to go back to this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “3 Bedroom Suite Misleading”
Reviews.Author: bonroxie
Reviews.Content: Went to the Grand Chateau in Vegas last weekend Feb 25th. I had reserved a 3 bedroom suite or so i was lead to believe. Very excited had a bunch of friends going. Well on arrival a 3 bedroom suite is really a 2 bedroom suite, and a 1 bedroom suite, in the same hallway but not connected. So once over the shock of not being connected. On with the good stuff, the chateau is in a great location 2 min walk from the strip, across the street from the new City Center. Location, Location, Location. I am not going to bring up the pool, been to this Marriott over 6 times and never visited the pool. The furniture and even the beds seem to be all new. Property looked great, free valet for your car. Oh and washer and dryer which is great do to the smoke in the casino's. Do not miss out on the Cosmo hotel across the street. this property is an edition property, you can use your Marriott points to stay there. Can not wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BondGirl75
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a guest in my friend's time-share and was immediately impressed. Valet was helpful and quick (don't forget to tip though as this is a free service), the lobby is spacious and check-in was a breeze. We had a spacious two bedroom suite with full kitchen/dining, 3 HDTV's, huge shower and bath which unfortunately was not a jacuzzi. The rooftop pool was impressive but it was too chilly outside to utilize. The staff was super friendly and helpful and quick to assist when we were locked out of the second bedroom. Fantastic location, mid-strip, within walking distance to everything. Only downfall.....since this was a time-share situation we were stalked by sales reps, bombarded with phone calls (at least three phone calls a day), even found literature that they slipped under the door all to discuss possible ownership. Aside from that, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Winnieberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom villa (8 of us) and it was fabulous! We stayed 3 nights to celebrate my sister in law's 40th, rocked out at Motley Crue at the Hard Rock, and experienced the Superbowl final on the Sunday. The hotel was fantastic - centrally located and within walking distance of everywhere we needed and wanted to go. Great to have kitchen facilities so we could cook breakfast in the mornings and have a few drinks before we went out at night. I would recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: v0LrAtH
Reviews.Content: The property is fabulous. The rooms are very spatious and with the typical Marriott style. It will be very recognizable for a frequent visitor. The views are great and the location is great too. You're right at the start of the Strip, but a couple 100 yards from the Strip itself, so it's actually quite calm for being right in Vegas. The absence of any gambling in the hotel makes it a great haven away from all the lights and noise which is Vegas. The only minor setback is the total absence of any restaurants in the building and the very small pool. Though there is a great buffet right next door in the Planet Hollywood hotel & casino.

Reviews.Title: “Experience the Strip without all the noise!”
Reviews.Author: 4heffdog
Reviews.Content: The Grand Chateau is the Marriott Vacation Club property off the Las Vegas Strip, and by off I mean within 100 yards of Las Vegas Blvd. The Grand Chateau was excellent. The staff was attentive, allowed us to check in early and was very helpful throughout our stay. I had read reviews before we left and DO NOT agree with any that bash the hotel or the staff. The room was clean (we stayed in a studio room), comfortable and updated. Our room did not face the Strip, but the front desk employee made sure that was alright with us. The hotel is right next to Planet Hollywood Casino, but unlike staying on the Strip the lobby was smoke-free and quiet. In Vegas you can ALWAYS find a party but you rarely can find a place that is quiet and comfortable to get away from all the action. If you are going to Vegas with your significant other or your family I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Grand Chateau.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BJSSMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip but opposite Planet h'wood, - nice and quiet but close to the action. Stayed in a high room to avoid noise & this worked. Hotel is in new condition and rooms are good, - (bed could have been a bit softer). Pool area is very small, would not want to be there on a hot day !! On-site market was fine for choice and small meals if needed. Valet a little slow but acceptable, no self parking. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: OurTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for four nights for a conference. It is right off the strip, close to Planet Hollywood and all the shops. I had a one bedroom and it was very nice. The bathtub in the master bedroom was huge. The kitchen was good sized and very adequate for my needs. The service was great. I was really impressed that they provide a number of free services. The valet parking is free and they are very efficient, the newspaper is free, the gym is free and is a really nice gym for a hotel. They don't have a casino and the entire place is non-smoking. The negatives: The pool is on the roof and is quite small for this size property, as is the hot tub. The curtains in the bedroom let in lots of light. Don't they know people go to Vegas to stay out late?

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cujo31
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one-bedroom suite for several nights this week and was very happy with my experience. The hotel is part of the Marriott timeshare properties so is quite large but does not have some of the more traditional hotel features, like a restaurant. There are probably 100 restaurants within a short walk from the hotel. The apartments come with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, soaking tub and separate shower and flat screen tv in the bedroom and living area. The hotel is located one block off the strip and I found it very pleasantly quiet. The staff was helpful. As this is part of the timeshare you do not get a traditional hotel cleaning experience every day but they will freshen your room if you so desire. I did not find that even necessary really. There is a small gym (5th floor) and a small pool on the roof with a bar. This location does not offer the Marriott Rewards "premiums" for elite members - none of the timeshare locations do - but you do get your points. With the rates they charge I would me more than happy to skip and upgrade! All the things that make the Vegas strip attractive (or unattractive) are just steps away. Planet Hollywood Casino and Hotel is across the street. Within one block you will find a 24 hour Walgreens that sells everything you can think of from a drug store including a small selection of fresh food. There is a small shopping mall across the street called the Miracle Mile (part of the Planet Hollywood complex) with several restaurants and shops. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants more than a simple hotel room and a nice quiet stay in the middle of the madness that is Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Camaro485
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a friend's timeshare here and it was excellent. The unit came with 2 adjoining rooms, one full kitchen, one luxury double-head shower, one standard shower, one tub in the bedroom (though being oversized enough to fit 2-4 comfortably, it was not a Jacuzzi, probably the only disappointment), 3 HDTVs, and plenty of space. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the valet service is free (so don't forget to tip generously), and they even had a store on-site in case you forgot something (which we did use for Zip-Loc bags, though overpriced the convenience was appreciated). Roof top pool was enjoyable as well, though we did not stop at the roof top bar, which is only open 2pm-4pm. It was walking distance to almost everywhere we went as well, so extremely convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: JeanPierreKim
Reviews.Content: A very good location, just off the main Strip, a few strides from the Bellagio and Planet Hollywood (you can see them from the hotel window). There are no casino or slots onsite which makes it a nice oasis in Vegas. There are also no restaurants as this is a self catering property Valet parking is free, and quick enough, with helpful staff, though if you only need to visit the main Strip you probably won't need a car. They even supply a driving map for the local supermarket, and have a courtesy bus that goes there (but not often). Stayed in the one bedroom as there were three of us, and one was a 90 year old relative who needed their own space, so it worked out perfectly. Spacious, very comfortable and with all the self contained amenities you need - from washing machine with dryer, to dishwasher, very efficient oven and pretty much all the utensils and crockery. Two free packets of coffee with the filters, so good to go. And of course free wifi A few grumbles - the walls are on the thin side so weekends can be a bit noisy. The towels were a little bit less plush than what we expected from a Marriott, and a few front desk staff who were big on "HI, HOW ARE YOUuuuuu" and smaller on actually being helpful. But check in and check out is seamless. Just what you need in Vegas. Note to those who rent cars. The car rental companies have a policy of pre-charging you for a full tank and asking you to drop it off empty. Unless you plan to do some travelling outside of Vegas you'll end up paying for at least half a tank of petrol after a week. So if you can opt out of this and do your own filling you save some money..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort - Close to the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: RedroverOttawa10
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Chateau resort is located approximately a block from the Las Vegas Strip and although it does not have an on-site casino, it is directly across from the Miracle Mile casino/shopping complex owned by Planet Hollywood and offers every type of dining /shopping one could hope for. The Grand Chateau does have an on-site mini-market for last minute grocery/snack/toiletry supplies and a roof-top pool with bar on the 38th floor; however, there is no on-site restaurant, which for us was not a problem, given the proximity to the Strip. Our two-bedroom, two bathroom suite was perfect for two couples vacationing together and included everything required to prepare snacks and meals; however, we opted to eat most meals out. If you are looking for something completely different, then Vegas is the place for you and the Marriott Grand Chateau is the perfect place to unwind when you have had enough of the hectic pace in Sin City.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott luxury on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: keystonekop
Reviews.Content: Well actually it is a short block east of the Las Vegas strip right across the street from Planet Hollywood. We have stayed in Marriott hotels all over the country and this one was by far the nicest we've stayed in yet. We used Marriott points and stayed in a one-bedroom villa. The villa was equipped with everything you would need for a comfortable stay, including washer & dryer. The bathroom had a dual shower and a large jacuzzi tub as well as dual vanities. The bedroom was luxurious and the bed was huge and very comfortable. The living area included a 42-in TV with DVD player and two very comfortable chairs in addition to a large and unusually comfortable sleeper sofa. Several of the best Las Vegas casinos are within walking distance (MGM, NY-NY, Monte Carlo) and the bus stop and monorail are both nearby. The cost (in Marriott points) was no more than any other Marriott hotel in the area (we did pay a 5000 pt premium for the upgrade to the 1BR villa). The exercise room was well-equipped and convenient, the rooftop pool is heated, and the view from the rooftop bar at night is nice. As always the hotel staff were courteous and helpful. As a comparison we also stayed a few nights at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club on the strip (at Sahara Blvd) it was nice but the Marriott was just that little bit nicer. We did get a great deal with Hilton but that's because they were trying to sell is a time share. If we travel to Las Vegas again we will definitely stay at the top-notch Marriott Grand Chateau again. Well done JW!

Reviews.Title: “Huge 2 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: jaynic
Reviews.Content: Our 2 bedroom suite was the largest accomodation we had during our month in America. One bedroom had 2 double beds and bathroom, the main had a king and massive bathroom with square bath and double shower. The kitchen was a good size and well equipped and a 6 seter dining table meant we could all be seated. Washing machine and dryer were handy. We were on the 10th floor and could hear some noise but Las Vegas would never be quiet. We only stayed 3 nights but the apartment would have been comfortable to spend a week at. There were activities on for kids, like art and craft, which would be good if you were looking for things to do. The location was in the middle of The Strip and whenever we needed the car, the valet got it quickly. If i was coming back to Las Vegas I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott visit”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in late January, and I have to say I'm very glad we picked this place. We arrived at the hotel, and at first it was a little hard to find, just because it is tucked between some really tall buildings. Then when you see it, you find yourself saying "how did I miss that". It's a huge building, and located between the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood about 1 block east of the strip. This location is truly ideal, and though it is slightly off the strip, you will probably end up walking less here than a place on the strip. For instance I also stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and Aria, and had to walk much less to get to where I was going at the Marriott simply because I didn't have to walk through a huge casino and navigate around the cars pulling into the mega hotels. Check-in was a breeze, even at 9:30 in the morning. We pulled up and were in our room in about 5 minutes. It was a very smooth process. Parking was also really nice, and offered another advantage over the mega casino resorts. Valet at the Marriott ran less than 5 minutes consistently, however at the Aria it was over 20 minutes, not to mention it was farther to the Aria valet from our room at the Aria than from our Marriott room to the bus stop on the strip. The rooms are also really nice. We had a 1 bedroom which had a full kitchen, washer and dryer (small apartment size), and very nice washroom. The kitchen is a nice touch, and if you don't mind cooking you can really save yourself some serious money in food. I must mention the negative of small t.v.'s. This is a running theme at all of their resorts, and for the small price I just can't figure out why their rooms do not offer a large screen t.v. The staff was very nice and helpful as well. There was one valet and one market employee whom I found less than chipper, but for the most part they were all great. I will say this place has a different vibe than the Mega Casino resorts. It does not have the wild, hip feel of the Aria, Mandalay Bay, etc. This was just find for us. No drunk or loud people at the resort offered a nice break from the activity of the strip. I really enjoyed my trip to Vegas, and the time I spent at the Marriott. I very much look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay On the Strip”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: We love this place, everyone would agree it looks as good as the day they built it "NEW". We stay every year with a group and have never have had a bad room or anything negative to say about this property. Non smoking, right next to Planet Hollywood, it's a great break from vegas but you are still on the strip. Even smokers would agree a non smoking hotel is a plus. You can walk anywhere on the strip, no need for a car. They also have a shuttle that takes you to the store and the other end of the strip. Valet parking no charge if you have a car. Great view from the rooftop bar and pool makes this one of our favorites in all of Vegas. Keep in mind this is more of a hotel not a 5 star resort, no room service. Front desk staff is always helpful and positive! We did miss the steam room not working in the work out room, hope thats fixed for our trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Grand Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Thombtc
Reviews.Content: My stepson's wedding was in Las Vegas on January 22nd and we stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau for 4 nights. We didn't use our International Interval Getaway but had to pay outright because we couldn't get a Getaway for the 2 bedroom villa ( one king bedroom on each side of the living/ kitchen area with own bath) that we needed in that particular week. It hurt to have to pay $1000 instead of the Getaway price. WE are very glad that we stayed in this hotel because we did not have to pay a resort fee ( as many hotels in Vegas are charging that fee now) and the location was very good for walking to major hotels on the strip. The Mile Mall Shops and restaurants were right across the street. THe beds were very comfy, the kitchen was spotless, and the noise level wasn't bad at all, considering that we were facing the airport side and occasionally heard a jet take off, even on the 24th floor. If we ever stayed there again, I would opt for the Planet Hollywood side of the hotel. The roof swimming area was okay, but small, and of course it was a little chilly to swim, but they did have those big heater stands up there. The pool was suppose to be heated, but we didn't feel it. However, we did enjoy the view from up there and we all sat at the bar for a terrific pina colada and some beers. The Bartender, (Nice, was her name,) was very informative and enjoyable. There is a shuttle from the hotel to the Fashion Show Mall most days and from Sat-Tuesday there is a shuttle to the grocery store because you have a full kitchen in many units . WE just gave the driver a small tip. Taxis are expensive in Vegas, so opt for the cheap bus that runs on the strip anytime you can. THe only complaint was the bell desk was not as helpful as they could have been for my stepson and future wife. THey had many bags and no one offered from the Bell Desk to help them. THey had to grab their own luggage dollie, load it, and push it up the room. THe Bell Desk just gave them a look and said"Be sure to bring that right back!" When they complained later to the management, they apologized and gave a $50 credit to the room to spend in the market near the lobby. THat was nice. My husband and I had no problem and they immediately brought our luggage up when our room was ready after a short wait. THey actually let us in the room long before official check-in time. Everyone else was terrific during our stay. THe timeshare people didn't hound us and just called once to offer a 90 minute program, but since we were already in Int. Interval, maybe they backed off a little. That was fine with us. Housekeeping service was good and no complaints. Towels were replenished each day as needed, garbage emptied, and kitchen was straightened up. I'm sure if you want a noisier hotel, this isn't the place for you, but we enjoyed the quiet after being out in the hustle and bustle after returning to our "home away". Don't forget that we were paying outright for the room and maybe timeshare guests wouldn't get that same service each day. Check that out as I'm not sure.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay! Just off the strip, clean, free shuttles...”
Reviews.Author: Kristen N
Reviews.Content: 3 of my friends and I stayed in a 2 bedroom villa here for a week and had an amazing time! Our room was gorgeous, one of the nicest places I have stayed in! Not one of the casino hotels with a bunch of shops or nightclubs inside, but plenty of other benefits. It's like a breath of fresh air when you need a break from all the chaos, but only a hop skip and jump away from it. The location is excellent, in walking distance to Planet Hollywood, the Bellagio, the Paris hotel, etc etc. This hotel also offers a convenient shuttle to the grocery store and the amazing Fashion Show mall. I would definitely recommend this if you're looking for a resort-type stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott members and always stayed at Marriott. We come to Vegas just about 2 times a year. For the last 2 times we arrived before 4 pm check in time, they made us wait almost 3 hours when before we could check in right away. I don't know if it is because the hotel has become more poplar or not? As a gold member, it is quite disappointing that we were treated no different than other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: DBOUCH
Reviews.Content: So pleasantly surprised. Sometimes you don't know what a timeshare trade will present you. This hotel is terrific. Just a short block from the strip near Planet Hollywood. The 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite was just beautiful. just redone, and more than we expected. I just can't say enough good things about it. The views from our room in all rooms were wonderful. The staff all very pleasant and helpful.Went to Albertsons grocery store on arrival. They have everything you would need to stock your kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location near City Center...large one bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: SusieJue
Reviews.Content: Always love a three day weekend in Vegas...so much to do and the shopping is incredible. Since I am a points and miles junkie, I wanted to use points for my stay and was able to get a one bedroom unit at Marriott timeshare property, Grand Chateau. Airport shuttle is $7.00 each way to strip hotels. Although the decor is not really my style, I had a wonderful stay for one night. I was not able to book a Saturday night here during this trip and stayed at Las Vegas Marriott. It was 25,000 points for one night at both properties. The location is perfect and in the heart of Vegas. It's a relatively short one block to City Center. It is just off the strip across from Planet Hollywood. The valet only parking is free. They provide a shuttle to Fashion Mall and Monday morning at 9 am they have a welcome morning session for overview of activities. The check in was speedy and the service was friendly. The bell person was very helpful and helped show me how to use the DVD player and theromstat, washer/dryer. The one bedroom unit 2021 had a gorgeous strip view of City Center. Consists of full kitchen with refrigerator with ice maker, stove, microwave, oven, toaster, blender, coffee maker and fully equipped with dishes, pots/pans and even measuring cups! The living area had TV, DVD (can check out DVDs at the front desk), sound system and dining table for 4. The bedroom had a tub for two and adjacent bathroom had shower with dual sinks. Comfy bed with TV. No robe and minimal toiletries. There is an in room washer and dryer. Free Wifi in the room. No casino or restaurant at this property. The pool is on the 38th floor, which you have to take two elevators to get to. The Sky Bar and whirlpool is also here. The fitness center is on the fifth floor and 24 hours. Board pass kiosk by the Bell Desk in the lobby and Concierge Desk in the lobby. MAZE for kids is also off the lobby. Got a late check out at 12 noon, where as normal is 10 am. There is an owners lounge, where you can hang out at after check out, which I think was an after thought. It has computers that you have to swipe credit card, TV, lounge furniture and book library. The Marketplace "store" for light groceries is open 24 hours and next to the reception. The lobby is very spacious and quite beautiful. ATM in the lobby and Walgreens near by for anything you may need. I walked to the City Center and you have to cross the street to the Planet Hollywood and cross the strip on the overhead pedestrian walkway. I enjoyed my stay and liked having the large one bedroom with kitchen. The view was gorgeous and felt like it was definitely worth the 25,000 points. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: dshires
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, clean, very nice staff in the Kid's Activity room. We really should have taken more advantage of all the crafts and activities available for our 8 and 2 year old. There's a shuttle to Albertson's 3 mornings a week to stock your refrigerator, and one block away from the strip was close enough for us. The mini-mart in the lobby was a little pricey, but we had plenty to do and see with the kids. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “High standard and value”
Reviews.Author: VICTEETH
Reviews.Content: Why stay at a "conventional " Las Vegas hotel/motel when you are staying for more than a couple of days. Stay at the Grand Chateau that is about 200 metres from the strip and is quiet and full featured. Kitchen, laundry, multiple TV's,free internet, on site mini-mart. Clean, well maintained, great staff,and a feeling of exclusivity without exorbitant cost. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Right off the strip with a Kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Oinkeater
Reviews.Content: I recently booked and stayed in a two bedroom suite, (which are actually two separate rooms connected trough a lockable door) and had an extremely enjoyable experience. This hotel is a block off the strip, and has access to the miracle mile shopping center across the street. The hotel does not have a casino inside and is smoke free, which was a plus as it can be hard to find smoke free areas in Las Vegas. This set up would be great for groups. Additionally, the hotel offers AAA rates and the roof top pool bar has a great happy hour & views of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pitiful POOL- Dont waste your Time”
Reviews.Author: april c
Reviews.Content: The Roof Top pool is an insult to the share holders. We brought into the Marriott for its name and we are Highly Disappointed with the Tiney Tiny pool on the Roof Top. this is Las Vegas where it get to be in the 100's clearly all of the tenants cannot use the pool accomodations. I really hope they are planning to build a REAL POOL in the NEAR FUTURE!

Reviews.Title: “Family-friendly hotel right in the centre of the action!!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca-DM
Reviews.Content: As often happens, I am writing this review from my room at Marriott Grand Chateu. Only 2 days left and I already miss this place!! We booked one week here using Interval International website (timeshare) and we got a really big deal for a one-bedroom suite, with kitchen. My husband, three-year old son and I love this place. First, the location. The Marriott is right in the centre of the action, just steps from the Bellagio, Paris, New York New York, MGM Grand, Miracle Mile Shopping Malls and Planet Hollywood - we really couldn't ask more! Unfortunatly, our room is not facing the street - but I guess that from high-floor rooms on the other side the panorama must be breathtaking. Second, the services. There is free valet parking, so you should not worry about finding a parking place - and anytime you want your car back, Marriott staff brings it back to you in few seconds. Then, internet is included and it works perfectly. Marriott associates are outstanding as always. I must mention Dennis from the loss prevention. Our son felt sick during our stay and Dennis really made his best to (succesfully!) help us. Third, the apartment. It is wide and new and beautiful, the kitchen is great, the furniture so elegant, the bed is simply awasome, and so the jacuzzi tub and the extra large shower that can accomodate four people at least! This is anyway not the typical Vegas hotel since it has no casino, no smoke, no music, it has no restaurants beside a "al fresco" bar with a nice view on the 37th floor. But we were glad this hotel is so family-friendly, that is exactly what we were looking for. So, I would for sure recommend this Marriott, better for family and longer stays (like 3+ days). For a shorter stay and other purposes (like gambling and clubbing) I would suggest a Vegas style lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: MATTNottinghamUK
Reviews.Content: I booked direct with Marriott on their website, I think I paid around $130 a night for a one bedroom suite. This came with a full kitchen, shower room, sofa bed, dining room table and chairs, King sized bed and on suite bath in the bedroom. It was great to walk back from the strip to a nice quiet room. We found the swimming pool on the top floor to be adequate, there was never more than half a dozen people in the pool at any one time. The grocery store in the lobby was excellent, OK prices were a little more than supermarkets elsewhere but from a British point of view still cheap. Would stay again if I ever went back to Las Vegas...thats a big if though....

Reviews.Title: “Best place for families traveling”
Reviews.Author: kayleighsmom
Reviews.Content: We've been coming here for 6 years now as we own a timeshare. In the beginning it was tough as there was a lot of construction going on but now that things are in place, we love it here. We have brought many guests and they love it just as much as us. There is something for everyone including the kids. It is a no-smoking facility and there is no casino on-site so it is very quiet and set back one block from the Strip. However, it is right across the street from Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile so you are right near the action of Vegas. We cannot say enough about the Marriott Grand Chateau.

Reviews.Title: “Get off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Nils62
Reviews.Content: I agree with the many reviewers who found this luxury property to be a nice quiet oasis just off the hectic, crazy Las Vegas Strip. There are no slot machines ringing in your ear and the lobby has a nice touch of hushed elegance about it. The rooms are really nice and our suite had a very comfortable bed as well as a nice kitchen. One could easily live here for a week and enjoy everything Vegas has to offer without the burnout factor. It has a great pool and a super gym. Now if they only had a restaurant so you wouldn't have to leave the property for a meal if you didn't want to.

Reviews.Title: “great for family”
Reviews.Author: T.B.Patriot
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3day trip to Las Vegas over Christmas with the extended family. We got a 3 bedroom, 3 bath suite with full kitchen and it was excellent. Free wi-fi was great as well. The place is really close to the strip, very much of walking distance. If you are going to Las Vegas to gamble, I am not sure whether this is the place as it does not have a casino but if you are going with a large family and need more room and somewhat feel at home, then this is your perfect place. we had a wonderful time and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Doc and Teach return again”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: This was our 3d return to this Marriott. We had a lock off unit 1806 with a view the street and part of Planet Hollywood. We like this Timeshare. I like the shuttle to the grocery store and Fashion Show Mall. The mini store in the lobby has a little bit of every thing The December decorations are tasteful for the season. Everyone is friendly and says welcome back, that is cute. We have been to several Mariott Timeshares, this one in Las Vegas is the friendly. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Some Grand Touches”
Reviews.Author: TravelTea
Reviews.Content: This Marriott Grand Chateau is lacking some grand touches that could match its namesake. The not so grand: - no restaurant (casual or elegant) - confusing (driving) signs to direct you the hotel entrance when arriving @ night - cheap & not enough toiletries for a suite - cheap (non-fluffy) towels - no coffee-maker in studio suite - lobby/front desk could use a maker-over The grand: - no casino= no smoking - quiet & convenient (1 block from the strip; kitty-corner behind PH mall) - comfy, firm beds w/ great down pillows & comforter - well stocked kitchen (in 1 bedroom suite) - professional, efficient, friendly staff (valet, front desk, housekeeping) If you need the space (more room/bedrooms, kitchen), this place fits the bill. Easy & safe walk to strip. Grand Chateau is a mis-nomer; was expecting old world elegance (like Venetian/Bellagio).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gyet
Reviews.Content: We came here for a week of Las Vegas and Grand Canyon. It is a very pleasant surprise to see the quality of the hotel amenities, the space of the room and practical layout of the room. The hotel is very nicely located to the new strip. Everything is just walking distance. We enjoyed great service from the hotel employees. The bed was incredibly comfortable after long hours of walking around in Las Vegas. We felt like we are at home and enjoyed the stay very much. We will definitely consider Marriott Vacation Club for our future vacations. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “So quiet, so nice!”
Reviews.Author: hugs4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at a recent weekend get-away to Las Vegas and could not have been happier with our choice. The hotel, which is also a part of the Interval International collection of timeshares, sits just off the strip across the street from the new City Center and adjacent to Planet Hollywood. In fact, our 1-bedroom condo overlooked the strip, beautiful view! In addition to this being just a beautiful hotel, one good thing is that it is quiet, a tiny bit away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but still close enough that a 2 minute walk up Harmon to the strip and you're back in the middle of the Vegas madness. The pluses are the posh accommodations, the nearby Planet Hollywood for restaurants, a casino, and shopping at the Miracle Mile. The minuses, no restaurants within the hotel itself. That's it..really, that is the only downside. As mentioned, casinos, restaurants are just short walk away. There is a 24-hour convenience store in the lobby for essentials. The Miracle Mile store across the street has an ABC convenience store which is just a tiny bit less expensive, and the hotel provides a shuttle daily to a local grocery store. If this is your first time to Vegas, you may wish to stay in a main, Strip hotel. If you are a more relaxed traveler who doesn't need constant Vegas stimulation, I HIGHLY recommend the Grand Chateau.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Admiralkittlemeyer
Reviews.Content: Had large 2 bedroom suite very good value at convention time No casino or restaurant. Small bar on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Close yet so far away”
Reviews.Author: Konatotheworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcome relief to the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. Pros: It is a non smoking hotel and does not have a casino so after a day of wandering through the Strip, it's nice to come "home" to some peace and quiet. The bed was comfortable and it's nice to have the access to a kitchen/kitchenette. We could have a leisurely morning with coffee, the newspaper that arrives at your door every morning, and a muffin before heading out. It's a half block from the strip and right across from the Miracle Mile Shops. Great location in heart of the strip. There is no restaurant in the hotel but Miracle Mile has a plethora of restaurants right across the street. There is a 24 hr mini mart at the hotel for a quick bite that you can fix in your units kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Barely Off The Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: annkr
Reviews.Content: For us this was a perfect choice for a week in Las Vegas. Just a short walk to the strip, cutting through thre Miracle Mile Mall made it even easier and we could end up up across the street from the Bellagio (my favorite) in ten minutes! We are not wild about all the smoke in the casinos, so it was great to return to a smoke free hotel. We had a one bedroom with full kitchen, Tower 2, 27th floor view toward the airport, which actually turned out to be rather nice. View from the rooftop pool/bar was great, and since we didn't plan on swimming, (sunny, but very cool in December) the small pool was not an issue. Valet parking was quite convenient for trips outside of the strip, and there is no charge for Marriott owners from other locations as exchangers or on II Getaways. We were impressed with the staff, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to do Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BradCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an I.I. Getaway in a 1-bedroom unit, and was assigned a strip-view room with a beautiful view of City Center and the Cosmopolitan. We were a bit concerned about whether we'd really get the "Vegas vibe" staying at this resort, given that it's a bit removed from the Strip and not a casino/hotel. Our concerns were completely unfounded. It's a very easy walk to the Strip, even in the December chill. You can either cross the street to the Planet Hollywood mall right outside the front door, or it's an easy half-block walk to the Strip up Harmon Ave. And honestly, it's nice to have an escape from the Vegas crowd at times. We really enjoyed retreating to the quiet of the Marriott Grand Chateau after a busy day in Vegas. It's so nice to have the extra space compared to a regular hotel room. Our room was very well-equipped with plenty of dish soap, dishwasher detergent, and laundry soap. Because we were on a weekly stay, we did not get housekeeping, but we did get a change of towels mid-week at no charge. The free wi-fi worked very well (other than having to log in once per day with a password). The double shower-head in the bath was a surprise. It's really nice, whether you're showering alone or with a special friend. The double-tub in the bedroom was also nice for relaxing, even though it was not a jacuzzi tub. The bed was typical Marriott comfort (very good, although not quite up to the Westin standard, which is my favorite). Lots of TV channels were available (including several HBO channels) on the two flat-screen TVs. No self-parking is available, but the valets were always very friendly and fast. I'm not sure we ever passed a hotel employee during the week without getting a smile and a friendly greeting. I went into this trip with concerns about whether we'd enjoy this resort, and came away with a new favorite place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great value”
Reviews.Author: 8kobe24
Reviews.Content: 1st time staying in a timeshare in Vegas and while I only used 4 nites of the week it ws still far cheaper than staying in a hotel insame location. Marriott is as stated a 1 minute walk 2 Planet Hollywood, thus a prime location on the strip. Full kitchen which saves tons of $ to b used on gambling or shows. I got the jacuzzi tub 1 bedroom; awesome! Decor a big outdated but still clean. Downside is valet only although its free aside from tipping & the valet guys were great.
