And, windows don't open, dnt even crack so the room ws stuffy even when it ws a mere 42 degrees outside and it wsnt fun having 2 use air conditioning. But, I will definately stay here again. Oh yeah, free wi-fi, helpful staff, washer / dryer in rooms & plenty of free amentities inc all necessary kitchen supplies.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: bitterntraveller
Reviews.Content: wonderful rooms, cleaned daily, Terrific beds, shower wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: djohns
Reviews.Content: Exchanged with II for a huge 3 bedroom/3 bath/2 kitchen (2,000 sq ft) at this Marriott 12/9 - 16. Check in & out was very quick. Overall, everything was nice, fairly clean and location was great -- nothing super spectacular. Some of the furnishings were looking a little worn and the maids left some soap scum in the shower (sorry, I'm a clean freak and don't like any scum), but basically still nice. Expected the bedding would be of a higher quality, but just comfortable. Master bath did have a 2 person tub with view of the strip, but no whirlpool/jets. Master also had a large seperate shower with dual shower heads. Other 2 baths were standard tub/shower set ups. Too cold for swimming, but did visit the roof top pool area. It was small and can't imagine how packed it would be during the warm season. Didn't do any cooking, but kitchens seemed to be stocked with the essentials. Had trouble using the washer/dryer. We had 2 set ups and I couldn't get either one to dry clothes. Packed light thinking it would be easy to wash clothes properly. Never reported the problem until the last day. Staff was helpful so I'm sure they would have corrected the problem. They do ask you to attend a timeshare presentation, but they're not pushy about it -- a simple no thanks ends it. They took the time to e-mail me in advance to ask if we had any special needs or were celebrating a special occassion. I told them we were there to celebrate my big '50' birthday. Don't know why they bothered asking if they weren't going to do anything (thought they would at least slip a generic birthday card under the door). Unfortunately, the only thing they did for my b-day was to send a maintenance guy to my door at 9 a.m. to fix a clogged toilet that didn't exist -- so much for the do not disturb signs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - quiet, secure and no smoking”
Reviews.Author: BarbGrae
Reviews.Content: One of the best establishments, (and not the dearest), we've stayed in during our 2 months during the great USA. We loved this hotel. Exceeded expectations for a 4 night stay in Las Vegas. We paid $116/n weekdays and $155/n weekend - including tax. Considering what we received we thought this was exceptional value. It was so nice and quiet for sleeping - because it's a couple of 100metres off the strip. It was secure with only hotel guests coming and going. Room card required for the lifts after 6pm. In room safe which we could fit our laptop into. The hotel is modern, has a very pleasant, large lobby and absolutely no smoking. The lifts were fast - we were on the 22nd floor - a relatively high floor as requested. We had a nice view of the hills as well as a partial view of the strip. The pool area looked nice but was too cold for us to hang out there this time of year. Good views though. We had a studio room with kitchenette. The room was spotless and the amenities excellent. Bed was fantastic. The kitchette had proper cutlery, glasses, crockery, toaster, microwave, decent coffee maker. Complimentary coffee provided to get us through the first morning. The bathroom was huge. Everything was clean. Daily paper was delivered to the door. Check in and out was friendly and professional. We asked for the possiblity for extended check-out and were given one once they had double checked the arrivals for that day. Nothing was too much trouble - we were very impressed by the front desk staff. By the way, there is a small 24hr shop in the lobby which has quite a good selection of items. We did a price check because we were self catering but couldn't bring food with us - shopped at Albertsons, which is a bus ride away. Out of interest bread and milk was only about 50c difference in price to Albertson. Even though fruit, cheese, ham, cereal and other items are way more expensive on The Strip than Albertsons. The Marriott market right in the lobby wasn't much more expensive than CVS or Walgreens down the strip for the items we checked. The days we were there the shuttle to some other grocery store wasn't happening - so can't comment on that. Absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel especially if you value non-smoking, quietness, cleanliness and security.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever stayed in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Having a kitchen saved us so much money on food! Our room (2 bedroom suite) was huge and clean. It was very easy to walk to the strip, we were much closer than I even imagined and, on cold night, we just cut through Planet Hollywood - easy! It was never more than a $20 cab ride to get anywhere, even as far as the Palms. It cost us like $200 each for 5 nights. I can't believe the value! Minor annoyances to prepare for: (1) There is no detergent to do laundry, so you have to go buy some. We had already been food shopping before going to the hotel, so we wish we had known this ahead of time! They do provide dish & dish washer soap, why not laundry? (2) I forgot my toothbrush. Unlike other Marriotts that just give you a cheap spare, they made me buy an overpriced one in the gift soap. There was also no conditioner in the bathroom, which isn't an issue for me because I bring my own, but you were thinking there would be some, just a heads-up... (3) We had a bunch of extra towels at check-in then the cleaning staff took them all away and never replaced them. We called down for extra towels/face clothes twice because of this. It just seemed really weird. There were only 4 of us, we should not have run out of towels daily...

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ron F
Reviews.Content: Had a suite with kitchen over thanksgiving weekend and it was nice. Only one block from the strip and across the street from planet hollywood and miracle mile mall with lots of eating and shops. Free wifi. Free parking but it is valet parked. 10am checkout unless you can score extended checkout. The result is a 10-20 minute queue for vehicles between 9 and 10

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Tenniscourtman
Reviews.Content: Check in was not a good experience. Two bedroom suite just ok.. No place to put luggage except on floor...Room is clean, but will not stay here again. Dry air blows from the bedroom heater, like a defroster in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RACEFAN4888
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week (Nov. 25 - Dec 2) here as it was very central to the strip. Walking distance to some of the major casinos and a short $8 - 10 dollar taxi ride to others. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite.The hotel is first class,great rooms,very clean,excellent full kitchen facilities,comfortable beds,polite and obliging staff everywhere.Valet parking was excellent. We were there primarily to sight see and take in shows. Gambling was not a priority and we enjoyed not having to run a gauntlet of slots to reach our room.The only negatives were the pool size was a little small and the washer and dryer in the unit were noisier than the jets at the airport. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Boat-Captain
Reviews.Content: This property is ideally located close to City Center, Planet Hollywood Casino and Miracle Mile Shopping. Additionally there are several bus stops close by allowing you to travel up and down the strip or to Fremont St. The Grand Chateau is not a typical Marriott hotel. It's a timeshare property that will rent out unused days or weeks. So, accommodations are more like a small condo unit rather than a hotel room. There is no restaurant on site, but many nearby, and with many units having a kitchen or kitchenette you have the option of eating in your unit. Marriott offers a free shuttle to a grocery store so you can stock up what you need for meals or snacks that you would like to have. There is a small marketplace on the property. Tower 1 (north) was recently updated with new furnishings, as was the lobby area. The sleeping rooms are large and clean. If you would like daily maid service, however, you will have to pay an additional fee. The pool is on the roof of tower 1. It's a small pool, but the rooftop serves as a great place to relax and watch the sun set. This a great property for longer stays, but will work well for a couple of nights. You'll like the location and the ease of front door to room compared to the time it would take to go from front door to room at a large casino-hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location, great for couples”
Reviews.Author: ladyrae14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Chateau for a week this past October. It was great. Perfect location right next to Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops. Very short walk (1/2 block) from the strip. If you went left, you could go to the MGM end of the strip and a right took you right over to Bellagio etc. Everything was really a quick walk. I wasnt too sure at first about staying in a time share and a non casino hotel, but I am glad we did. Those morning trips for coffee or a late night snack can end up costing you $50 a pop when you are staying in a hotel with a casino. There was a little shop in the lobby with all the necessities including starbucks make your own coffee. There is a kitchen in the room which you can make your own food if you so choose. This was great for us because we would have bagels or something in the morning and it was also so easy to make drinks before we went out. We stayed with 4 couples total so we had 2 time shares. Each had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a common dining room, living room and kitchen with washer and dryer. It was great to have such a large common area for everyone to hang out before going out. We even had appetizers one night. I would definitely recommend this place when trying to be on a budget and for those traveling with other couples. Loved the rooftop bar and pool. What a view. Overall, a really great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Vegas for family”
Reviews.Author: hidden293995
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for almost a week with my family. The rooms are spacious, clean and have all what you need. The staff is very friendly like all hotels in this wonderful city. It is very neat and comfortable for family. No night club or slot machines in the lobby. Just right place for family. The only comment I have is the swimming pool, it is very small and crowded since it is the only attraction in this hotel. It is considered terrible when compared to the quality of this hotel. In addition no restaurant in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: akajade1908
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location of this hotel. Right across the street from the Mall and close to the center of the strip so either way you want to travel, it was good. The hotel provided you with transportation to Fashion Show Mall as well if you would like that service. The rooms are nice and spacious, but I did not have the WOW effect. The walls were thin. I could hear my neighbor getting up every morning at 7am, so that was a disappointment for me. But overall, this was a good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful retreat from the craziness”
Reviews.Author: sunnyCA21
Reviews.Content: The Grand Chateau is a time share property operated by Marriott. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and allow two people to "pretend" they have a Las Vegas apartment. Even though our living room looked out over the airport, and not The Strip, we didn't mind because the mountains in the background and the lovely sunrises made up for it. The full sized bath had a 5 foot shower with two heads, plus there is a second vanity, with stool, in the bedroom, which also had a double sized tub. (Too bad it wasn't a Jacuzzi)! And, as always, Marriott provide wonderfully comfortable beds! This is a fabulous place if you want to get "away" from the crowds, but be only a block away it. A washer and dryer in the unit allowed us to clean up after several days of traveling. The criticisms: valet parking only, which meant LOOOONG waits at check out time or in the evening; coffee packets for the room are not provided after the first morning; tiny, tiny, tiny rooftop pool, so not a place for teenagers who want to enjoy the sun, and the tiny rooftop bar closes ar 7-7:30 PM. On the other hand, great bars and restaurants are only a few blocks away. If you want fabulous prime rib, go to The Palm at Caesar's Palace. Split a salad, split the 28 oz. prime rib and you'll still have lots to bring home for the next days snack. PJ Clarkes, also in Caesar's Palace has a $1.00 oyster happy hour from 3-6 PM.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bcmom_7
Reviews.Content: The Grand Chateau is a fair place to stay if all you're looking for is a clean room with decent furnishings. There isn't really any concierge service even though they do have one...they are not very helpful, except to pass out brochures. The room that we stayed in, a 2 bedroom suite, was your typical Marriot room. It was clean but unfortunately quite noisy with the thin walls. We had an American Idol wanna be next door who belted out odd tunes at 10-11pm at night, along with little kids that screamed till 12 and got up bright and early at 7am...they did quiet down when my husband thumped the wall. Luckily, they left a couple days after our arrival. It's a fine place to stay if all you want is a clean room to stay in, its just not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet place in sweet spot of strip”
Reviews.Author: eokauai
Reviews.Content: I have two young children so it was great they didn't have a casino or bar in the lobby. Nice and quiet in the villa. Newer construction, the villas were well designed and huge. Rooms were very quiet considering the airport and strip were nearby. free valet parking was a plus. this is where we will stay every time we stay in vegas visiting friends/relatives with our kids. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice One but it's still not an Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vandermurfy
Reviews.Content: This set of suites is just off the strip, perfect location, free parking, spacious, clean, it looks just a Marriott, but with a twist. It doesn't have a regular maid service, once a week complete cleanover, and regular dusting once a day, however, should you require regular maid service, there is a tarrif and one can be hired extra. You treat this as if it was your own apartment away from home. Checking in was dead easy, we got lucky because we arrived so late and didn't have to wait. We couldn't believe the size of the room when we got in. fully equiped kitchen leading into the lounge/sitting room. Nice big TV, adjoining bedroom, huge bed, a kind of ensuite with a huge tub in the room, leading to the main bathroom/toilet area. Water pressure wasn't so good in the showers but still decent enough to get one refreshed. We could really chill out here, we got a paper delivered every morning except weekends. They have a little supermarket down in the lobby area, go in with your hands up, you're as good as being robbed by the price of the bacon eggs and all ! We tried the outside pool but didn't make it in time for the happy hour, wow, big deal, and so were the prices of the drinks, and potent, wow, the barman just lets the juice rip. Just as well we missed happy hour because there was a hell of a lot more we could have missed,(chuckle). Breakfast at home wasn't what we wanted, we made breakfast a couple of times, we had all the facilities available, pots, pans, utensils, plates, cutlery etc. But on holiday, you want to have one little bit of inhouse pampering, like the breakfast. I know, it's a personal isue but not important, the ambience of the place is worth staying for. No noise, no casino's, no clutter, no smoke, smoke free, unbelievable, (worth the lack of breakfast dining inhouse, I think?) Anyway, across the road, there's a whole big mall out there, the Miracle Mile with it's shops and restaurants. leaving at the end of our stay was a a simple affair, I washed most of my clothes in the suite, dried and ironed them, nice and tidy, neat luggage for the security at the airport to rummage through. The lobby has a service to offer guests that want to check in and print their boarding passes, free!!! I forgot to mention this, that there is an available taxi service outside the lobby, and one can be arranged for you. Now, how can I fault the Grand Chateau? Well, the outside bar for 1, but it is a holiday resort, no breakfast bar/reastaurant, If that is a fault then they are guilty, but you be the judge of that. How can I default this place? It's perfect, I think. The lifts/elevators work, the rooms are huge and spacious, air conditioned, tv's in sitting room and bedroom, huge comfortable beds, clean sheets, clean everything. They even have shopping trips if you are tired of getting robbed at the local convenience store. Check those out. Except for 1 thing. The couch/settee/sofa did not have a throw on it. In terms of hygiene, I would bring one with me next time, you never what you're sitting on. And you can wash it before you leave anyway. So as a tip, bring one huge light cotton throw(a beach towel even) for the settee/couch sofa or what ever. You will love this place for what it has to offer and for the conveinence it dispenses to you. We differ on this, my wife and me, She would stay here again, wild horses wouldn't drag back to an hotel again everrrrr, however, as for me, I most certainly would go to a Mariotts hotel first and only come here as a 2nd choice, but hey thats me. As we, well, I guess we are going to be back here real soon. We came her at the beginning of November fo one week and left on the 10th November.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Feds294201
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare for a 2 bedroom, sleeps 8 condo at the Grand Chateau. There were 4 of us and any more would have been very crowded. The rooms are nice but not 5-star. Our main complaint was upon arrival we were informed that maid service of any kind would cost extra. How ridiculous! We have stayed in timeshare exchanges on 4 continents and never have we had to take out our own trash or make our own beds or phone for towels! For that reason we will not stay there again and before we exchange to any other Marriotts around the world, we will check to see if they also have that policy. On the other hand, the location is excellent; we walked to many of the large hotels from there and the Miracle Mile Shopping Mall is across the street. Valet parking was very convenient. So if you are booking into this hotel and paying for your rooms rather than exchanging, you might have maid service, otherwise....beware. Also nice not to have to walk through a smokey casino to get to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay near the strip...but not for pool scene crowd”
Reviews.Author: JeannieChiliBeanie
Reviews.Content: I love this property. The staff is lovely, the property is smoke free and casino free! It is a vacation club property so there is no restaurant or bar except for the serviceabe sky bar at the pool on the roof. But across the street at the Miracle Mile are plenty of choices. I find it refreshing to get away from the raunchy crowd and relax at the Grand Chateau. The rooms are lovely and well appointed. It's quiet and elegant. You can get a suite with a kitchenette or a full kitchen. You can walk to many attractions and then when you've had enough you return to a haven. The concierge helped us wonderfully with dinner reservations. The housekeeping/loss prevention staff courteously found and returned some items to me that I left behind, with a delightful attitude. The internet is free and dependable. The pool is small and not much of a draw at this destination -- so if that's important you will want to go somewhere else. There is a nice fitness room and a bigger pool will be part of the finished project in the coming years.

Reviews.Title: “Just like WWII with sirens every 2 minutes”
Reviews.Author: valcarcejim
Reviews.Content: The good: great, spacious two room with nice features. Clean, nice sheets and great valley parking. The bad: woke up every 15 minutes with sirens, banging, sirens ... Like a war outside my room. The noisest hotel I've ever stayed in. I was told tower 2 is better .... Ask for a room out of the war Zone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: bluegrasstraveler51
Reviews.Content: Very good accomodations, it is part of Marriott`s Vacation Club program. The apartment I stayed in (14th floor) was spacious , clean and comfortable. Some glitches with the WiFi , otherwise an uneventful stay. No casino , henceforth quiet and easy to find a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JulieRichardT
Reviews.Content: this is the fourth year we have stayed here at this location. a great place to stay best location in the middle of the strip.Rooms are great if you get a villa, staff are friendly and helpful, valet guys are good just the one thing that lets it down year after year the house keeping it never changes they get 1/5 rating.If you can put up with the house keeeping or the lack of the house keeping this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: EMTSkip911
Reviews.Content: My 100th night in a Marriott this year! I cannnot thank them enough for the HUGE basket filled with goodies. The hotel was clean and the staff very nice! I was not sure if I would like not having a casno not in my hotel. It is a 1/2 block and not bad, I think I saved alot of money that way! I was a little shocked no daily made service but we got towels so all was good. I would stay again. They where more tenative then any MGM or harris Property is to us when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect option in LV”
Reviews.Author: carlosfidelis
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel from Nov 4 to Nov 11 at room 1420 and it was perfect.This room was a villa with one bedroom. Im a marriott vacation club owner and I chose Las Vegas to know this year. What a surprise with the city that is not so tacky as I imaginated and with the hotel that is in a very good location, one block from the STRIP and close to a Mall ( you just have to cross Harmon Av). The location couldn´t be better cause its close to the Strip without beeing in that MESS of lots of tourists, drunks and people distributing papers with pics of sexy girls I got a room without Strip view cause I didint want to wait until the check in time. The concierge gave me good information about car rental ( DOLLAR) and the front desk ( a guy called Jay) was very helpfull giving me assistance with the arrival of some boxes delivered to me.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas condo setting within walking distance of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: roseyposey133
Reviews.Content: A nice property that is well run. valet parking is included in the rate and the service is good. The pool and hot tub are on the roof which affords you a wonderful view of Las Vegas. The facility is non-smoking; a nice break from the casinos. You are quite literally across the street from Planet Hollywood. The two bedroom villa we had was quite spacious. The maid service could have been better; especially for a Marriott. The maid broke a wine bottle in our suite and we still saw broken glass three days later. The beds incl. the sofa bed were comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped. Free Internet but there was no business centre. There is an owners lounge you can use but the fee was somewhat high. All in all, a very comfortable stay, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Tower 1”
Reviews.Author: fpgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit here and except for 1 thing, it was all we've come to expect. The one thing is----- even though Tower 1 has been refurbished and is very nice, if you are given a room that fronts on Harmon St., asked to be relocated. There were too many sirens to count on almost every night of our 6 night stay - not a very restful sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: shields33
Reviews.Content: Great location, acceptable facilities but no restaurant and indifferent staff. The pool area seems like an after thought with no umberellas or shade and too small for the number of guests. As a regular Marriott user, I was disappointed, especially when for the same daily rate you could chose The Cosmopolitan, vastly superior in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BeckL
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! I had a 2 bedroom unit on 12th floor. Newly renovated from what they told me. Gorgeous. Easy walking distance to bus stop, shopping mall and Planet Hollywood. Rented a car - they valet park only. Small expensive store in complex but they provide shopping trip (first come-first serve) to local grocery store. Pool is small and I only went up once - too crowded. Concierge was awesome. Computer in lobby to print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treat!”
Reviews.Author: disneydad331
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for one night only, wish it was more, prior to a trade show the following day. Not sure what to expect with a vacation club, but WOW, this property was amazing. Quick check-in, friendly staff, and then there are the rooms! Super clean, and big! I was in a 1-bedroom suite, and this was practically 4 rooms, a bathroom, a kitchen, a living area, and the bedroom. No restaurants at the property, but all you need do is walk across the street to the Miracle Mile Shops @ The Planet Hollywood where there is everything from a Brazilian Steakhouse to Fast Food Chinese and Ben & Jerry's. Would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: annarbeit
Reviews.Content: Exceptional staff, great location, nice rooms. Needs an on site coffee shop or restaurant otherwise, quiet and comfortable yet situated perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'home base' for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Markmontana
Reviews.Content: We had several employees along for a convention, and picked up a 3 room suite at the Grand Chateau. It was great, we had a nice common room for hang in out, and yet we all had separate accommodations for privacy. Very comfortable and impressive. We eat out when in Vegas, so it was no problem that the hotel does not have room service. But they do have a small market and encourage you to bring your own food. Highly recommended as a central base for Vegas activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room size 2 br was very good for 4 men”
Reviews.Author: rockygee
Reviews.Content: We were 4 guys in our 60s looking for a place to use as a base for golfing in Vegas for a week. The 2 br 2 ba unit was in excellent condition. It had two king size beds with two couches that turned into beds. There were 3 big tvs, a full kitchen and living and dining room. Plenty of room for 4 men. They have free parking and a valet service that we loved. The parking was quick and they had our vehicle ready every morning at 5:30 am. The rooftop poool was small but good for us. They Hot tub next to the pool holds about 6 people and was great for soaking our weary bones after 2 rounds of golf every day. Towels were supplied near the pool as you get off the elevator. They have a food market on the main floor that sold frozen pizza and snacks,ice cream and sundries. The Hotel is next to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle mile shops that were amazing. Lots of shops and restaurants,bars. The Bellagio Resort on the strip is also a short walk from the Marriott. We had dinner at a place called "Mangianos" Italian restaurant on the strip that was excellent. Great food and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Too quiet?”
Reviews.Author: Volks79
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 2 bed 2 bath room on 17th floor. King beds in each room. 1 sleep sofa in one bedroom and another sleep sofa in the living area. One of the bedrooms have a large jacuzzi. Beds are not the most comfortable specially when compared to heavenly beds. The sofas seem rock solid but would do in a pinch. We were there on the weekend and the elevators were very fast. Getting the car from valet took an everage of 10/15min. Nothing happening at the hotel. Specially at the pool. Looked at the pool for about 3 seconds. Average age hanging at the pool seem about 50. Nice location. About 10min to the strip since the traffic lights take so long. No bad at all. Miracle Mile shops being accross the hotel is very nice. One thing to keep in mind, I was there for 3 days and they only cleaned the room 1 day. When I called the front desk, they told me that daily cleaning is not part of the deal. The other days they only dropped off towels and soap. Washer/Dryer is in the room. Very nice stay if you are looking for a quiet place. If you would like a bit more action going on where you stay, maybe planet hollywood across the street might be better. Their pool was always packed. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for large groups”
Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: When we visit LV we normally stay at Palazzo or Wynn, but we decided to give Marriott a try as my parents came along and I wanted a space that is more relaxing for family get together. A plus is that it's very close to the strip, being directly opposite Planet Hollywood - actually a short cut to get away from the heat is to go through the mall inside the Planet Hollywood. The set up is very nice as we had 2 rooms that connected. One had a bedroom with a master bath, a full size kitchen, living room and dining room. The other was your basic hotel room with a queen bed. It's definitely nice to be able to use the kitchen. Normally our dilemma with visiting LV is that we never seem to be able to finish our food at restaurants, so having a fridge and a microwave was handy. The minus - the walls were thin, and when they had the weekend party at the pool at Planet Hollywood you can definitely hear them despite the insulated windows. For some reason our bed was extremely hard. I think it was a memory foam mattress and I can't seem to make a dent to it. So I kept waking up with sore shoulders. My parent's bed at the other room seemed a little softer. The pool was dinky and hard to get to (elevator up, then switch to another elevator). The view at night from the pooltop was beautiful though. Overall, if we go by ourselves again I will go back to our old haunts, but for family get together it is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Well located non-casino hotel off-strip”
Reviews.Author: KGE
Reviews.Content: Location: 1 block east of strip, across road from Planet Hollwood and Miracle Mile shops. Easy to walk to most hotels and casinos between MGM and Venetian and a short cab or monorail ride to other locations. Lobby/Appearance: Brand new building so everything looks clean and nice. Marketplace next to front desk for food/drinks/toiletries. 2 computers available to print out boarding passes. Valet attendant available at all hours to help with your car or to call a cab. Rooms: Our room was spacious, with a king bed, lcd tv, large tiled bathroom, couch, kitchenette with bar fridge, sink, microwave and table with 2 chairs. We were up on the 33rd floor with a great view. The rooms were well insulated, we barely heard anything or anyone from adjoining rooms. Rest of hotel: I didn't get to check out the gym, pool area or rooftop bar, but I heard that the bar was nice, but small, with a great view. Overall, a nice hotel close to the action but far enough away to escape and recover.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusMel
Reviews.Content: Large rooms and great location. Pool is too small and nothing extra. Staff was pleasant and shuttle service to grocery and other end of the strip is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Confortable Living”
Reviews.Author: PerantauDunia
Reviews.Content: 5 star given based on the fact it met all our expectations. Stayed here for a week utilising a free timeshare bonus week so it was very good value. We had a one bed apartment with limited kitchen, which was fine as we did not plan to cook. We had a great view from the room overlooking the strip where we were able to see the new City Centre and also Excalibur lit up at night. The view was amazing. Compared to the Hilton Vacation club and others, this was actually a few minutes away from the strip so it was really convenient. The concierge at the lobby was also knowledgable and great and suggested a number of destinations we could go to when we said we were interested in the serrounding canyons and national parks. In short the rooms and beds were great and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. One other thing is that the hotel is 'small' by Vegas standards, so it was nice not to be walking miles and miles after exiting the elevator to get to your room!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay for the family”
Reviews.Author: Timotraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with a group or the family this is the best for Las Vegas. We got the 2 bedroom suite and it was perfect for us - my wife and i were traveling with two teenage girls and having the separate bedrooms and - thank heavens - two bathrooms things went well. The location was perfect in the middle of the strip and only a hunderd meters/yds or so from the main strip. Rooms were excellent and a full kitchen if you just want to have something in the room. The service was excellent - perfect and for the price you could not get a two room suite like this!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: scottfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in September in a 2 bedroom/2 bath villa on an II transfer. The rooms are clean and up to date. Our friends utilized the bedroom in the lock off and sleep in until after 10:00 a.m. each day. We are glad we chose that room for them because we are early risers and have breakfast by 7:00 and to the gym by 8:00. They said they never heard us once during the whole week and we even run the blender each morning for a smoothie and they never heard it. Customer service was impeccable. We visit Vegas every year, but this is the first time we rented a car and used Valet Service. The Valet was always quick and easy and the staff was beyond helpful with directions or anything you needed. Will definately rent a car each year in the future as using Valet at each hotel that we attended a show was so much easier and relaxed then using the Deuce or a Taxi. Also we were able to drive to Red Rock..a must...and the Grand Canyon. We were also able to drive to happy hour at Flemings (close to Red Rock) which is fabulous....a must try. Having a car also allowed us to drive to Costco for groceries and fully utilize the kitchen in our unit. Will rent a car always in the future, but if you choose not to, Taxi or shuttle from the hotel is quick and easy as well. We have stayed at the Grand Chateau before and consider not staying because you really can't utilize the pool (I am definately a pool person) but the location is a bigger benefit for us. Our week was a hot one and if you think having a small pool is better than none....think again...this pool is so small and on hot days who wants to hang around on the roof in the sun and share a dip with 25+ strangers in an oversized hot tub. We utilized the fitness facility daily, sometimes over crowded however and needs expanding for cardio equipment.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel in a Sea of Exceptional Hotels”
Reviews.Author: sldkjf2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau to celebrate a family member's 80th birthday and chose it based on location, price, and reviews. What a great pick! The hotel was centrally located, just a half block off the Las Vegas Strip, within walking distance of everything we came to Las Vegas to see. We booked two suites, each identical. Each suite had a separate living room with eating area, kitchen, bedroom, and bath. The baths were luxuriously appointed, with dual showers, spacious sink area, and beautiful stone tiling throughout. The bedroom had a large garden tub and a second spacious sink area. The beds were very comfortable. The kitchen was exceptionally well appointed with dishes, glassware, cooking equipment, and silverware. I say exceptional because one of the kitchen drawers was equipped with every kitchen gadget you'd have at home and all the appliances were full size, not mini versions that are found at many properties. The coffee maker came with enough coffee and filters to last until one could get to the market to buy more. And speaking of market, there was a small market in the lobby from which we purchased supplies daily. It was simply too convenient to make an effort to travel out to a grocery. The prices were what one would expect in a market inside a hotel, but we never failed to find everything we wanted in that market, from snacks and refrigerated breakfast items, to staples like milk, bread, and sugar. There were six very fast elevators and even after a week, we never had to wait for an elevator. There was a small pool on the rooftop which we didn't use, but it looked inviting and the Jacuzzi beside it was a good size and well maintained. The pool area sported a hosted bar and had great views of the Las Vegas strip. Other than the physical facilities, which were superb, the employees were the best I've ever encountered, and that compliment is not offered lightly. The check-in was effortless and the front desk staff never rushed us when we were asking for directions or suggestions. They were simply some of the most pleasant employees I've ever dealt with. The hotel offers free valet parking; self parking is not available. The valets were efficient and delivered our car within a very few minutes in every case. They were as friendly as the front desk staff and were helpful on several occasions in giving us directions. Anything I didn't like? Well, only one. All the lights in the suites had been changed out to the new compact florescent light bulbs and they did not produce much light. When first turned on, they were very dim, but over time got brighter, a mild aggravation. This was simply one of the most pleasant and beautiful places we've stayed. The next time we go to Las Vegas, I'm sure we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for our Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: TR_Travel_UK
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Las Vegas in early October 2011 with my wife & daughter and we had booked a "2 bedroom villa" which turned out to effectively be a suite with a connecting door through to a standard room next door which was exactly what we wanted. The main suite had a large sitting & dining area, well equipped kitchen area and a large bedroom & bathroom (with huge tub & large walk-in shower). As others have noted we thought the location was really good - just off the strip, but close enough to walk to a large number of the major attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay without the noise the casino hotels have”
Reviews.Author: Pointscollector
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this as an option when staying in Las Vegas. My room was 2723, it had a fully equipped kitchen, sitting area, separate bedroom and large bathroom. Had a strange experience on my first day though because 2723 and 2724 are at the end of a long hallway and have an additional door to go through, so as I was going in my neighbour was coming out! The views from both the sitting room and bedroom were great straight across into the City centre. On things others have commented on; the pool is on the 38th floor (roof) and although small is I would have thought adequate, ok it's not the Mandalay Bay beaches and all that, but what do you expect on the roof! There is a small bar and a sitting area and the views across the strip skyline night and day must surely compensate in some way. The hotel is on Harmon Ave but the access is a turn off, but it's very simple to find just turn at the lights at the entrance to Planet Hollywood. And something to remember the hotel only has valet parking which was not a problem as the valets were helpful and quick, just allow 5-10 minutes and your car arrives at the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: goodone26
Reviews.Content: Am late in reviewing but wanted to say my friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Our suite was just perfect, especially having two bathrooms. The kitchen area provided everything we needed. The location was great - just a few minutes walk to "The Strip". Would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Duke001
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable bed and quiet room. What more could you ask for when traveling. The full kitchen was a treat, as was the separate sitting room. Across the street from Planet Hollywood and within a short walk to the new City Center, New York New York, MGM Grand and Paris. This place was centrally located, easy to get to, and no more than a short walk or $10 taxi ride from almost any major casino or restaurant. If you are staying here, go to Roy's for dinner, get the discount coupon book at the front desk and stock up on beer, wine whatever at the ABC store in the mall across the street. The Grand Chateau provides a free shuttle to the grocery store and the fashion center mall. Both minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Attentive Stafff, Great Value, Very Small Pool”
Reviews.Author: RJordan5448
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 29th wedding anniversary and hubby's birthday during our 7 day stay at the Grand Chateau. Location is excellent being just a block away from the strip making its location quiet, but within a 5 min walk to strip, City Center, or Planet Hollywood. Front desk, valet, and bell hop service were excellent (nice touch for them to remember our names even when we were just passing by). Hotel was generally in great shape, however, our room's furniture had a lot of dings and the hall carpets were in need of a good shampoo/cleaning. Still better than some of the more upscale Vegas hotels we've stayed in the last few years. Having a full kitchen was extremely convenient as we elected to have breakfast in twice. While we elected to rent a car and were able to pick up our supplies as needed, the Grand Chateau offers door to door service to local Albertson's on designated days. It also has a small shop off the lobby which has a good variety of general items, however, it is a bit pricey but convenient. Main positive point is that we were able to get a 2 bedroom suite (1 bedroom suite with adjoining deluxe room) for less than the regular price of a deluxe room at the 5 star hotels we generally stay while in Vegas. Great to be able to share space with our friends while still being able to have privacy when needed. Also, used the in-suite washer/dryer which was a real help in not having to pack extra clothes. All in all we jhad a wonderful stay with only had 2 complaints - the pool is 12x12 at the most and lacks any real use for swimming. Located on roof which offers a nice view but little else. Secondly, housekeeping really not up to standard. We slept late every day and notified housekeeping of our leaving (you call if you want your room cleaned after 3:30 pm). Three of our 7 days our room was not cleaned. Twice our room was cleaned but no wash clothes left. The value is excellent and we highly recommend to anyone who enjoys being close to the action but enjoys the quiet. This is a Marriott Vacation Club (timeshare) property and they will try to get to you attend a presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Good short term vacation rental”
Reviews.Author: wineismylife
Reviews.Content: Marriott Grand Chateau 1 & 2 75 East Harmon Avenue Las Vegas, Nevada 89109 USA Phone ----- http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/lasvg-marriotts-grand-chateau-1-and-2/ September 21, 2011 Marriott Grand Chateau is a vacation time share rental property that is part of the Marriott Vacation Club division of Marriott International. Although the focus here is obviously on selling time share rentals the property is available for nightly rentals on an availability basis. Being in town on a trip for both business and pleasure I stayed here along with some friends that had already booked their rooms for the same events we were attending together. The property is located on Harmon Avenue, maybe one block if that far from a bustling section of the Las Vegas Strip. This location is actually quite good for both business purposes and pleasure seekers. Pleasure seekers will find themselves barely a block from the new City Center with short walks to notable properties such as Aria, The Cosmopolitan, Monte Carlo, Bellagio, MGM Grand and beyond. For the business traveler the Marriott offers complimentary valet of your rental car where you can quickly exit onto Harmon Avenue towards Koval Lane, avoiding the immense congestion on Las Vegas Blvd. The arrival process was very good with the valet being a great first impression for the facility. He quickly greeted me when I pulled in with my business rental car and gave me a good lay of the land as I unloaded my bags. A little tip he offered for those of you staying here on business is if you’ll let him know at check-in he’ll pull your car forward and have it ready for you as long as you’re leaving before 8AM. This is a little something he says he likes to do for his business guests to make it easier for them to get out in the morning and get to their jobs. That was a nice touch. The check-in process was good but not exceptional. It seemed to take a bit longer than needed until the assistant front desk manager finally came from the office to assist in breaking loose the log jam. At that point I was finally cheerfully greeted and quickly checked in with all of the information I needed to take on Vegas. The facilities all seem brand new and in pristine condition. All of the common areas are modern, clean and attractive. The rooms seem to be primarily longer term vacation or business rentals. These rooms are basically expanded suites that include separate bedroom, bathroom, living area and even a full sized kitchen for cooking and entertaining. The kitchen comes stocked with the basics for preparing moderate meals, full sized coffee pot, dishwasher, full sized refrigerator and the like. The adjoining living area has a nice sized flat screen LCD TV with stereo system flanked by a full sized couch, two chairs and a coffee table. The four seat dining table is wedged between the kitchen and living area in this open concept design. In the bedroom there is a king sized bed with another good sized flat panel LCD TV, an arm chair for reading and watching TV and other basics. Of particular interest there is an over-sized tub located in the bedroom set across from a separate sink, mirror and make up table for the ladies to utilize while the bathroom is otherwise occupied. The bathroom is all marble, with a really good sized walk in glass wall shower containing two shower heads. Overall I’d say the Marriott Grand Chateau 1 & 2 is a very nice, part time rental property. The only negatives I can think of from my stay where the heightened push to sell you a time share. I personally find this annoying, especially when traveling on business. Others might not even be bothered in the least. I found the advance phone calls from the “Pre-Arrival Marketing Specialist” a little annoying for what was essentially a business trip. In addition, our water was shut off from 5PM until 8PM the first night of our arrival due to a broken water main outside of the hotel. You can’t blame the hotel for such acts beyond their control but when you’re the guest that needs to shower before heading out to dinner for the evening it still irritates a little bit nonetheless. Marriott Grand Chateau 1 & 2: recommended if obtainable at a price point comfortable to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms, really awful pool area.”
Reviews.Author: Saxeygirl
Reviews.Content: The Grand Chateau is a little tricky to get into. The entrance is actually NOT on Harmon Ave. but up the side street it faces. If you pass it you have to go around a large block to get back to where you were and you can't turn left off of Las Vegas Blvd. The staff is friendly, the facility is lovely. We had a one bedroom unit overlooking the strip facing south. It was beautiful at night. We were "short" one TV remote when we checked in, so called on it and someone came within 15 minutes to rectify the situation. Our BIG disappointment was the pool. If you have visions of yourself sitting by a pool there, you should look elsewhere. The pool is located on a PART of the roof, a small portion, actually. You have to take a separate elevator to get there. About a third of the space is taken up by a bar - one step up from the main pool area. The whole thing is surrounded by a wall that's at least five feet high. Picture cement with chase lounges side by side - very close. No umbrellas, no shade, no small tables, just rows of chase lounges surrounding a pool the size that you might have in your own yard. The space around the pool is so narrow that if someone's standing there, they have to move so you can get by. If you plan NO pool, or relaxing time by the pool, then this would be a great choice, otherwise I couldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful smoke free hotel near the stip”
Reviews.Author: sedum37
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed totally smoke free hotel just a block from the Las Vegas strip. Very convenient to visit the strip and popular casinos/hotels/restaurants. We had an excellent view of Las Vegas from our room. The room was nicely appointed and spacious. The bathroom was huge. We enjoyed our stay very much. Check out AAA, Senior or Marriott rewards rates. Note that hotel has only valet parking and does not have a restaurant or casino. My only complaint is the 10AM check out time (or would have given it 5 stars)!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: GBCANDYMAN
Reviews.Content: Although it's off the strip it's only a few minutes walk to the strip. If you're walking north cut through Miracle Mile shops to get to the strip even faster. To go south go left out of the main entrance and walk thru the alleyway to get to the strip. No need to rent a car. Easy access to just about everywhere by bus or monorail. It's about a 10 minute ride from the airport. The elevators arrive quickly. We stayed in a lock off which was fine for 2 of us. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SuzyWho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 and from the minute we arrived, we knew it was the perfect place to stay. Marriott quality mattresses ensure that everyone has a great nights sleep. The apartment was fully equipped as usual and the free transport to Albertsons for the first few days of our holiday meant that we could stock up on supplies easily.The staff are really helpful and it was well worth going to the welcome meeting to find out more about the hotel and surrounding area. It was brilliant to be in such a serene hotel. All the others with casinos and restaurants were great to visit but noisy and I certainly wouldn't have wanted to stay in one. We hired a car to visit Hoover Dam and red rock canyon and found the valet parking at the hotel to be quick and efficient. We have never used valet parking before but certainly got used to it quite quickly. The only downside is the small pool, but the jaccuzzi is brilliant and the view from the roof terriffic ! If we ever go to Las Vegas again, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silly_girl42
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel to stay at - a Home away from Home - appartments with everything - except the pool - it is far too small and shallow - but the rest is excellent. They have iced water dispensers in the foyer for guests to use free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: cara_anne
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Vegas was a first for many in our group, so staying in a non-casino hotel was a point of contention. But once we got to the hotel, we realized we made the best choice. The ladies at the front desk (Billie) were most kind and helpful. The concierge was great on helping us get a last minute car. The housekeeping staff did a fantastic job. The bell hop was awesome holding our bags all day until our red-eye flight and then getting us a limo to take all 6 of us back to the airport. The staff definitely lived up to Marriott standards. The location was ideal - easy walk to MGM and City Center - even found a short cut through the adjacent property's parking lot. The 2 Bedroom suite was awesome - even the sofabed was comfortable! They have new foam mattress on the sofabeds. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Marriott stay”
Reviews.Author: dom3070
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott for the 1st time in September. This hotel is the place to be. We have stayed at many other hotels on the strip but found this to be the best. Its located in the center of the strip and walking distance to many of the casinos.It's across the street from Planet Hollywood Casino and the Miracle Mile Shops.Across Las vegas Blvd is The Aria and Cosmopolitan Complex. We are Marriott owners and found this location to be a great addition to the Marriott inventory. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.The only down side was the pool area.But on the other hand the view from the roof top pool and bar is excellant.There are many restaurants nearby and also a Walgreens to pick up those items you forgot.A tip before you check in pick up your groceries ( the Hotel will call you if you request it when your room is ready). Another tip if you're traveling noth on the strip try using the Miracle Mile Shops, which has a Harmond Street entrance.This is a quick and "cool" shortcut.

Reviews.Title: “Best alternate to the Casino-Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jarakus
Reviews.Content: Another great visit to Grand Chateau! My wife and I have been here four times, and we always comment that it is our favorite hotel of all those we have ever been to (and we do 60+ nights a year). One block from the strip, directly across Harmon from Planet Hollywood and Las Vegas Boulevard (the strip) from City Center, halway between the top and bottom of the strip. Location is AMAZING (the setback from the strip is key here), and removed just enough so you can escape from the madness each night. Why is it the best? Ready? Ok, here goes....the cleanest (immaculate), the biggest (seperate bedrooms, full kitchen, full living room, enormous bath.....must be over 800 square feet), most livable (washing machine in each unit, 2 full bath countertops and sinks, vast closet and dresser space, fully equipped kitchen), best view of the strip, easiest access to the heart of the strip, fast and plentiful elevators, convenience store in the lobby, newspaper in the morning, rooftop pool (sun ALL day), no traipsing through a casino to get to check-in or on the way out to the street), QUIET when you want quiet, no skeevy people in the unit next door, 37 floors tall but with an intimate feel, short ( 3 or 4 minute) walk to Tix-4-tonight, directly next door to Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood (15 restaurants and one hundred stores), directly next to the numerous theatres at Planet Hollywood (biggest selection of shows on the strip), easy Walgreens access, Deuce bus access, and a constant line of cabs ready in front of building, etc. etc. Try it to believe it. Honestly, the room alone makes this the only property I would consider in Vegas (all the above info is based on the one bedroom unit, they also have efficiency units with a mini kitchen). If you are tired of living for days out of a tiny hotel room without even a fridge and constantly having to exit through a huge casino, you need to try this. My wife and I enjoyed it so much, we bought a timeshare here....best thing we ever did in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Buzzer127
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott time share owner and swapped for this. While the rooms (2 Bedrooms) was fine, we found the property lacked a bit. There is no restaurant on the premises. There is a pool area on the rooftop which is very small considering the size of the property.

Reviews.Title: “What? No Casino?”
Reviews.Author: PeacenikAlameda
Reviews.Content: Its hard to believe that there is a hotel in Las Vegas that does not have a casino associated with it. This is a vacation club property so there are many amenities that you just don't find in a regular hotel in Vegas, like a kitchenette. So if you don't enjoy the noise pollution generated by all those slot machines, this is a great place to stay. We don't gamble, but go to Vegas for the fine dining and the shows. The halls were very quiet but the pool area very crowded. Many families bring their children to the pool. All seem well supervised while we were there, but it was tough finding a chair. The bar was O.K. Definately a hit with the twenty somethings, and served a good nightcap. Looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: starjdg
Reviews.Content: It 's like having your own 5 star apartment in the middle of Las Vegas strip. Full kitchen with washer and dryer... Free wifi in all the rooms. Location is the best... It 's in front of the new City Center and across Planet Holywood Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kayway11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay in a studio room on the 12th floor. Great accommodation, couldn't be any cleaner or more comfortable. View just OK (we were were somewhat disappointed because of our Marriott Gold status and our request for a room with city center view was not granted or even acknowledged. In fact we had specifically requested this view along with being away from any construction noise. Surprisingly one morning ( 2 days before we left) we were awoken with a jackhammer noise that was quite disturbing. After making a phone call we were told they would put us in another room however, one wasn't available. Since we were leaving so soon we chose not to go to the trouble of moving for such a short time. In lieu of this they apologized profusely and gave us a gift certificate which was nice but didn't take away the noise factor. Given the experience at this specific property we strongly suggest you confirm any room request at the time of check in...especially ask to avoid the noise factor. Additionally, don't waste your time with the time share presentation. The mentality of the presenter and in particular his supervisor (who actually told us to say the presenter did a good job on the evaluation we would receive later) are typical... arrogant and condescending and not worth the aggravation or time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful property, staff attention a little sloppy at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: cbsjohn
Reviews.Content: The property was in great shape. Location in the middle of the strip, but set back a few hundred yards to avoid the noise and bustle. Across the street from the Planet Hollywood, as well as the fairly new Miracle Mile Shops. These shops have a number of good and reasonably priced restaurants. Staff was helpful with tips, but we had a bad experience, when 4 days into our stay another couple with the same last name were given keys to our room. We were sitting on the couch when the door opened and they attempted to come in with their luggage ! If not for this goof up I would have given them a much higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “What were they thinking when they built the roof top Pool & Bar!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler54
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the typical Marriott vacation property rooms, which are fantastic! They are large & well furnished. The property is impeccably clean. The location is great, only steps away from the center of the strip. We wanted a room facing the strip but they refused our request, even with my Platinum Elite status. That was only a minor disappointment as the view from the “bad side” is still pretty nice. The major negative is the roof top pool area. What were they thinking! The pool area looks like it was designed by the same people who design the Motel 6 parking lots! It is a small dumpy pool surrounded by a small deck and high walls with little decorations. So even though it’s on the roof you can’t see the views unless you go to the wall and peer over the approximately five feet walls. The roof top bar is also a joke. It’s a dump! Bottom line, 5 stars for the property but one star for the roof top pool & bar.

Reviews.Title: “A quality Marriott timeshare resort”
Reviews.Author: 3seasonsOhio
Reviews.Content: We own a two-bedroom villa at the Grand Chateau but had not stayed at this property until now (Sept 13-17) for 4 nights. It has the standard two-bedroom Marriott villa layout with the lock-off second bedroom efficiency. We were on the 31st floor facing the strip and the view was great. The pool on the roof is the resort disappointment but will be replaced once the additional property towers are constructed-- could be a while with the fragile economy. We still enjoyed our time in the sun as did many of the resort guests. The view at night from the roof is amazing. E. Harmon Ave. sort of dead ends into Las Vegas Blvd with the Aria and Cosmopolitan (City Center) resort complex as the backdrop. There is no restaurant on the property and the nearest full service grocery stores are not within walking distance. We used the local Walgreen's (couple of Vegas blocks south on Las Vegas Blvd) to fill in the food gaps since we did not have a car this trip. We were completely satisfied with the location relative to the strip. The side entrance to the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood are directly across the street (East Harmon) with street level crosswalks. A skywalk is under construction over E Harmon where Harmon meets the strip as well as another shopping/restaurant complex (Harmon Corners) which is scheduled for a Dec 2011 opening. Walgreen's is advertising as a tenant which would be much closer than the one down the street. The lobby offers a dedicated computer for airline websites without charge for on-line flight check-ins and the printing of boarding passes. I believe the valet is 24 hours as a gentleman was available to wave us a cab at 4:30 a.m. for our trip to the airport. The bell desk will lock your luggage up if you arrive too early for check-in and the front desk will call you when your room is available if you leave a number. It is a non-smoking property (a smoking area is available on the roof by the bar) which is a welcome relief in Vegas. If you are interested in a non-casino resort close to the strip, this property is certainly one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: Ocysu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Studio Suite in September 12th to the 14th. On the positive side: The suite was clean and comfortable. If you are renting (not an owner) daily maid service is provided. The employees were friendly and professional. Planet Hollywood's shops and restaurants are right across the street. We had a room on the 31st floor with a beautiful view of City Center. Though we did not use the service, a shuttle to Fashion Show Mall, and a grocery store is available. It is complimentary The negatives were: A studio suite is more like a glorified hotel room, with a sitting area, and small counter with sink, microwave, coffee maker, etc. The studios at Trump or the Signiture are much nicer. The television had a very poor picture, and the remote didn't work quit right, but who goes to Las Vegas to watch TV? Personally, I'm not a fan of valet parking. At this Marriott one has no choice. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here. I would stay at the Grand Chateau again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Goregous”
Reviews.Author: Adnjw
Reviews.Content: The Resort is a beautiful one. And right off the strip. We found it easy to get to everything yet quiet like we like it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jandahender
Reviews.Content: Rented the 2 bedroom villa and we were very impressed with the unit. . We requested an early check in and were very pleased our room was ready at 10.00 am over the busy Labour Day weekend. As well we got the higher floor unit we requested. The beds were very comfortable and we did not hear any noise from the hallway or upstairs. The room was newly renovated, very clean and contained all of the utensils we required for our stay I am not sure if it was an oversight but we had to request shampoo (forgot to bring my own) as only soap was left in the bathrooms. The kitchen was adequately stocked with dishwashing soap and liquid detergent. Coffee was not replaced and there were no tea bags. We cooked some meals and used the grocery shuttle. The shuttle goes to the Albertsons store and operated Saturday to Tuesday from 9.00 am to 10.30 am. Tickets for the shuttle are given up to half an hour prior to the shuttle's departure. We were allowed approximately 40 minutes to do our shopping. If you do not have an Albertsons discount card there is no need to register for one as they will give you the discount at checkout providing you ask for it. There is also a shuttle operating to the Fashion Show Mall which we did not use. Card access was required for after hours access to the elevators. Unable to comment on the pool and the gym (which is free) as we did not use these facilities. While there is laundry facilities in the unit it took about an hour to wash a load and the dryer took a long time as well and you could smell the exhaust in the room. Did not attempt to do any additional loads. If you have the time suggest renting a car and visiting Hoover Dam and hiking Red Rock Canyon. We were very happy with our accomodations and will stay here again. Enjoy your time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “What fans of Marriott should expect...”
Reviews.Author: chainleank
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge Marriott fan and have been for many years. This trip didn't alter my feelings on the company and the resort was exceptionally clean for how busy it was, and for being in Vegas. I stayed for 3 days, very much enjoyed my room, with no issues and was pleased at how well I slept and the service I received. There is a pool on the property (rooftop), however, its very small, and you might expect, at times you compete for a chaise lounge. It was not bad however and I did enjoy it. Looking forward to the next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: norgenvaaz
Reviews.Content: Only a short walk to the strip. No casino but if you want to gamble it's a short walk to the other hotels on the strip that have them. Great room we stayed in, separate dining, lounge & bedroom. All cooking & washing facilities available in the room at a very reasonable rate. Why pay a premium rate if you don't want to - we can't complain about this hotel. Good choice for a family as there was no casino to walk through every time you enter the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: tammig17
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times in fact we own a week of time share here in a gorgeous three bedroom. We love to stay here. The only bad thing about it is a really lousy pool. They were supposed to build two more towers and a much bigger, nicer pool but the economy banished those plans. Marriott, please build a nice pool here somewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and choice for a family Trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: IanB186338
Reviews.Content: After struggling to find a vegas hotel on the strip within our budget with either two adjoining rooms or a suite, we found this little gem. The location is fantasic, right in the middle of the strip but back a few hundred yards (which means it is a litle quiterer too). The rooms were very nice, spacious, and very good value. The hotel does not have a restaurant but it does have a small shop and the kitchen in the rooms is excellent, and of course Vegas is on your doorstep so you wont be short of places to eat. We had a great view looking towards the City Centre, and the pool, though small, did have another great view over the strip. All in all a very good choice for a family of 5 - would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow can only describe the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Paddles1964
Reviews.Content: Wow can only describe the rooms Ok these are not just hotel rooms but small apartments, well not even small apartments, distant sized apartments with all the trims. This without a doubt would be the best valued Marriott Hotel that we have stayed in the world. The room that we stayed in on the 28th level had a main bedroom with king sized bed and spa sized bath, separate shower. Whilst the 2nd bedroom had two queen sized beds, the dining table seated 6 and had a reasonable sized kitchen which was fully equipped. Windows do not open, but there is an opening vent for fresh area which was cleverly constructed in the widow frame. Wifi was free, lobby was elegant and there is a small but well stock shop. Roof top pool was small. One block off the strip, but still close enough to all the action. Great 180 degree views. Friendly staff Likes - Value for money - Size of the rooms - Laundry and Dryer in the room - 3 x flat screen T.V’s - Main bedroom to die for - Views Dislikes - Size of roof pool

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: ScottJ1
Reviews.Content: The room was as we expected from Marriott Vacation Club Resorts. They were roomy, comfortable and well appointed. We enjoy the kitchen, easy breakfasts before hitting the strip. The car parking process was easy and very trustworthy. I accidentally left money in the car and they put it in the glove box and mentioned it to me when I picked it up. The pool was small, but not very crowded, so that worked out fine. It would be nice if there was a restaurant on the property, but I guess they expect most people will go to other hotels/casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Family Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Studio room.We are members of the Marriot Asia Pacific Club and we used our shares to stay in this Marriot property for 4 days: The good thing about this hotel: 1) It has a small kitchen even for the studio room equipped with microwave,coffeemaker,bread toaster, ice bucket, utensils,plates and bowls. 2) The studio apartment has a huge king size bed and a king size pull out sofa bed.Easily a couple and 2 kids can fit into the studio room 3) just across(less than 5 minutes) walk to Miracle Mile Mall of Planet Hollywood 4) It costs only $16 to get from the airport to this hotel by taxi 5) Its near Bellagio,Paris, Caesars Palace,MGM, Polo, etc. 6) Theres no casino in this hotel so its really meant for families 7) Free Internet Negative Side: needs Improvement 1) Activities offered by the hotel are mostly for families with young children ; 2) You have to pay extra if you want your room to be cleaned everyday(average $15 for a studio room).You can however request for fresh towels 3) Toiletries are limited compared to other Marriot hotels.I only saw 1 face soap, 1 soap ,1 shampoo and 1 conditioner; 4) Pool is definitely very small for a huge property like Marriot 5) No restaurant altho theres a small store at the lobby(prices however are expensive) Tips: 1) You can try restaurants at the nearby Miracle Mile Mall for your meals 2) There are 2 ABC stores(much like 7 eleven) at Miracle Mile where u can buy drinks, sandwhiches even some fruits and other gift items. Its much cheaper to buy here than other stores along the strip

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jlrui2
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Vegas with our two elementary school children. I chose not to stay at a strip resort so that we could avoid the smokey casinos, solicitors and long lines. We decided on this resort because I am generally a fan of the Marriott brands. I won't stay elsewhere in Vegas, with or without the kids. The location is perfect, directly across Harmon from the Miracle Mile Shops. The one bedroom villa was perfect. The kids were happy to use the large sofabed in the living room, and I was able to close the bedroom door and relax in the hot tub. They offered daily childrens activities, housekeeping, and great service that you expect from any Marriott. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Planning for Construction Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: Warren D
Reviews.Content: Stayed there August 21-28 on the 11th floor in a 3 bedroom villa. Construction w/unbearable noise was coming from the12th floor directly into the villa. Moved to the 19th floor after 3 days of misery after being told that I should have requested a room that was not below construction - did not know that I had to request that. Was first offered a $25 drink comp for 6 people at the bar located near the roof top pool - the temperature of 110 during the day made that option undesirable. Was then given a $60 comp for the market place which we used for way overpriced grocery items and snacks. Finally after asking for more compensation we actually received 6 tickets for the Phantom show playing at the Venetian. Actually booked the show for a future stay and hope to use them later in the year. The problem is simple - Veags is a late night to early morning vacation. Most people sleep late during the day. The Marriott should have never given me or anyone else rooms directly below construction - very poor planning on their part. If it happens to you just tell them that "Sorry just does not cut it" and ask for some real compensation. I had a total of 3 couples in the room and I even apolgized to them for the noise because I had planned the entire trip. The Marriott is usually a great place to stay but in this case they fell short with their lack of planning and consideration for guests during their renovation projects. If you are going to stay there ask about construction going and insist on being no where near it. Finally the Jersey Boys show at the Palazzo is the best show I have ever seen in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: bmsozzy
Reviews.Content: Ok, unless you get free rooms at one of the casinos, why would you want to stay ANYWHERE ELSE? I mean, this place if fan-tas-tic. Its literally right across the street from the Planet Hollywood Casino, so its almost like staying at a casino hotel but without all the noise and drunk tourists. The lobby is immaculate, employees were cleaning the grout on the floor with tooth brushes at night!! Its very quiet, you never had to wait for an elevator or a cab if needed. The room I stayed in was a one bedroom and it was supurb. The room as very big, with a kitchen and the shower had two nozzles (which if fun even if youre alone.) The rooftop pool is a little small and very hot since youre in the desert, but the cooling fans, the bar and the view will make you forget about the heat. Fantastic. I will stay no where else from now on. Viva Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice to have an apartment and my wife loved the washing machine!”
Reviews.Author: MrFelipe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott's Grand Château mainly because it was four of us, two couples, and it was the end of a long trip. We had started at Los Angeles, driven to and stayed in San Francisco and we had planned five nights of party at Sin City. Having previously stayed at the Bellagio, I guess the only negative thing I can say about the Marriott is that it didn't have a casino. But it was the perfect base for our five nights there; located next door to Planet Hollywood we were just off the strip so could walk everywhere. The apartment was a two bedroom apartment and it was fully equipped. We were able to have breakfast on a couple of occasions and our other halves were really happy to be able to do some washing as we had been on the road for a while so they had used their favorite clothes. Vegas itself was awesome, but it was made more enjoyable by Sandy from the guest relations team. She was great, not only booking out Grand Canyon trip and our shows for the week, but really finding out what we really liked and matching that to the best possible option. She's a true asset to that hotel. So if I return to Vegas with my wife or a group of friends I would probably choose this hotel again as it provided all the home comforts without sacrificing location.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best two bedrooms condo for family use”
Reviews.Author: etohelp
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this time share (we exchanged from our timeshare in orlando) for one week in june. i know, i know, no one stays in vegas for a week. well, we attended a dance camp for 5 days so that occupied most of the week. by the way, we had been to this camp for 5 years and it is great. the location is great, right next to planet hollywood, right across from city center and cosmopolitan. we rent a car because we go to eat frequently at filipino restaurants along maryland parkway and in chinatown along spring mountain road. in case you don't know, las vegas has great filipino restaurants and a large chinatown. the employees at marriott are extremely courteous and helpful, the amenities are as what you would expect in a marriott timeshare. their quality of amenities are above average compared to many timeshares. parking is all by valet. give 10 minutes for them to pull your car up. i gave a dollar tip each time and they really appreciate it. the one drawback of this place is a small swimming pool. if this is an important part of your needs, don't stay here. the other peculiarity of this place is the lack of any spacious grounds around it. it is a relief not to have to walk through a casino to get to your elevator. across the street (sidestreet, so just a short walk) is the miracle mile shopping center connected to planet hollywood. this is one of the best malls because it has like 130 (approximate) shops from high end to very affordable. it has fast food of all kinds and moderate priced restaurants. it has at least two theaters inside for live performances. it has restaurants with nice outdoor patios that over look the strip. great for people watching. it even opens early for breakfast, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Paris but...!”
Reviews.Author: 911SC
Reviews.Content: We started and finished a month long trip to the US in Vegas and on our last night, I booked us into a 2 bedroomed suite at the Marriott. At the start of the trip we stayed elsewhere in Vegas and had seen the Hotel Paris which looks identical to the Marriot in its design. Accordingly we turned up at the Paris expecting to book in and after over an hour waiting in the queue we were told we were at the wrong hotel. Are we the first to make this mistake??? We were told the Marriott was just a short walk and set off with suitcases in tow. We were very hot and fed up when we finally arrived!! Immediately we were pleased.
