The check in queues in all the Strip Hotels are horrendus but we were served immediately at the Marriott. Our room was fantastic - probably the best room of the whole trip, It was huge with two beds/two baths/lounge/Kitchen etc. Views were superb. We could have moved in! Less than a block from the strip and very central. Had a swim in the pool then off to see Vegas again. No restuarant and only a very small roof top bar - seemed odd not to have these facilities but theres plenty of choice just outside the door. Would return for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Escape From The Strip, Right By The Strip”
Reviews.Author: geerdad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nearly perfect. We exchanged here from my home resort in Puerto Vallarta and it was a good exchange. My wife and I shared a one bedroom unit that was in very good condition (relatively new) and served all of our needs. The building is non-smoking, as per Marriott's policy. The roof-top pool was disappointingly small, but I didn't go there for the swimming. It was a refreshing break from the intense Vegas summer heat. The rooftop bar was good enough, although drinks were a little pricey. A little more food options would help. The only down side with the hotel was that there were no restaurants. They make up for that a little by offering a 24/7 convenience store just off the lobby. They started lobby reno's in the middle of our week there, but we were forewarned about that when we booked last fall. Great location. One block off the strip alongside Planet Hollywood. Relatively short walk to Aria for Viva Elvis. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott on the Strip, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Townie33
Reviews.Content: We have owned at the Grand Chateau since the inception. The location on the strip is fabulous. Situated just across Harmon avenue from Planet Hollywood, just up the street from MGM, and right across from the new City Centre; it is in a prime location. The rooms are impeccable. We own a two-bedroom, two-bath villa. Each bedroom has it's own flats screen TV. The living room has a much larger (at least 46-inch) flat screen TV. If we decide to use a one-bedroom unit then we still have the living room and the bedroom, so we still have two TV's. The kitchen is very nice. Plus you have a wash/dryer. Each unit is very well decorated. The staff at this resort is fantastic. They couldn't be nicer. They always have gone out of their way to make our stay the best it could be. If you have a car you must park it in the parking garage. This is a good thing. With the sun beating down on your vehicle all day in the summer it gets very hot. With it in the garage it will stay much cooler. There is no charge for the garage. But a tip for the valet is more than courteous. A major BUT comes into play when you go to the pool or exercise room. Both are too small for this facility. I have become extremely disenchanted with the pool area. While the Grand Chateau boasts "Pool w/Bar." Don't be fooled. The size of both the pool and bar and pool are miniscule compared to what is needed. And if there are too many children around there aren't enough drinks at the bar to deaden your pain. When we purchased here we were shown a beautiful picture of a pool above the parking garage. That has yet to materialize. All in all this is a very, very nice resort. We come back almost yearly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Timeshare Without The Smoke”
Reviews.Author: vacationloverchicago
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the connivence of a time share with kitchen,then this place is for you.You are one block from the strip,can walk to the cosmopolitan and easy access to the highway.They were remodeling the lobby and just sprucing up the place.Very friendly staff,always willing to help.Decent gym to work out in,and small grocery store in the timeshare.Big grocery down the road,and they have a shuttle to take you there.This is not a hotel,don't expect hotel amenities,casino,daily maid service,room service.But if you want the best of both worlds,this is the place.There is also free valet parking.The only disappointment is the pool,which is the size of a bath tub.They are building a new one in a year.By the way,we had a 1 bedroom unit which was very spacious,fully equipped and large bathroom,and faced the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but missing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Hoseroller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and enjoyed my stay. Driving in there is no self parking, but the valet are fast and courteous and they are quick to point out that the service is complimentary. The front desk staff was cheerful and very helpful. The one room suite was very large with a full kitchen, living room, huge bathroom, a bedroom with large bath tub and a comfortable bed. All of the other reviews here are spot on about the size pool and how crowded it is. The fact that there is no restaurant on site is an inconvience, but the small marketplace shop has most items needed if you wanted to make use of the kitchen and just across the street is a mall that has numberous restaruants to choose from. The only complaint I had was that the drain for the in-bedroom bath tub runs down the wall right next to the head board of the bed. The people above me had their early morning bath and drained the tub (it takes about 10 minutes to do) at 2:30 in the morning, other then that I really didn't hear much else. If there had been some kind of restaurant / breakfast buffet available would have made this an easy 5 star vote for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room... not much else”
Reviews.Author: lib88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a business convention located at one of the big casinos a couple of blocks away. The location is great. Close to the strip and great views. The rooms are clean and in good shape, and the beds still have the great Marriott quality. The price you pay is also strip quality and you would expect a lot more from a hotel on the strip at these prices. The pool is the size of a postage stamp. You would literally have more room in your tub because you share the pool with about 20 other people. There is no maid service unless you pay extra, except for a once every 7 day cleaning. No ability to park your own car in a self parking lot, valet is the only choice. No on property restaurant. These are the reasons for 3 star rating. I understand that this property has all sorts of plans to complete the resort, but there were no signs of construction except for the face lift the lobby was getting. The rooms are nice, but understand what you are paying full resort prices for partial resort amenities if you chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Dandric
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up here through our time share and loved it! It is about a block off the strip across from the Cosmopolitan and Aria; across the street from Planet Hollywood. Great location! The rooms were beatiful and spacious, very clean! We had a great view of the Strip from our room, a huge bath tub and double sink bathroom, and kitchen. There is a roof top pool, it is very small - but serves the purpose - the views are great and you can get drinks. The service was excellent - we would come back here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Stay Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: erykahte
Reviews.Content: When I 1st booked this 2br suite I was hestitate on how close it was to the strip even though I was told it was 100yds away from the strip. When we got there nothing but great service every car gets free valet service, when we got there before our room was ready so the bell desk held our bags while we walked to the strip which was only about a 1-2min walk & the miracle mile mall is directly across the street(less than min walk) Everything was great room, pool etc. The only bad thing is that the dryer in the room takes forever to dry but some of the floors have complimentary washer & dryers outside the rooms that were better than the ones in the rooms. Ah! one more thing we stayed on the 23rd & we felt like we were actually on the strip!!! Great deal & Great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tripitgood
Reviews.Content: First of all, I think it's hilarious that a couple of people said that this place was dated. It's about 5 years old and the decor is French. We stayed in room 2619 with a clear view of City Centre/Aria and some of Planet Hollywood. Nothing was worn, torn or scratched and everything was very clean. Bed was very comfortable. We love this place because it isn't just one room which is great for us as he likes to stay up and sleep in late and I am the opposite. This way he could stay in the living/dining area watching TV as late as he wanted. We were able to check in at noon which was nice. When we checked out, they let us have until 11:30am to get out. I guess that's subject to whether they are booked up or not. Our flight home wasn't until 7:30pm but they held our luggage for us at the bell desk until we left for the airport. There is a shuttle that goes to the grocery store Albertsons several times a day from Saturday to Tuesday. We took advantage of this but we bought way too much food and much of it went to waste. We had no desire to cook on vacation and there was just the two of us. Next time, I would just buy water, fruits and vegetables to snack on and maybe ice cream. We made a suggestion at the concierge that perhaps they could set up a food bank drop off box for unopened food items that guests haven't used while there, but she looked at us like we were crazy. Or even if there was somewhere we could have put the unused stuff so that other guests could have taken them if they chose to. Before you pick up groceries, you may want to see if the kitchen has all of the dishes/pans/utensils you will need for whatever you plan to make. Also, just a tip: If you take the shuttle to Albertsons, there is lots of shopping nearby such as TJ Maxx, Marshalls, Walgreens, Target, Payless, Best Buy and others. There is also a big mall maybe a 10 minute walk away from Albertsons (www.boulevardmall.com) on Maryland Parkway. These stores aren't nearly as crowded as the outlet malls and the fashion mall. If you aren't able to catch the grocery shuttle back to the hotel, you can catch a bus on Maryland and Flamingo (route 208, I think) by Walgreens back to the strip. I think you get dropped off by Caesars Palace so you can either walk back to hotel from there or transfer to a strip bus. The front desk staff was always very friendly and helpful. As other reviewers have mentioned there is no daily housekeeping service which was fine with us. If you want extra towels and sheets, you have only to ask for them. It doesn't take long to make a bed yourself. There is a room where you can take your garbage and recycling if you so choose or you can just put the stuff in the small closet by the entry way. It was great to have a flat screen TV (maybe 36-40 inch?)in both the bedroom and living room. DVD player in the living room as well. No problems with the internet connection and it was always fast. The pool is small, as many others have said. It was still refreshing though. It's not deep and you can't really swim in it but it was nice to hang out there for a bit. Everyone was friendly and chatty. Very social and intimate setting that you might not get at a huge pool. You probably wouldn't hang out at the pool all day anyway. Seemed like there were always empty chairs. There is a small bar there. Many bought drinks there but there were also quite a few people who brought their own alcohol to the pool and it wasn't a problem. There are misters above the bar and going pretty much all around the roof edge so it was nice to pull up a lounge chair underneath. Not really anything else to say that hasn't already been said in other reviews. It's a very nice place and it's just a 2-3 minute walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SavantIII_11
Reviews.Content: Marriott Grand Chateau is a premier Marriott timeshare resort. There seems little rationale in comparing and contrasting Marriott Grand Chateau with Marriott Ocean Pointe in Palm Beach, Marriott Grande Vista Resort in Orlando, Marriott Newport Coast Villas in Newport Beach, or Marriott’s SurfWatch in Hilton Head Island. All five of these Marriott timeshares offer superior accommodations on two different oceans and in Las Vegas. The geography of the Great Basin is vastly different from the geography of Pacific southern California, or central Florida, or the Low Country near Savannah, or the Atlantic Palm Beaches. Our two bedroom and bathroom condo is listed as 1252 square feet; this is not spacious, but very congenial for my wife and me. The villa has two king beds and two sofa beds. Because the Las Vegas Blvd. area is highly developed with timeshares, hotels, motels, and the recent CityCenter, Marriott offers elegant, guileless refinement. A tiled floor foyer extends to the kitchen and bathroom area. A full kitchen (smaller than some other Marriotts) is very well equipped with appliances, cook wear, and service wear. We tend to prefer morning coffee and an American breakfast taken in our villa, with options to prepare lunch or dinner as we consider various opportunities. Granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathrooms compliment the walnut cabinets. The villas feature the standard industrial grade carpet; the furniture and accessories tend to resemble French provincial, and are comfortable. The combination living room and dining room features a large, wall-mounted HDTV and DVD player with a broad selection of TV cable channels. Cell-phone reception is fine. The all-important Wi-Fi connectivity is complimentary, truly high speed, and flawless. Marriott’s designer (decorator) service is an expression of sophisticated elegance. Several framed mirrors and pleasant framed prints add some stylishness to the villas. The HVAC system is totally functional, and the mandatory washer and dryer enhance the vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “very nice appartments”
Reviews.Author: Gasser1961
Reviews.Content: Grand Chateau is in a great location, just off the Strip near the Harley Davidson café. It is very pleasant to come back at night to a quiet place without the hustle and bustle of the casino hotels. The appartments are very spacious, clean and well equipped. The only drawback is the size of the swimming pool which is very small so if you want to spend a lot of time swimming, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve at the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: atomSF
Reviews.Content: We liked it a lot. It is a half block from the strip and no smoking. While some Casino hotels have no smoking rooms, the smoke smell still seems to linger in the hallways and in the rooms. This is a timeshare hotel. My 5 y.o. daughter thought it was the best hotel in the whole world. She has stayed in over a dozen hotels. They have a small kids activities room with daily activities. It is a little hidden to the left of the front desk. My in-laws, who do not understand timeshares, found out how much we paid for the 2BR unit and wondered if we could do it every week and just live there. They also wondered if there was a volume discount. We were in a 2BR lock off, so we had a king and jacuzzi in the master bedroom, sofa bed in the living and a king and sofa bed in the 2nd bedroom. The living and dining area wasn't large and the dining table was at the door between the lock offs, so my in-laws needed to squeeze by. There was a full kitchen in the main unit with a kitchenette in the smaller one. There wasn't a fan over the cooking range, so the smell stayed in the unit. We had to leave the door open while cooking. The windows do not open, but they have a sliding pop up vent along the windows for air flow. Because the pressure of the hallway air conditioning was so powerful, we could have probably left the door closed if the window vents were open, to air out the unit. The valet parking is outsourced and they have like 10 cameras at the garage entrance to view all angles of the car and area. Valet parking is free. A couple days a week, they offer a free grocery shuttle. To get to the heated pool, which was very warm, on the roof, you have to go through the sales department, but no one bothered us. The pool and hot tub are small. We were able to see the New Years Eve fireworks from the roof. Part of the roof structure blocked view the MGM side. The Planet Hollywood and its mall are across the street. The Spices (I think) buffet there is very good. Todai is typically good for Japanese seafood buffet, although we didn't eat at this location, is across the street as well. The mall has its own water show, that the kids loved. They also had an area, where it "rained" along the wall way, every 10 minutes. I didn't go, but my in-laws went across the strip to Encore? and Aria, past Louis Vuitton, the new hotel and thought it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: latkwat13
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two teenagers and a 22 yr old recent college grad. We booked a 3-bedroom, 3 bath suite, which is more than enough room for 5 people. I expected the suite to be one unit. However, it is actually 2 suites--one 2-bedroom and one 1-bedroom. To my knowledge all 3-bedroom units in this hotel are located at the ends of the hallway. There is a main door that opens to a "foyer", providing access to both suites. In this regard, it is very private. The suites are very spacious and nicely decorated. Each has a sleep sofa in the living area, as well as a separate kitchen with full refrigerator, stove, dishes, pots and pans, etc. We only used the kitchen in the 2-bedroom unit, so that we could eat at the dining room table (which seats 8 people). There is a washer/dryer combination machine in each unit. I don't recommend using the machines if you need something quickly, as the dryers are not efficient. Each bedroom has a very comfortable king size bed. Comfort is what I expect when I stay at a Marriott hotel, and I am never disappointed. There is an option to have two beds instead of a king. The master bedroom has a large jacuzzi, double sinks, and a walk-in shower with a built-in bench. All the bathrooms are spacious. The view from the large windows is spectacular at night, as the location is only 1 block from the strip. My 15 yr old daughter pulled up a chair to the window each night to look out, while listening to her iPod. I would request a room on one of the higher floors to get the best view. The only negative we encountered was noise coming from nearby construction on the strip, and a banging sound above our room during the day. This didn't prevent my family from sleeping, but could be an issue for a very light and late sleeper. If a room is requested at the back left end of the hotel, it might not be heard at all. Be prepared for valet parking, as there is no self-parking available on site. There is an open parking lot across from the hotel, however. We chose not to park there for security reasons and to keep our vehicle shaded from the heat. We bought a few items from the convenience store, though somewhat pricey as expected. There is also a shuttle available for trips to the grocery store. My children and I used the fitness center a few times. It is well equipped with treadmills, each with its own tv; free weights; machine workout stations to target various parts of the body; and a few other nice touches. We visited the pool one day, but did not actually swim. It is a bit small. There were daily activites for young children at the hotel, but nothing for teenagers. Thus, we found all of our entertainment away from the hotel. There is plenty to do on the strip. Away from the strip, I recommend the Town Square outdoor mall (late in the day), Hoover Dam, the Grand Canyon, and the Barringer Crater. My children are fans of amusement parks. So, we also took a trip to Six Flags, Magic Mountain in Valencia, CA. Another choice is Knotts Berry Farm Amusement Park. I would go just to eat the chicken dinner. Overall, my family and I had a very nice stay at the Marriott Grand Chateau. I definitely recommend anyone choose this hotel--whether for business, romance, or family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to strip but peaceful when break needed!”
Reviews.Author: KNS1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a time share trade. It is only 1 block off the middle of the strip. Great location with spacious rooms including kitchenette. Valet parking (required) was very responsive. Pool is very small on the roof. Exercise room was great. Highly recommended for a peaceful stay as no casino or nightclub in the hotel but plenty are just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small pool”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithRiley
Reviews.Content: As an owner of another Marriott timeshare, I exchanged into a 2-br unit at this property over Mother's Day weekend. The location is exceptional as it's just a block from the strip by the new City Centre. The lobby area has a mini-market. All staff was very helpful & friendly. Here are some pros & cons: PROs 1) Location, location, location. If you get a higher-floor room facing the strip, you'll get a good view of the strip actions. I can see the new Cosmopolitan & Bellagio from my room. It's just a short walk to the strip & directly across from Planet Hollywood & the Miracle Mile Shops. 2) Free mandatory valet parking. 3) Exceptional high quality unit - fully equipped kitchen with granite counter-top, stainless steel appliances, higher-end cookware, washer & dryer. These are lock-off units. The 1-br side has a jacuzzi tub inside the bedroom. The bathroom shower has an awesome opposite-facing dual head shower with great water pressure. The sofa bed in the living room is not bad either. 4) Excellent security. To access the various floors, one must use the room key. This sort of prevents non-guests from roaming around the floors... although they could tailgate other guests. CONs: 1) The roof-top pool area is so small that it's a joke. When the wind kicks in, the door to the pool area is closed. I heard that Marriott plans to construct additional building(s) adjacent to the existing property and will have a bigger pool. 2) The pillows are ridiculously soft and small ... to the point where they don't provide any support. One could double up on a pillow but due to the small size, it's hard to stack them up. As an owner, I was invited to participate in a timeshare in exchange for some bribery (I opted for a visa gift card). The salesperson was not pushy at all. I immediately informed her that I was not interested in purchasing this property. So, the discussion was mainly focused on how to best benefit from Marriott's new point system. Overall, it's a great property in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HuskersLincoln
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau June 11 - 18, 2011. I will definately stay here again. Service was wonderful, everyone was very friendly. Great Location!! Valet parking was very nice. Rooms were beautiful. Pool was small but we always got chairs and it was not crowded in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families”
Reviews.Author: MamaDep
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located one block from the center strip, where the new city center complex is, and right across the street from Planet Hollywood. For a property that offers full kitchen and accessible to the strip, this place can't be beat! The property itself is pleasant, but don't expect the luxurious accommodations as the MGM Signature or Trump. As other reviewers have noted, the pool is small -- comparable to properties like Residence Inn and other 2-3 star hotel chains. It's not a "resort"-like property. Downstairs there is playroom where kids can play table hockey, video game, and there is a play kitchen area. They also offer daily activities for kids and adults (like craft making projects.) We rented the 3 bedroom villa and it was very comfortable for our extended family of 7 adults, 2 toddlers, and 1 infant. But it is more like a 1-bdrm suite plus a 2brm suite, which also means you get 2 living rooms, 2 kitchens and 2 washers/dryers! (Check out the Marriott Grand Vacation website for the floorplans.) In one the dining room, you get a table that seats 6. The bedding was very nice higher end Marriott property quality, but the toiletries were standard. In fact, no conditioner was provided. Also, save yourself the disappointment and don't expect an upgrade just because you're a Marriott rewards member. Overall, I strongly recommend this property for families and for anyone wanting hotel with full kitchen close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: aleLima
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was only one block from the strip. The only problem is that if you are not an owner you wont have a good view. Great for travelling with family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Pinoy123
Reviews.Content: Not Mariott timeshare owners but stayed in a two bedroom and it was nice. Everything was clean. Kitchen is convenient in Vegas if you bring food or run down to a local market. Some noise through the walls. A little walk to everything as it's a long block to the strip, but I could use the exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great rooms, awesome rooftop pool / bar”
Reviews.Author: Caryjames
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here four times and have enjoyed it immensely each time. It's located just off the strip and next to Planet Hollywood. It lives up to the Marriott standard and the fact that you can get a 3-bedroom suite is great. Full kitchens and in room laundry is a great bonus, especially with families. For something a little less hectic, stay here... You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm less than impressed with customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ninn4
Reviews.Content: Well, first off we're owners at this location so I would have expected adecent reception welcome and preferred check in. The start of this has been unwhelming. We were told there were no upgrades available on check in, fine. We were told to check our luggage, sure. Then we're supposed to wait 2 hrs. To check in. Again being owners I would have expected better treatment. I had to ask for entrance to the owners lounge only after I saw a small sign on a door. So far less than imPressed will write an update shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business”
Reviews.Author: Butcher1961
Reviews.Content: Tried to check in @ 3pm only to be told room was unavailable and they would call cell phone when it was ready. Went back to check in 10 minutes later with different staff member who allocated room immediately! Not a good start but it got better. 1 bedroom suite was roomy and well furnished. Full kitchen and laundry well suited for live in family but perhaps not necessary for solo traveller who eats out every night. No restuarant in hotel and roof top bar/pool was OK for drinks/nibbles. Overall service etc.... was acceptable and would return again

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, CLEAN, GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Babakk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 night,and I loved it there was 4 of us, very clean, east check in/outs great friendly staff very clean gym ( not that used it though) overal a great experience, will def go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: koro25
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 11am in the morning and was able to check in. For Marriott gold/platinum members, there is no upgrades so you will get which ever type of room you booked. One thing I did notice is frequently the bell boys are not available to assist you with luggage as they also perform the valet function. So if you are looking for someone to assist you with your bags, you may need to wait a little till they are free. We got the standard room with king bed. The room was quite big. In normal hotels it equivalent to junior suite. There was a small kitchenette which microwave and fridge, table and sofa. Got the airport view on the 15th floor. Rooms were very clean and inviting especially after a long day walking around in the heat. There are no restaurants or lounges in this property, but there is the 'miracle mile' shopping center just few minutes away, and the strip is 5 mins walk. The hotel is smoke free and has no gambling machines anywhere, so its good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dcgp24
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great stay in Vegas. This is the 2nd time we have used a Marriott Timeshare. The entire place was very clean and quiet. It is just the right distance off the strip and the MGM Grand was just a block away. A lot of the big hotels are with walking distance. Valet parking was great and the resort staff was professional. Not a lot for kids to do at the resort. They have some activities but not very much. The pool area is very small but was told they plan on putting in a new pool area with in the next 18 months. Spent most of the time seeing the sights: Red Rock Canyon (awesome), Hoover Dam, Circus Circus, and a number of Vegas shows. Overall a great vacation. We rented a car which made it easier and quicker to get to the area attractions. Most of the other hotels and casinos have self parking for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: houghtkw
Reviews.Content: Don't believe what "sonalbhatia74" says below. Obviously, this guy had some expectations that were not available and gave a low rating. But ones expectations should be considered before selecting a property. If they don't meet your expectations, don't stay there and then write a poor review. In any regard, I have been staying in Vegas several times a year for 25 years. Although I have been a Marriott owner for many many years, I always stayed somewhere on the strip. Once I got a deal at the Mirage for a small suite that cost around $250.00 off season. It was nice, but when you consider what you get here for the price/points, it is far beyond what you could get anywhere on the strip. A two bedroom unit is over 1200 Sq.ft. It is a great place to stay. It is not a Hotel, it is a timeshare/condo. Don't expect room service, clean up and all the stuff you get at a hotel. If you need such things, stay at a hotel. It costs quite a bit more at a hotel, but you will get what hotels offer. I think "sonalbhatia74" thought he was getting a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place right off the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: mrsp-alisoviejo
Reviews.Content: We needed to use a timeshare week that we had deposited with Interval International before it expired so we chose this Marriott property. We have have good luck with Marriott Timeshare properties in the past. This was a great location. Nice two bedroom with living area and full kitchen. The strip has a lot going on and this was a nice place to recover after a long day of sights, sounds and smokey smells. The big disappointment was the pool. It is small and shallow and there was no shade. They let you use the Polo House's rooftop pool and kiddie play area. It is not much bigger but at least the Polo House has some cabanas for shade. We spent 6 nights at the Marriott. To treat the kids we spent the money on one night at Mandalay Bay and enjoyed two days of their extraordinary pools, wave pool and lazy river. That was the kids favorite part of the week. The downside of Mandalay Bay was the noisy and small room and we couldn't wait to get back to the quiet of the Marriott for our last night in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Yawn...nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: KBrogan
Reviews.Content: The photo of the pool area that is shown on the Trip Advisor website makes the area look big, but it's tiny. There are a lot more lounge chairs all fighting for their space in the sun (no shade at all.) Didn't bother going into the pool (too small for me and the ten kids already in it.) The fitness room was nice and had televisions on each machine which I really liked since it helped to pass the time. The fitness room did get busy so time your workout either early or late if you want some 'me time.' Other than that...no amenities that warmed my cockles. Our room had a queen and sofa bed, small frig, microwave, dishes and regular size bathroom (no jacuzzi.) The maid brought us towels each day and made the bed. It really felt more like we were in a motel than a time share/resort. In fact, I've stayed at motels with nicer amenities. The front staff was nice enough, but the tour staff seemed bored with their jobs and did little to assist us besides hand us a sheet with restaurants that would give you a discount if you showed them the Marriott hotel card. Problem was that they did't put the address of these restaurants on the sheet so it was virtually useless. The parking staff were very nice and they park your car for 'free'...obviously, you should give them a tip when they retrieve your car. The best thing about the "resort" was its location near the shopping mall across the street and several nice theme hotels. We were a block from the strip and well within walking distance of numerous casinos, restaurants and shops. In fact, across the street in the mall you can get a great breakfast for $7 from several restaurants that offer great deals. We went to the time share spiel and we had to spend two hours rather than the 90 minutes suggested but the salesman was nice and he didn't pressure us. They did show us the plans for the resort and apparently when it is done it will have a reall pool and other amenities. It was a great value for us because we got four days and three nights for $150, but if I were a Marriott member, I'd be upset because this hotel is nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel ... Horrible service ... This palce is like an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: sonalbhatia74
Reviews.Content: I am Marriott Platinum member and booked this hotel for 5 nights. I had the worst possible hotel experience and checked out after 2 nights. The hotel website makes it look "Grand" but in reality, this place is worse than a motel. The room decor is bad and outdated. The pool is tiny and there is no restaurant or room service. For my 3 days of stay, the pool was closed. Apparently, the hotel was struggling with getting rid of "bees". I feel bad for the time share owners at this property MARRIOTT ELITE MEMBERS NOTE THAT NONE OF OUR ELITE PREVILEGES ARE APPLICABLE HERE. The hotel staff is rude. I had a week in advance to request an early check in and was assured. But at check in, the front desk attendent told me that they are too busy and my request can't be honored. The staff didn't have the courtsey to even apologize. I had also requested a room on a high floor at the time of booking but was given a room on 7th floor. The front desk attendant told me that Marriott Elite Previleges are not applicable at Marriott Vacation Club. I am never again staying again at a Marriott Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value for families but lacking in amenities.”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Chateau for three nights as a group of four adults and two kids. We chose this property because of the price and also because of the two bedroom units. We found that there are simply very few options in this price range if you want to guarantee two connecting or adjoining rooms. All things considered, the location is convenient. It's across the street from the Planet Hollywood mall, and a 10 minute walk to the Bellagio fountains and the new City Center complex. It's pretty good considering Las Vegas blocks are massive, and it can take 10 minutes to get out of some other massive resorts. We got a two bedroom, two bath room. The room itself was nice, clean, and decently sized, but not luxurious. The room had a full kitchen plus a kitchenette in one of the bedrooms. A typical timeshare "lock-out" layout. The master bedroom had a separate double-showerhead shower, and a deep soaking bath for two *in the sleeping quarters*. Yes, there is a bathtub & a sink next to the bed. There was also in general too much furniture in the rooms, making the place feel much smaller than it really was. With six people total, we felt that we were always bumping into furniture. In terms of hotel amenities, the little convenience store next to the lobby was useful. The prices weren't outrageous, and it filled the basic needs for drinks and stuff. You should still go to the supermarket to stock up, but it's nice to not have to go out. The valet parking was also quicker and more reliable than I had expected. Beat walking a long way to fetch the car, especially in the desert heat. Two downsides. There is no restaurant in the premises, so you either had to make something, go out, or get takeout. I wished that it had at least a little cafe or something for when I felt particularly lazy. Then there is the TINY rooftop pool. Considering that this hotel probably targets families rather than partying 20-somethings, this is a big detriment. There were probably 10 people (mostly kids) in it when we were there, and it felt crowded. And it's 3.5 feet deep all the way around, so not the best pool for little kids. Finally, if you haven't read elsewhere, there is no casino here. I personally think that is a good thing, because it's nice to get away from that. All-in-all, I'll stay here again if I'm traveling with a large family or group. Just don't expect it to be Vegas party central.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the Strip in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dave98133
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop in our five weekly timeshares in the last three months. This was the last and overall the best. The location just off the strip and near the new City Center and other other big resorts was perfect. We had a 31st floor room with a great view of the city. The room itself was very nicely appointed with the tile floor, tile shower and granite counter tops along with the big soaking tub. It had everything we needed. This was the first place we stayed that had BluRay players and there were two of them for each of the flat screen TVs. I think the living room one was at least 47 inches. There were also lots of free movie channels like HBO and Starz. It was also nice to have free internet access and a washer and dryer both in the room and a common set on the floor for free use. We rarely saw anyone on our floor and never heard anyone. It was nice having the security on the elevators so you could not get to your floor without your magnetic room key. But it did allow going to any floor. A couple of small negatives were the small pool and pool area on the roof with no shade. The other issue was the valet parking. It was a inconvenience having to get the car through the valet but it was free. We did use the free shuttle service to the grocery store. You can also use the Las Vegas bus system and avoid the bad traffic on the strip. I expected to have to pay for some of these “extras” from our last experience staying at a hotel type property in Canada. It was a Delta timeshare property and they charged $15.00 per day for parking, $8.00 per day for the internet, the common use washer dryers were a charge and it did not have DVD or CD players nor more than one HBO channel. They did have pay per view movies. So getting that stuff all free at this Marriott was a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet space just steps from all the action”
Reviews.Author: calgontakemeaway90
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a comfortable one bedroom suite for 3 nights. This property is just a block from the middle of all the action on the strip but, provides a cool, quiet home when you need to rest. Parking is all valet and complimentary, and the crew on the graveyard shift is particularly hospitable to weary residents returning home late or leaving early. I loved the newly remodeled unit on floor 34. Everything is so clean and fresh. This is a non-smoking property; much appreciated after the casino environment. Can't wait to visit again. Hope it is soon.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything but without the madness!”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Gla
Reviews.Content: A family trip to Vegas to see some shows and the unique atmosphere of Las Vegas. As we had teenagers, and we are all non-smoking, I was looking for more of a family type of hotel. This proved to be a good choice. Also it doesn't have a casino attached, which was good as we didn't have to deal with all the people who would be there. It is a hotel, not hotel and casino. The location is good - walk through Miracle Mile shops and come out facing the Bellagio. A great way to start your trip is to see the Bellagio fountains the night you arrive. It is pretty central so you can walk down to Mandalay Bay or up to Venetian. We did both but also got taxis at other times as it is very warm. We had a 2 bedroom villa, good value, clean, well maintained. The roof top pool was also good for sunbathing. We managed to see O, Penn & Teller, the aquarium and Grand Canyon. A good place to base yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to celebrate a special birthday!”
Reviews.Author: mermaid30059
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Chateau was a very nice timeshare property. The rooms were spacious, clean and well decorated. It was close to everything-just a few steps away from Planet Hollywood and very closeby to the Bellagio. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We mentioned it was my friend's birthday when we checked in and they sent up a birthday card and some chocolates. We had a great time and would definitely stay at this property again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: JAS1947
Reviews.Content: Booked this location for a small family reunion and it was everything we had hoped for. There were four women in a one-bedroom condo and we had plenty of room. The location off the strip was perfect because it was quiet, and the fact that it was a non-smoking and no casino resort made it much more pleasant. The pool on the roof is very small so those with small children would probably find it inadequate, but we just went to the roof to lay in the sun and read. Customer service was outstanding - check in, valet, bell service, maintenance, etc. The best I've ever experienced. If we called and needed something, they were there in a few minutes and we received a follow up call shortly thereafter to make sure we had been taken care of. There is no restaurant on site but that wasn't a problem because we had a full kitchen and fixed much of our own food. Would definitely stay here again when in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but pool rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: stew1930
Reviews.Content: Four of us just returned after 9 nights in one of their 2 bedroom suites. Overall very good - rooms plenty big enough, one of the most comfortable hotel beds we've ever had, staff very helpful, hotel spotlessly clean and we had no noise at all from other guests. We liked the fact that we were just off the strip with no restaurant or casino - there's more than enough of them to be found close by and it made the hotel a nice peaceful haven from the Vegas madness. The small shop on site is quite expensive but OK for the odd thing. The big downside for us was the pool - we knew it was on the roof (38th floor) but had not appreciated just how small it would be. 5 people made it seem crowded and you could not move around much - you could only stand in it to read, drink, chat etc. Added to this was there was absolutely no shade from the sun and the beds were packed together (spent an interesting couple of hours gazing at a lady's ripe verrucca about 2 inches from my nose, one day). I know you don't go to Vegas to spend hours at the pool but in 100+ degree heat, it was important to us that we could cool off and the pool just did not fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: scornelius73
Reviews.Content: My husband and three kids stayed at the Chateau for three nights. The staff was awesome and the hotel was beautiful! The pool on the roof was especially cool!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: TrudySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Pros: Had the "kids" come down with spouses; rented a 3BR and 2BR near each other. Had a spiral ham and lots of water bottles, snacks available for "schmoozing" and hanging out. Very near City Center with all kinds of attractions; walking distance to casinos along the strip. Wonderful weather at this time of year. On the 32nd floor; what a view especially at night. Marriott hospitality and service always superb. Cons: VERY small pool and spa on top floor but plenty of lounge chairs and few people at this time so not so bad. Smoking allowed on this level since Marriott does not allow smoking inside of the building. (Great policy, BTW!)

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel - that is it....”
Reviews.Author: 2GiddyUp
Reviews.Content: This is suppose to be a Marriott Vacation Club, but have very few amenities. No restaurant, a tiny pool, a bar at the pool that seats 4, and the roof top area has almost no view unless you are 8 feet tall - oh, and it reeks of cigarets. The rooms are small, the TV’s are 27 inches at best, and the hot water was gone by 9 a.m. almost every day were were there (which was very concerning because there was almost know one in the hotel - we saw 3 people on our floor during a 6 day stay. The staff is there just to take your money and that is about it because they offer nothing. I asked for some change in one dollar bills and you would think that I asked them to give it to me for free - they actually refused to give me 5 dollars in ones!!! This was unbelievable - the same person would not help me get two business cards for the hotel the previous morning (a habit I have when I stay in any hotel for address and emergency purposes)... Never again will I stay at this hotel. Since it is a Marriott hotel you would think the service would be better, especially since I am a Platinum Member 4 years running. If this is what Marriott Vacation Clubs are like you can count me out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: careerfair
Reviews.Content: Loved it! This place is in a prime location and has great amenities....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: mendoza830
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this Marriott 6/9-6/11. I reserved a 3 bedroom villa which is a great deal for 300 a night for 3 bedrooms/3bathrooms. They gave us two rooms which were catty-corner to each other behind a door that separated us from the rest of the rooms. So our big family of 10 propped open both doors and ran back and forth from room to room. We had 3 bedrooms, 2 sofa beds, 2 kitchens, 2 washer/dryers, 2 dining room tables. The room was fantastic. The staff was very nice. You don't have to worry about parking, it's all valet. The property is right off the strip, just behind Harley-Davidson, walking distance to pretty much everything. Every window had a great view too! Everything was very clean & new. My family agreed that this is where we all will be staying again every time we head to Vegas. Also, Excaliber is $25 a day for buffet. You can come and go all day until 10:00 p.m. It's pretty decent food. Big selection. I found that none of the buffets are any better than the others. This was a great deal, especially for a big family. Why spend 25 for each meal when you can spend 25 for the whole day?

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel but with a few small issues”
Reviews.Author: Mass_Traveler2007
Reviews.Content: The location next to Planet Hollywood casino and one short block from the Strip across from the new City Center complex can't be beat. The one bedroom suite we had was very comfortable, spacious and nicely decorated. The kitchen was clean and well stocked with pots, dishes, etc. The dual head walk-in shower was great, as was the large garden tub. The free wi-fi worked well. The fitness area was small, but clean and the equipment was pretty new. Also, the small locker area offers a steam room. Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. A few things to be aware of: - the lobby Market is VERY overpriced and you'll definitely want to bring your groceries or take one of their free shuttles to the supermarket. - the pool / Sky Bar area is on the roof with no shade and the Sky Bar is only open a few hours per day and doesn't really have much of a view due the high wall.

Reviews.Title: “Served its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Renda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott on points, so a free visit and arrived in the evening. We were taking a Pink Jeep Tour the next day at 630 AM. The hotel held our bags and car in secure areas despite us checking out while we were on our tour of the Grand Canyon. So, we would have liked a restaurant in the hotel since I had a broken toe and preferred not to walk on it. However, we wanted to go visit the Vegas Strip and it is very close. The views are beautiful from the roof; hard to see from the high edge but beautiful all the same. The pool is TINY, and so is the hot tub. You have to go to the 37th floor, get off and walk around the corner to another elevator to take you up to the 38th floor to the bar and pools. Interesting. The coffee pot in our room stopped up and caused a huge mess and no coffee; so we had to go buy coffee down in the store in the lobby. All in all though, we were happy. It was free !

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: MCMARE
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare in Mexico and went with 18 family and friends. 8 of us stayed here and we loved it. The service was great. The pool on the roof was wonderful and the rooms were very clean and modern. We will come back and stay here for sure. Quick internet, close to everything without all the hassles of right on the strip. See you soon for sure. No restaurant but thats ok go right accross the street for some great dining and good prices. Great mall right across the street from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but missing a larger pool atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: scanbarb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom - great rooms - roomy with all the amenities - kitchen, washer,dryer. Enjoyed coming back to the room after a long day and not having to go through a huge casino atmosphere. Great location- near all the attractions. Major miss - not having a larger pool area to relax. This was a major disappointment but otherwise we had a great time and the hotel has a great view at the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “FREE WI FI!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beckyjake123
Reviews.Content: AND WI FI IS A MUST THESE DAYS. We shopped at the local supermarket and stocked the full size fridge. On Wed., my brother-in-law comp'd gorgeous rooms, a 30 minute walk away, at Ceasar's Palace. All I could think about was how I would be hungry in the morning and I had a fridge full of food back at the Grand Chateau. My husband could tell I wasn't happy, so we walked back to our villa at 1:30 in the a.m. My friend and her husband decided to stay the night at Ceasar's. They awoke to find the coffee in the room was $12.00 and one cup in the food court was $4.00. They drove back to Marriott's Grand Chateau where a fresh pot of Peets Coffee was brewed in our own villa for pennies on the dollar. The Grand Chateau is gorgeous with all the amenities one would expect of Marriott. My all time favorite destination in Vegas, the atrium court in The Bellagio is a reasonable walk away. A "Ross" discount store recently opened on Las Vegas Blvd. within walking distance too, making any last minute clothing necessities bargain priced. The "Donnie and Marie" show is also within walking distance. It's a great show appropriate for all ages. The brand new City Center is directly across the street boasting over-the-top architecture and art. The villa was spacious and I contented myself simply people watching from our 15th story window. One negative, besides the sad pool, is the noise level. The Polo Towers are quieter. Did Marriott cut corners on window install? Seems like they may have done so. That would be my only complaint, and for sensitive ears, it might be a game changer.

Reviews.Title: “Fun On the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Meenu_Singhal
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay there in marriott , Good room having all facilirties as needed..on the strip and close to restaurants where i could get Indian food to eat ..just step out of hotel and you are in the most wanted location of world..the strip..take it on the best of money making machines ij Planet Hollywodd just adjescent to this property.. i had a great time there,

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if you want casino-free hotel”
Reviews.Author: kajain77
Reviews.Content: We went for a 15 day family holiday to US in April-May 2011. We were a group of 6 adults (including 4 senior citizens) and a 2 year old baby. I chose this hotel because we wanted hotel with no casino and a kitchen - we are pure vegetarians from India. We took a 3 bedroom villa. At hindsight, a 2 bedroom would have been sufficient. Pluses for the hotel are: - The location is great. Just 5 min walk to the strip and right in front of Planet Hollywood - Fantastic villas - huge & very lavish rooms and equally grand bathrooms: very comfortable and well equipped - Full kitchen with utensils etc - Washing machine and dryer in every villa - Complimentary wi-fi internet and very good speed - Conceirge sevrice is very good However, it would have been great if there was a restaurant serving breakfast. Also, the pool is quite small and that too on open roof. It can be quite cold there. Overall, i think this is a great hotel if you want a family holiday. In terms of cost, its more exepnsive than the hotels on the strip. But i guess that's the cost you pay in Vegas if you want to stay away from gambling dens.. I got a 25% discount being a elite Marriott rewards member and that made it affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 Days”
Reviews.Author: tffd01
Reviews.Content: I just returned recently from Las Vegas and had a wonderful trip. Here is the lowdown. HOTEL – Pros - Stayed at the Marriott timeshare facility called the Marriott Grand Chateau which was one block off the strip. Called ahead and asked for a high floor and got it. I was very happy that the room was ready when we got there at 11:00 in the morning. I have stayed at timeshares before and this was no different. We had one bedroom, living room with pull-out couch, kitchen and bathroom, no balcony. The beds were comfortable, the AC worked fine, we had garbage bags, laundry detergent, microwave, toaster, everything that you should have in the room. The hotel was clean and everybody is friendly. AND A GREAT VIEW from the 26th floor. There is a convenience store in the lobby which is open 24 hrs. and they have everything you need in a pinch. The hotel has a shuttle which will take you to the grocery store, if you want. Valet parking is the only way to go at this place. The valets are really busy, especially during check-in times but only once did I have to wait longer than seven minutes for my car. The pool is very small (remember this is not a resort) and is on the roof and has a nice bar. There was always a nice breeze on the roof and it was actually relaxing there. The pool area got crowded during “happy hour”. Cons – The girl behind the desk gave me wrong directions on my first day there. Luckily the valet gave me the right directions a few minutes later. The concierge didn’t seem to be much help. They didn’t know anything more than what I could have found myself on the computer. Location – Perfect location. The hotel is situated one block from the strip. It is within walking distance of five or six other resort/hotels such as New York, New York, MGM, Bellagio, and Paris. It is directly across the street from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops which is a mall with many restaurants. It was an easy walk for breakfast or shopping. If you like seafood, you HAVE to check out “Todai” – a seafood buffet which is in the mall across the street. Without a doubt, my best meal over the five days. We tried breakfast in the mall at a couple of places but it was really expensive and wasn’t very good. My kids went up the block one night for dinner to the Harley Davidson restaurant and they said it was very good (cheesesteak, burgers, pulled pork). We had lunch in the Mirage one day at the Carnegie Deli (pastrami, corned beef, matzoh ball soup) – delicious but, of course, expensive. We also tried the Bellagio Buffet, which supposedly is the best on the strip. It didn’t disappoint. The Mirage also had a dolphin and animal habitat for seventeen dollars which was very nice. They also have the Terry Fator Show which we saw. He’s a fabulous talent and one of the best shows in Vegas. The Bellagio Fountains was one of the highlights for me. I could stand there all night and listen to the music, which is choreographed perfectly with the fountains. There’s a show every fifteen minutes at night. And the Eiffel Tower from Paris is right across the street from there. Another highlight was the Barry Manilow Show at the Paris. He still sounds the same way he did thirty years ago. We also did a helicopter ride to the Grand Canyon with Maverick (separate review) and indoor skydiving (separate review).

Reviews.Title: “A very nice room if that's all you need.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a location just off the Strip. It is easy to walk to shopping, restaurants and casinos. The room was super clean, pretty and functional and had a great view of the Strip and street action below from our upper floor room. The hotel itself was an appealing oasis from the action outside because of the non casino, non smoking premises. The large lobby is furnished with traditional style art and furniture which adds a restful aspect when stepping off the street. This is a timeshare resort property, so for those just renting a hotel room, the usual amenities of daily coffee and housekeeping are nil or by request. A good choice is to procure ground coffee and breakfast items and take advantage of the small kitchen and utensils provided to dine in room. The hotel has a grocery shuttle and a small overpriced convenience store in house for supplies. The big disappointment of the property is that there is absolutely no outdoor space except near the valet stand. The smokers congregate near this area. The rooftop pool and bar is not up to Marriott standards. The pool is tiny and the very small bar fits about 10 people and is basically a smoking area. The rooftop gets very windy, and is not kept up very well. It is decorated with fake potted plants. There are views to be had but only by leaning over a high wall. This is a quiet, clean, nice hotel otherwise so if you need only a convenient location with a calm atmosphere this is it. The valet service is complimentary and very efficient and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to relax”
Reviews.Author: K_d_Social_One
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Grand Chateau and to sum up the experience in one word would be Comfort. The staff are super friendly, professional, and top-notch. It was hard for me to leave at the end of my stay. The valet team are not only quick to get your car (complimentary service) they were very friendly and offered to give you directions and suggestions on places to go (e.g. movies, dinner, etc.). The front desk, bell staff, and concierge were all great. Location - While the location is just off the strip it is a 2 minute walk to the strip, The Miracle Mile, and Planet Hollywood Casino. Room - Stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. Everything is there to give you the comfort of home. All you have to do is buy your food. Washing machines are in your room as well. The gym was nice. Looking forward to my next visit. THANK YOU GC for making my trip a good one.

Reviews.Title: “OUT OF THE CASINOS”
Reviews.Author: JulieRichardT
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in Vegas each year for the last 11 years, 2009 we decided to get out of sataying at the casino's so we tried Marriott Grand Chateau, stayed again last year and have booked again for this year. Excellent value, free valat parking, location centre strip right behind Harley davidson Cafe. Would highly reccomend this hotel to anybody. Home away from home full kitchen and in room laundry.

Reviews.Title: “great location and family friendly suites”
Reviews.Author: mukundan_us
Reviews.Content: stayed at these location three times so far with different members of my extended family and friends.GREAT LOCATION!!!Very friendly staff.24/7 convinience store!! no more time share presentations since marriott went the points route. Overall, if staying with family especially young children(yes people do take their family to vegas) this is a great place as you can keep kids away from smoke and slot machines while you experience a home away from home.Roof top pool is a cool feature.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AND LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: vb72514
Reviews.Content: My youngest sister decided that our 2011 family reunion was going to take place in Las Vegas, to celebrate her college graduation! There were 10 of us (4 sisters and spouses ranging from 21-34 years old, plus our parents). We booked two 2 bedroom villas (which was plenty for us! Each villa had a master with 1 king, other room had 1 king and a pull out sofa, plus a pull out in the living room), and the front desk agent made sure our 'villas' were across the hall from eachother. The rooms were a nice size, the kitchen was a full kitchen with a stove, microwave, fridge and dining table for 6, living room area with a flat screen and couches. One of our villas had a view of the strip, the other was of the mountains! This hotel was a block from the strip (2 minute walk) and across the street from the Planet Hollywood mall entrance. We liked this hotel because we could enjoy the strip but when returning back to the hotel it was quiet (there is no casino). There is a shuttle to take you to the shopping area and the market. We stocked up on groceries which was nice that we could make breakfast each morning. The roof top pool and bar are small but the view of the strip was great! The location was perfect, lots of dining options and the larger hotels/casinos. Cabs were also readily availible if needed, but for a limo it was only $5 per person! We took that one night to the Luxor to meet 12 other family members for dinner. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay here again, the strip is a short 2 minute walk, safe area too!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke free and close to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: BarryDryB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at both the hotel and timeshare sides of the Marriott split by a visit to Zion np. Couldn't fault the big room, hot tub, well equipped kitchen, huge comfy bed and double head shower. Superb smoke free location, knowledgable and helpful concierge, and easy to use valet. Loved the nighttime views from the roof and dip in their hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family stay!”
Reviews.Author: shelleyham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights. Centrally located on the strip. No casino but that makes it quiet and smoke free. Having a full kitchen was wonderful for breakfasts. Very clean. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Booring...”
Reviews.Author: nware1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a dressed up Fairfield Inn near the strip, this is for you. It's clean, and the service is nice. But, for most Vegas travellers - I owould imagine they want to stay at a cool resort. This is not that. One would expect a Grand Chateau to be.....Grand. Well, this is not. The hotel, especially for Las Vegas standards, is extremely blah and booring. The rooms were comparable to an extended stay hotel. The fixtures, decor, and big tube television were not near the GRAND part of the Grand Chateau. The only thing I think that was Grand was that it was 35 floors of a glitzed up Fairfield Inn. There is not a concierge floor, breakfast for Marriott Platinum Memebrs, or even a Restaurant on site. So, if all the other Resorts have the great food, activities, and nicer rooms - - why stay here? As I mentioned; the hotel was clean and the service was nice. But the place is booring, location is ok, and the rooms are extremely cheap. Luckily, I stayed for one night. I feel bad for the people who pay to be part of the vacation club.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Chateau ....large units, great beds, but NO FRILLS”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_M_of_NC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights and had an abundance of room, wonderful beds and pillows, grreat service, couldn't ask for more......that is, until you visit the other hotels along the strip.....oppulence, elegance, beauty, artistry. It depends on what you're looking for.....if it's simplicity with lots of room, great beds, great service then Marriott Grand Chateau is the place for you. If you love elegance then think about Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian Ceasars, or maybe Mirage. If you want a great pool, do NOT stay at Grand Chateau but rather Cosmopolitan (I think that's the one with the great lazy river). I think Grand Chateua is planning to add a new pool in the future, Also GC is not right on the strip but very close. It's adjacent to Miracle Mile Mall which you will walk thru to get to the strip. Not a bad mall at all! Eat a cheap but yummy lunch at Oceans One for only 5.95 , in Miracle Mile Mall. The pasta is fabulous. We did enjoy our stay at GC and much more economical.

Reviews.Title: “1st class”
Reviews.Author: LyndyNZ
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay..check in easy ..very clean spacious 2 bdrm apartment. We stayed for 4 nights...the staff were excellent and location perfect..good little 24hour store much appreciated..just off the strip and no casino...although we like to have a little gamble . it was quiet to come home to. If we ever get to Vegas again we would definitely stay there and recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Timeshare in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Maureen089
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas every year in the summer and always choose to stay at the Marriott Grand. It is located a block from the strip and right across from the new City Center. The rooftop pool is small, but the views at night are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Made Vegas Vacation That Much Better!”
Reviews.Author: davdaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Chateau with a group of friends for a long weekend in mid-January. We did some price comparisons and determined that we could stay in a 2-bedroom villa here for the same price as 2 hotel rooms at a nearby hotel/casino. The 5 of us (with some urging from me) decided that a villa would be the best way to go, especially since it included a full kitchen, dining area, and living room and was smoke-free. I'm glad we stayed here! We arrived midday Saturday, and check in was a breeze. We found everything clean and ready for use in our room on the fourth floor. The kitchen was fully stocked. The master bedroom had a king bed and a separate tub and shower. The second bedroom had two queen beds. The sofa included a fold-out bed, which luckily meant no awkward bed sharing would have to occur. We called housekeeping for linens for the sofa sleeper, and they showed up about 10 minutes later. The Grand Chateau does not have a casino, which makes for a quieter and easier-to-navigate hotel lobby. (It was like night and day compared to Treasure Island, where I had begrudgingly stayed a year prior.) The hotel has some timeshare properties, but luckily they were not in our face about it. Even though the Grand Chateau does not have a Strip address, it is across the street from Planet Hollywood and almost the exact same walking distance from the Strip itself as the nearby Aria and Monte Carlo properties. An unexpected perk of staying here is that, despite it being January, the roof-top pool and hot tub were open! Yes! Also, views of the Strip from the roof are excellent. The only sour note from our stay was the bedding: It appears that down bedding was used, and 3 of 5 of us woke up heavily congested as a result. I realize now that this is preventable, though, as the reservation system does ask for a bedding preference. Live and learn, right? Overall, I highly recommend the villas here! P.S. We didn't have a car for our stay, but if you do, be aware that this property has valet parking only. It's free (besides tip), but personally I consider valet parking a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis from the Vegas' Non-stop Commotion”
Reviews.Author: DJBrighton
Reviews.Content: This the place to stay with your family in Las Vegas! It's an easy-walking block off of the Strip, which is the perfect distance from Las Vegas Blvd. We had a party of 7, which included 4 children/teens. We booked a two-bedroom chateau, and it was just perfect! We were on the 25th floor (the building has 38 floors) and a had wondrous view of the Strip. The 2-bedroom units are on the ends of each wing and have four large picture windows (1 in each bedroom and 2 in the front room) plus another smaller window in the master bath. A giant shower for two PLUS a 2-person tub is in the master bath. Beds were typcial Marriott cozy. The place was spotlessly new looking - I couldn't find a wall scuff or a fabric/carpet stain anywhere, and I intentionally looked for one. In-unit washer/dryer and even a dishwasher included. The downsides? Rooftop swimming pool is very small. Location is about midway between MGM and Bally Monorail stations - so it's a 10-minute walk to either. No hotel food service. But contrary to older reviews, there IS daily maid service. Staff was great! It's a fully non-smoking hotel, but there's a designated smoking area on the roof (with a great view!). I highly recommend Marriott's Grand Chateaux for families in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff.....Lovely Rooms.....Small pool area......”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersFour
Reviews.Content: We just got home from spending a week at the Chateau. The entire staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We were especially impressed with the valet personnel. The only complaint I have is that the pool area is very small and crowded for the size of the hotel. If you are not at the pool by 11:00 a.m. you won't find a chair. There is no mid-week cleaning as we have had in most timeshare exchanges, but didn't need it. Really enjoyed the smoke-free atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quit Sure Why It Gets Such High Ratings”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Traveler_100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a stay here for one night based on the reviews here at Trip Advisor. I'm somewhat puzzled at the high reviews -- maybe the more spacious rooms are much nicer, but we stayed in a regular hotel room and were very disappointed. Pros: Service was very good -- there was no line at check-in or check-out, all calls to the front desk were answered promptly, the complimentary valet parking was fairly quick Location -- Centrally located on the Strip, walking distance to many of the other hotels, restaurants In-room microwave, fridge and dishware -- Convenient for breakfast Cons: Room -- Small and very outdated, especially given that it is Vegas. The beds were saggy & uncomfortable. For anyone that wants double beds, please note they only have kings. Checkout -- 10AM? In Vegas? Lack of restaurants -- There are no restaurants, room service, or any type of food in the hotel Overall, for the price we paid (over $200/night), we expected much more. At that price point in Las Vegas, there are many options available that are much nicer. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time here! Spacious rooms and close to amenities!”
Reviews.Author: ourcherishedlife
Reviews.Content: www.ourcherishedlife.com On the last leg of our trip, my best friend, Jordan, and soon to be fiancé (ahem…time is ticking), Mable, joined us in Vegas. We rented a spacious 3 bedroom villa at the Marriott Grand Chateau that boasted of 2100 square feet. We had a key that opened up to a tiny foyer that had separate doors to two units: the two-bedroom-two-bathroom-suite and a one-bedroom-suite, each with its own kitchen. The location was great as it was directly across the street from the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood and less than 5 min walk from the new City Centre and the wonderful shops at Crystals. They also had complimentary valet service which was excellent as do all the hotels on the Strip (a little known fact!). The one downside (some may see it as positive) to this hotel is that they do NOT have a casino and it is strictly a hotel. We were very relieved to find out that Planet Hollywood was only a 2 min walk. I like to roam the craps & blackjack tables in my pjs at any given hour and I like to stumble back to my room with the ching-ching sound of the slots so the lack of casino was a bit of an issue at first BUT I must say, it was kind of nice to have a smoke-free “oasis” to escape to each night (especially since it is so close to PH anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: 0003she
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent a week at the Grand Chateau and had a great time. The location is perfect for access to the strip without encountering all the noise and hustle and bustle at night. The rooms are a little dated decor-wise but they are certainly spacious and well equipped. The shop is a bonus, if a bit pricey. We didn't use the complimentary shuttle to either the Mall or the supermarket as we had our own car but this must be a great help if you don't have a car at all. If I have to make a criticism I would state that the pool are is way too small for a hotel of this size and that the drinks seem to be watered down in the bar. However, it would not put me off from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Grand Chateau!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyKouple
Reviews.Content: As Marriott owners at the Grand Chateau, we are always amazed at their attention to detail, the cleanliness of the facility and the friendliness of the staff. Every single detail was just perfect. I asked for a room on a high floor with a nice view of the strip and they put us up on the 33rd floor overlooking City Center. The view each night was sometimes the highlight of the day. With the opening of the Cosmopolitan and City Center it is truly the best location in Vegas. Good job Marriott! Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing way to do Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Archer11
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers lovely one bedroom suites that are perfect for long trips. The full kitchen helped us save money on breakfast and the living area was a nice place to enjoy some wine (admittedly, Two Buck Chuck from the local Trader Joe's) before heading out to the strip. Little things - like having a corkscrew and laundry basket provided - made it feel less like a hotel and more like a condo. On the downside, our room looked almost directly into the Planet Hollywood Westgate, so the view left a bit to be desired. Also, we were really glad to have rented a car. The hotel shuttle to the grocery store had very limited hours and we liked having the freedom to check out some stuff off the strip. It's a little weird to have a mandatory valet (don't forget to have cash for tips), but not a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room”
Reviews.Author: TravelSneak
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Good location, attentive staff and the room was gorgeous. We had a nice kitchen, dining area, soaking tub, huge bathroom with nice toiletries. The only negatives about this hotel are the 10am checkout and mandatory valet (no charge but it's nice to have the option to self park).

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay for long Vegas trips!”
Reviews.Author: videokenomom
Reviews.Content: After more then 15 years of hotels in Las Vegas, I decided to venture into the Timeshare idea on my recent March trip in Las Vegas. Traveling with my son and his girlfriend, I wanted a place that allowed us to interact without sharing the same room. What a wonderful decision!!! Located across the street from Planet Hollywood, it was a piece of cake to walk around the Strip and still be in a safe area. The 2 bedroom offered one king bed, another with 2 double beds and a sleep sofa. Full kitchen facilities allowed us to have breakfast every morning and to actually have a place for leftovers on the few times where we dined at restaurants other then buffets (check out Max Brenners at the Shops of Caesar's Forum for a very nice and memorable dinnner). A washer and dryer are also conveniently located in the kitchen area. One downside (if you want to call it that) is that all parking is done by valet only. Great and quick except you sometimes felt like you didn't want to pull the car out so many times a day, so a little planning was to be made :) They offer two complimentary bus shuttles - one to the Fashion Mall on the Strip across from Wynn and Venetian....and the other to a grocery store. For those not in the know, you can also order groceries online (Vons, Albertson's and a few others) and have them delivered at the start of your stay. Staff was great - especially the valet guys (Thanks Zachary!). It took some getting used to not having the convenience of a casino downstairs but I probably saved more money that way. No presentation of the timeshare was required...we enjoyed our stay without any bothersome sales pitch. Complimentary wireless internet - great deal with you consider that across the street at the Planet Hollywood timeshare, they charge $19 a day - per computer! Our 2 bedroom had a fantastic view of City Center and the Strip. I can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Joyce6262
Reviews.Content: Timeshare Resort, also avaiable to the public.. We loved it here, it was quite, close to everyhting, very courteous staff..Be prepared to spend 90 minutes in a presentation, it was well worth it they give a choice of 3 concerts to see..Rooms are a little small but was perfect for my husband and me, but they are very elegant..Kitchenette in room with microwave, and the best bed ever..If on a timeshare you need to pay for your room to be cleaned..You can ask for towels, sheets, etc at no cost..I give this a 5 star..

Reviews.Title: “Terrific room in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NolaHal
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I've stayed in various hotels up, down, and off the Strip, but feel I've finally found a place I'd be happy to return to again and again. The location is perfect: across the street from the Miracle Mile shopping center at Planet Hollywood--not for Bebe and the Gap, but the quick return to air conditioning--a block from Bellagio and City Center (Tom Ford, Le Cirque, etc.) and a $15 ride from the airport. The price is right, the rooms are large and non-kitchy (do you really want Eddie Munter's outfits under glass in your room?), the bed is comfy, and there's a little market in the lobby for your kitchenette. The staff at the front desk, front door and said little market were professional and cheerful. The housekeepers cleaned the room at the most convenient time for us. The fitness room had 20 or so aerobic and a full set of new weight machines: there wasn't a muscle group I couldn't exercise.
