Yes, at night there were (it was early Spring Break season) some rowdy-ish college-age guests, but the lack of a casino, restaurant and large, on-site bar kept that to a minimum. If you must hobnob with the well-dressed, foreign, over-50 crowd, then stay at Bellagio, pay the (this weekend) $500/night, and marvel at the light show from your window. Otherwise, spend less than half for a night at the Chateau and use the rest for dinner at the Eiffel Tower and a good seat at "O."

Reviews.Title: “Certainly "Grand" and nice place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: theooc456
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during New Years, using my in-law's timeshare. It was terrific! We had the suite with the master bedroom and full kitchen. First, bathroom was awesome, so spacious and the tub was huge. Bed was comfy and we loved how we had a kitchen to at least cook in, in case we took a break from eating on the strip. On New Year's Eve, they had the roof open, and even during the day it's a great view from up there. It's right off the strip next to MGM and Plant Hollywood - one minute and you're in the Miracle Mile Mall. It's a great place to stay if you want the accessibility of the strip but some quiet time as well. Overall, we really enjoyed our trip and hope to use the timeshare again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything and great room”
Reviews.Author: CatyRay
Reviews.Content: I've owned a week here and have stayed three times. Now that City Center is complete, there is even more available within a 5-minute walk. I don't bother with the car at night. The weather was unusually cool for this time of year (50s versus high 60s), so it was too cool to sunbathe by the pool, but the bar was open during the day and I used the jacuzzi and fitness center. Bed very comfy; I was in a studio this time, so just had a microwave, small fridge, coffee maker and toaster with dishes/utensils for two. I used the free guest laundry down the hall. Concierge was helpful, and mini-market open 24/7, with reasonable prices. I plan to go back in October. I really enjoy not having to walk hundreds of yards through a casino to check in and stand in a long line. Great for groups and families, too. Quiet, no drunks running around making noise!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaltonMiller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as we had a week to use through our timeshare. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa which was big enough for my husband and I as well as my mum and dad. They kindly offered to have the sofa bed in the living room area. There was seperate access to the one bathroom wich was useful so we didnt have to disturb each other during the night. The rooms were spacious and well equiped. The hotel itself was ideally located towards the airport end of the strip but just one street back from the main drag. The lobby and pool area was excellent as were all of the staff at the hotel. There is no downstairs bar only the roof top bar which has limited opening hours. There is a shop in the lobby which sells everything too. They also lay on a free bus twice a week to go to the supermarket and fashion mall. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved the roof top pool”
Reviews.Author: Jeans_Green_Earth
Reviews.Content: Right off the strip by 1/2 a block, which is perfect for a quieter spot. Great staff at the front desk and the conceirge. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Our 2 bedroom suite with kitchen was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best timeshare swap in vegas”
Reviews.Author: mortarman69
Reviews.Content: We have swapped to Vegas at least 6 times over the last 10 years and this was the best swap we've made. Great location(especially for us walkers), friendly staff, best beds and pillows in vegas. Had friends with us and they were overwelmed by the Chateau. Will definitely book here again. Had no problem with the wireless and I've got a old IBM thinkpad. Rooftop bar prices are high, but we didnt spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say that already hasn't been said.”
Reviews.Author: Jya-Jya
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the beds are comfortable, the entire hotel is clean, the staff is so polite..No complaints. It doesn't have a casino but I think we saved $ because of that. Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, MGM, Ceasars, The Cosmopolitan, & more are all in walking distance. We got so much exercise from walking too. Loved our stay here..we'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Adult GIRLS weekend in Vegas- AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: mrslisamasseron
Reviews.Content: I am a 27-year-old woman that had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Chateau with my older sister and our Mom for a long weekend in January! My Mom is the owner of an Interval International timeshare week, and we booked the room through them. Even though there were three of us, we fit comfortably into the "lock out" portion (regular guest room) with no problems whatsoever. We would normally stay in a villa with a kitchen, master bedroom, jacuzzi, family room, etc... but this was all that was available as it was a last-minute booking just to "use up" another one of our weeks we had banked, and honestly, we didn't miss the larger room one bit! The "lock out" portion is much larger than your standard hotel room, hands down. Plenty of storage space in the armoir and closet for clothes, and the bathroom is a real treat! Three ladies fit numerous hair dryers, makeup, shampoo, brushes, and toiletries comfortably in the bathroom with room to spare! One thing I DO suggest- bring your own shampoo and conditioner and soap, as the ones provided are, well, hotel quality. Especially if you are here for longer than a couple of days! That being said, the shower is wonderful and immaculately clean granite. They provide 3 large comfortable bath towels, and 3 small hand towels. We have no problem re-using towels from day to day for a long weekend, but on our third day, the maids cart was parked outside of our room and we took advantage! Ha ha! The location of the hotel is UNREAL. You walk out the doors and the Miracle Mile shops are right across the street. Plenty of shops, and restaurants with CHEAP, reasonable food! (We had breakfast 2 days at NICE restaurants for less than $6 per person!) The best kept secret of Vegas is the ABC Shops. There are TWO of them in the Miracle Mile Mall that sell beer and wine for REALLY cheap (Beers- $2 and Wine-$3-$4), and it is absolutely awesome to be able to walk around everywhere with open containers! Us being from Illinois are not used to that. We love shopping with wine! (Although we shouldn't make a habit of it- Oh my! Ha ha ha!) Last but not least, the rooftop pool and bar of the hotel is amazing. They had a "Happy Hour" special every day from 2:30-4:30 that offered spectacular views of the city. The drink specials, not so spectacular, but then again- the view was what we were paying for! We also capped off our last night in Vegas in the hottub on the roof above it all. We didn't want to leave! We cannot wait to save up a week again and return to the Grand Chateau- next time for the full seven nights! That says ALOT for Vegas- bc usually it tires fast! Not the Grand Chateau!

Reviews.Title: “very good location near the strip”
Reviews.Author: lucilion
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excelente suite with two bedrooms with all you can need to have a pleasant stay, even the wash machine in the bed is very useful. From the rooms within the highest floor you have beautiful views of the street and also is easy to walk in the bigs hotel near it- Cosmopolitan Aria, Bellagio, MGM, Paris, Planet Hollywood... But as we stay in the weekend of new EVE AND PAY MORE FOR IT, i think they should leave some gift in the rrom, like a little champagne, so as to say have a happy new year, also they didn t prepare anything special for that night at the roof, not even putting more chairs so we can site and see the fires. They dont try to make contact with the quests, the only time that I talk to someone in the front desk, it was in the check in and the girl didn t explain me nothing about the hotel. Maybe they could offer a drink to the quests in the roof in the new evening. The stucture of the hotel is good, but definitely they don t know how to make the quets as someone special, just you are another quest!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location, no services”
Reviews.Author: lr2522
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Chateau is located in a very good spot, half a city block off the strip, and just far enough away from the noise and traffic of Las Vegas Blvd. It is also centrally located along the strip, across from City Center and adjacent to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shopping area. Rooms are very nice with comfortable beds and pillows, adjustable thermostats, luxurious bathrooms with good lighting, and kitchen amenities. There are not many services available at the MGC. Services are limited to a small convenience store, a rooftop lounge, and shuttles to a grocery store and the Fashion Show Mall. There are also children's activities available. There was no daily maid service provided during our stay, nor were bathroom towels refreshed. We got clean towels from a cart that was parked in an adjacent hallway, but the dirty towels accumulated in the bathroom. For a fee, maid service could be requested. One problem we encountered during our stay was that the water system for the entire property was shut off from midnight until 6:00 a.m. on the day we were scheduled to depart. This was a major inconvenience as we had to check-out at 4:30 a.m. to make our flight, and we ended up having to cancel our last-night plans to go Downtown so that we could shower and prepare for the next day's travels. To compound the problem, we were not notified of this planned water outage, and only circumstancially found out about it ahead of time because we happened to be in the lobby printing our boarding passes when another guest was overheard talking about it. We went up to our room to see if there was a message on our phone or a written notification of the planned water outage, but neither were found... There were also an unusual number of visits to the property by firetrucks and ambulances during our stay. This was noticeable since our window overlooked the front entrance. There were signs posted throughout the MGC that testing of emergency systems was going on, and it's possible that the emergency vehicles were part of the testing. Overall, if you're looking for peace and quiet amongst the noise and excitement of the casino resorts and a comfortable night's sleep, this is a good place to check out. With the multi-bedroom availability, It is also worth considering if you are traveling with a larger group or traveling with children. Because of the water problem we encountered and lack of food service, it gets four stars instead of five.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, nice rooms but NO services”
Reviews.Author: VASoxfan
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its proximity and The Strip and its ratings on TripAdvisor. Most of what you read in the previous reviews are true: The hotel is only about a half block off the strip near City Center and the Cosmopolitan, the hotel is clean, well-maintained and smoke-free, and the rooms are spacious, modern and well-appointed. So why only a "3"? The hotel has virtually no services. There is no restaurant or bar except for a small rooftop bar that isn't open during cold weather, no room service and very spotty/slow wireless internet. Most of the rooms do have a small kitchen and there is a small, somewhat expensive market in the lobby if you want to cook for your self. Finally, despite being a Marriott Vacation Club, there didn't appear to be much to do for kids. If you're comign to Vegas with a spouse or other adults and plan to either eat out or cook in every night, this hotel should be fine for oyu. If you want a more full-service hotel with a restaurant, bar and room service, you may want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: drummachine82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great. We had a nice 1 bedroom suite which was really big. so it was no problem of space for us 3. the location is great to. just about a minute walk off the strip. definitely the best thing about the hotel is the pool on the roof and bar. from there you have a great view of the strip. apart from that it is one of the few hotels that don't have a casino which makes it more like a hotel. I really can recommend this hotel as u get a great room in a great location for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Soychicken24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in October 2010 using a week of my mother-in-law's timeshare, so the accommodations cost us nothing. The room was small (a studio) but very nice with a large bed and great pillows. Huge flatscreen television that we took advantage of for late-night movies. There was a couch, small table for 2, and a teensy little sink/microwave/toaster area. Not the greatest kitchenette but we were hardly in the room and ate out every meal but breakfast anyway. The bathroom was also spacious and had a lot of room to keep toiletries. The hallways were clean, spacious, and the elevators were fast. The lobby was very nice. There is a small shop for snacks and goods, but it was extremely overpriced. Instead, we walked to the Walgreens around the corner on LV Blvd. We did use the hotel shop for coffee each morning, which was only $1 if we saved the Starbucks cup from an original purchase. The hotel is located on Harmon Ave. in walking distance of the strip - we cut through the Miracle Mile Shops to reach LV Blvd. each day, which took no time at all. The cabstand in the front of the hotel quickly and efficiently got us cabs on two different occasions. We had a terrible view, which was one of the cons - we overlooked a parking deck and could see part of the MGM Grand as well as the airport. This view also offered some mountains, which I enjoyed most at twilight. Again, we weren't really in Vegas to chill in the room, so it wasn't that big of a deal. There is a super-tiny pool and bar on the top floor of the hotel, which we went up to see but did not use (it was a bit too chilly in late October for outdoor swimming). All in all, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: enma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott's Grand Chateau the first week of January. Absolutely loved the place. I typically do not like Vegas mostly because of smoky casinos/hotels. Marriott's Grand Chateau is the only place I'll stay at in the future. The place is clean, smoke-free and the service is excellent. The location is perfect. Right across from The Miracle Mile and Planet Hollywood and only about 100 yards from the strip. Because we had such an awesome, smoke-free place to stay I now like Vegas! We rented a car though it is not necessary. The valet parking is free (+tips) and fast. Highly, highly recommend Marriott's Grand Chateau. The only complain I have is the extremely slow (but free) internet. The pool is also very small which can be an issue during the summer. Traveling in January we had no desire to use it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: kayshu01
Reviews.Content: This modern facility provides 1200 + sq' of luxury, at the best location in Las Vegas. Starting with your experience of all staff members from the bellman to the receptionist, to the housekeeper and the concierge staff, everyone was extremely courteous and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and at home. The suite was spacious and spotlessly clean with a full kitchen, washer and dryer and was fully equiped with the tiniest detail in mind. Our vacation seemed so much more enjoyable because we lacked nothing in terms of comfort. The beds were luxuriously comfortable and the kids had plenty of room and the independence of watching/playing their games on the big screen flat TV. The location cannot be beat, especially for someone who doesn't like the crowds, smoke environment and the casinos. It is less than a block from the strip but well within easy walking distance from the new City Center. I'd say we had the best of both worlds. I was extremely satisfied and happy with our overall experience and have already recommended the facility to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Suite, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: cmlough
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay with our group of about 10 couples on a golfing vacation. We didn't have to deal with the casinos and smoke but were right across the street from all of that when we wanted to partake in the casinos and shows. We had a two bedroom suite with a living room, large dining room table and a full kitchen with a washer and dryer. We also had views of the strip. Every thing was clean and the staff more than helpful including the people at the concierge and the valet parking. We got a great price for our 2 bedroom suite with a kitchen Dining and Living room. We booked on line and had both of our names on the reservations. The other couple called to have their Marriott points used for their half of the room. When we arrived we were informed that we didn't have a suite but just a single room with one bed.. Luckily I had all the print outs for the reservations or I think we would have been out of luck since they were so full. Evidently you can not use your points for half of a suite so when they put the points on the room it reverted to a one bedroom room. At first we had a gentleman with attitude but we stayed calm and he went back to management and it got worked out. They tried to say we had to pay the available rate for that day with a little discount which was more than our original reservation rate. We quietly discussed (as we had been doing through the whole time) that it was not fair at all since we had not made any error but Central Reservations had made the error. In the end everything worked out. When traveling always carry your reservation confirmation printouts. We would go back here since the error really happened at Central Reservations. This is a great place with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Beautiful, Great Location, No Casino Smoke”
Reviews.Author: SFguy87
Reviews.Content: The Grand Chateau is one of the best values on the strip! Not only are you directly across from Aria, Cosmopolitan, and Planet Hollywood, but you are a short walk to Paris, Bellagio, and MGM. The best thing about this hotel is that you won't get lost and there is no smokey casino! Everything is spotless inside and truly arrives at the French theme. One downside: the between-room doors allow for a lot of sound to travel between rooms. We could literally hear every word of a conversation with out neighbors. We were upgraded to a strip-view room, and it was an astonishing view. Great deal that you should NOT pass up!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: alberrt
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to see the fireworks New Year's Eve in Vegas. Stayed two night in a "villa" room on 12/30 and 12/31 2010. Everything was very nice indeed. Better then we expected. When we are in Vegas will stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Romfordman
Reviews.Content: Booked this from the UK a few months ago only because we wanted a Marriott brand & did not know what to expect. Arrived and were upgraded to a two bedroomed suite. Really spacious lounge, big plasma tv in lounge - each bedroom had own TV - lounge had stereo, DVD player - dining area had large table and four nice chairs - kitchen was unbelievable - proper cooker, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, toaster, blender, shall I go on? Lovely reception area, good but pricey shop, clean - great staff & fantastic location - walk to the strip in five mins & the Planet Hollywood shopping mall (The Miracle Mile) is just over the road crammed full of reasonably priced shops & nice restaurants which do great breakfasts for under $7.00. Would stay here again tomorrow it is a perfect location and a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: BadBuddy
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in the three bedroom unit on the 29th floor over Christmas. Great views of the strip. A fantastic location literally steps off the strip and across from the Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile Shops. Nice to stay in a completely non-smoking facility. The rooms were large and the kitchens very well equipped. Ice makers in the fridges, dishwasher, microwave, everything you needed. Staff was accommodating and friendly. The only negative is the prices in the Marriott store-double if not more that stores just south of the hotel. Take the shuttle to Albertson's and save $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great units, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Imagemaker_10
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in time in Vegas before Christmas. We stayed in units 611 and 622 with our kids. We booked 2 units so our older children could have their priviacy and own good times We shopped at Albertsons after checking in, and got groceries forked of the week. We probably saved a thousand dollars over buying restaurant meals and ate well. While I have a few favorite restaurants that we still visited, it's nice to not have to restaurant every meal! We had a traditional Christmas eve meal right in our unit. It was great! We slept in some days and left after 3pm, several days, as if we were home. Very relaxing compared to just having a hotel room. The walls were a litlle thin though, I overheard a few arguments and a sexual episode as well. Wasn't a big deal. Overall, as I said to the desk, it was a good stay. It was a 3 min walk to the miracle mall and all the empties of the Strip. Loved our stay, will return.

Reviews.Title: “A family-friendly retreat just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelSavvyMomAZ
Reviews.Content: First of all, my husband and I really do NOT like most things about Las Vegas. We had a promotional hotel package that was about to expire, so we decided to make the trip despite our disinterest in gambling and late-night partying. We took our four children with us. Most of our activities were away from the strip (I highly recommend Hash House a Go Go on Sahara Ave for breakfast). I give this information so readers can appreciate what we really liked about Marriott's vacation club villas. We stayed in a spacious corner 2-bedroom. The room was clean, and the furnishings were comfortable and conservative (no Las Vegas flash). The kitchen was compact, but was fully equipped so we could comfortably eat meals in the villa. The dining table accommodated 8. The master bathroom was spacious and actually had a great view of CityCenter. (We had views of the strip from all windows of our 25th-floor villa.) Our villa was QUIET. A huge priority for me! No hall noise. And no traffic noise below (except for occasional sirens.) The Chateau is just one street off the strip, so if you want quick access to Paris or Planet Hollywood or Bellagio, they are just steps away. (I actually love the Bellagio's decorated conservatory and the fountain show.) But, if you want to avoid the strip (and if you have a car), just turn right onto Harmon to bypass Las Vegas Boulevard all together. (You can also take a complimentary shuttle to Fashion Show Mall.) The Chateau does not have slot machines or gaming tables; it smells fresh and clean (because it does not allow smoking); and it welcomes children. It has very few amenities, however, so if you're looking for an amazing pool, an on-property restaurant, or a spa, you may be disappointed. But if you want a family-friendly, quiet haven from the strip where you have flexibility to prepare your own meals, you will be pleased! CONS: Internet (complimentary) was frustratingly slow. Dryer took forever to dry even a small load. The little "convenient store" near the check-in desk would be a true convenience if the prices were more reasonable. PROS: Valet parking was quite efficient (and complimentary). The 6 elevators easily accommodated all guests' comings and goings. The fitness center was quite large. The lobby was spacious and elegant. Service was friendly and more than adequate (but not Marriott's best).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, horrible internet service”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: This is a residence club timeshare they are renting it out to the public. It seems solid and well built, very quiet for us. Very little in the way of fitness/spa facilities, but you get a kitchen and lots of room. Like another Elite Rewards member, I asked for a high floor and was given lower floor - was told all the higher floors are for timeshare members. Great location 1-2 blocks off strip and if you are lucky you can get a straight on view of City Center. Excellent valet service but fair front desk service - "this is not a full-service Marriott" they said. Beware -the internet service is VERY slow and drops connections. They did not seems interested in fixing it either. I would stay again though, good choice for retreat from Vegas insanity

Reviews.Title: “2 bedroom suites are an excellent value for large families”
Reviews.Author: CelineCeline
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in December, and booked a 2 bedroom suite, essentially a 1 bedroom suite connected to one of their regular rooms. The suite was modern, clean, comfortable, large and very well appointed. We had a full kitchen including a fridge, microwave, full range, and dishwasher, as well a washer/dryer in suite! The 2nd bedroom also had their own minifridge and microwave. The tile shower in the 1 bedroom suite had a dual showerhead and was very luxurious. My wife also really liked the separate ensuite vanity and sink. There is also an in room soaker tub which we didn't use but looked like it could have been quite nice to use. One slightly odd thing is that they don't routinely provide you with conditioner, we had to call down a few times to have our conditioner brought to our room, but they were happy to do so. We enjoyed the complimentary in room wifi (though it was slow), and having a kitchen was fantastic for the casual breakfast when you sleep in after a long vegas night. The fact that the hotel did not have a casino and is non-smoking was a huge bonus for us. There is no self parking, but complimentary valet parking, which was nice and a pretty efficient operation. All in all a pleasant stay, and we would definately return if we're back in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Impression!”
Reviews.Author: MyWay7783
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 traveled to Las Vegas for the first time to celebrate a special birthday milestone. We had a 2 bdrm and 1 efficiency unit. Our stay at The Marriott Grand Chateau was fantastic. From check-in to check-out the entire staff was pleasant and very helpful. The location is great (across the street from Miracle Mile Mall) and off the strip. The rooms were clean and spacious. The weather was very cooperative and allowed us to use the roof-top pool and bar one afternoon. Although I do wish it was bigger, we still had a nice time there. We liked having the valet parking and free wifi. We will definitely be returning and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay – just wished they would have gone with a more glamorous theme!”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip to Vegas to celebrate some big birthday milestones. We had a two-bedroom at the Marriott, and then added a one bedroom at the Planet Hollywood Towers, which is right across the street. We checked in to the PH Towers first; and we felt let down with our Marriott room because if felt frumpy when compared to the classy PH Towers. But by the end of the week, we all grew to appreciate the Marriott because of the significant difference in service between the two – Marriott (first class) and PH Towers (no class). The Marriott really should have gone with a different design for Vegas – something more contemporary or glamorous. The room was very traditional which is fine in Lake Tahoe, but I would expect something different in Vegas. The room was nice – our only complaints were that the kitchen layout is difficult (the dishwasher/sink/refrigerator area) and our shower was black on the ground and leaked. The shower has a “governor” on it, so I could never get it hot, which was a bummer. We cooked which most people don’t on vacation, and found the facilities good for entertaining. We had a washer/dryer in our room, plus another full size set right down the hall. The location of the Marriott was very convenient; and service, as with any Marriott, was excellent. Valet parking was free, and the valet staff was awesome. They seemed interested in what we were doing, and always ready with directions. We had a couple of maintenance calls (our fault, we locked ourselves out of our lock-off and we couldn’t figure out the washing machine) and we had immediate response to our needs. We never walked in or out of the building without someone greeting us. Our only complaint was that they were working on the room above us with power drills at 8:00 am. Seriously? Vegas at 8:00 am? Security was good, elevators required key access after 6:30. Internet access was extremely slow and frustrating, even after the front desk gave us a bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy Here! No Frills...”
Reviews.Author: sunbaby39
Reviews.Content: I am a silver elite Marriott member, I asked for a high floor and they put us on the 9th floor, there are 37 floors. We could here the Valet garage honking horns all night long. The rooms are small, we had a 1 bedroom suite, bed was rock hard, and the walls a paper thin, I could hear the older people next door blowing their nose, REALLY! I am disappointed, and I have learned a lesson. Always stay where you know everything is great. I will only stay at the MGM Signature from now on. A true 5 Star!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MMM2001
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for three nights while meeting up with family who were celebrating a milestone birthday. While I would not recommend Vegas for families with kids or teens, this hotel was conveniently located to meet up with family living on the East Coast during their celebration in Vegas and kept us out of the smoke-filled casino hotels. The hotel is located one block off the strip, so those looking for the Vegas Experience are steps from the middle of it all. Across from the hotel is the Miracl Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood, which was a good mall for shopping & dining with a teen. The room at this Marriott Vacation Club looked exactly like the rooms in two other Clubs we've stayed in. They were nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 5th floor and did not have any issues with noise. The bathroom was especially spacious, but only shampoo is provided. It would be nice if they also provided a small conditioner and lotion, but this is typical at the Marriott Vacaiton Clubs. Although the weather was not good enough to use the rooftop pool, we did go up to check it out. The walls around it are pretty high, so you have to stand against them and lok over to see the strip, but it's still a nice pool area. It's somewhat small if there are lots of people wantng to use the area, but includes a pool bar. A great plus was that valet parking is free to Vaction Club owners and those exchanging into the club. We also enjoyed free WiFi in the room and throughout the property. If we ever return to Vegas, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy.................rude timeshare rep”
Reviews.Author: rdopfl
Reviews.Content: Our sleep was interruped several times every night by very noisy sirens from emergency vehicles (we were on the 30th floor). We did the timeshare presentation. The rep was very friendly until we stated we weren't interested in buying. He then became very rude and resorted to high pressure tactics to try to sell us. Valet only parking is another negative. Never again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare-type studio resort Great value, standard & Location”
Reviews.Author: viajero_salsero
Reviews.Content: Beware of check out time 10am! We checked out on a Sunday, and requested for late checkout but front desk said no. I am a Marriott Gold and used to getting my late checkout requests, but look out for this because Vegas does get very busy all year long. Beware of thin walls ! When we checked in I thought we heard drilling and knocking sounds. It was during the day so I wasn't too bothered. At night we were having some sweet moments and downstairs neighbour knocked the wall 3 times to let us know that they heard us - but we were very quiet!! Other than those two watch-outs, of course the Grand Chateau has more than what you can expect - fully equipped kitchen, big enough sofa lounge for a family, washer/dryer and the whole 9-yards! Bathtub in the open bedroom - beautiful. Two showers in the walk-in shower room - genius! I was lucky to be put in the 35th floor (the building has 38 floors) , facing the strip, so I had a breathtaking view of Vegas lights - priceless! Location is superb. Cross the street and you're in Planet Hollywood. Miracle Miles Shopping is great to spend a whole day even if you're not quite a shopper. Paris, Bellagio, all within easy walking distance. Just park your car free at valet and walk! No casino, no smoking. I'm not a gambler so that don't bother me at all. May appeal to many who want some peace and quiet off the crazy Vegas strip!

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd stay and we love it.”
Reviews.Author: extranan
Reviews.Content: One of the things I love about the Grand Chateau is the location. Next door to Planet Hollywood. There's a traffic light for easy crossing. Planet Hollywood has the Miiracle Mile with shops and restaurants and 2 ABC stores, which are excellent stores to purchase water, snacks, sodas, beer and souveniers. Cheap. The hotel is w/i fairly easy walking distance to the Bellagio, Paris, MGM, New York, New York and right across Las Vegas Blvd. from the new City Center and Aria Hotal & Casino. There's an awesome shopping area in City Center, called Crystals. Very expensive but so lovely. Be sure to go to the roof on the 38th floor. Have a drink at the bar or just look at the excellent view. The pool is up there but it's really too small. They also have a jacuzzi. The valet parking at our hotel was excellent. Very short waits. Always very cheerful. Everyone is very nice and helpful. You really feel welcomed. The location is perfect. The accomodations are pure luxury. I love it here.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and plenty of room for whole family”
Reviews.Author: diamonisky
Reviews.Content: I got married in vegas, and booked a 3 bedroom villa for my family to stay the week in las vegas at the marriott grand chateau. My mother couldn't believe how much room there was inside the villas. It felt like being at home in las vegas, very comfortable. My mom and dad said they would travel with us more often if this is what the rooms look like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet and the Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: RadarGuyCT
Reviews.Content: The studio room was just right for two people. Typical excellent Marriott room plus a refrigerator and microwave. The tub drain was stopped up, but they fixed it quickly. No restaurant or breakfast place in the hotel, but they can be found across the street at Planet Hollywood. This place is a welcome respite from the usual Las Vegas monster hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large villa for so much less than regular Vegas prices...”
Reviews.Author: BrnEyedGirl
Reviews.Content: Right off the strip on a side street across from Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. Still perfect walking distance to Caesars or MGM. There is no casino in the hotel and that is a nice change of pace. It was quiet. There are plenty of casinos within walking distance. Non smoking. Service for taxi cabs is fast. There is an ABC store across the street in the mall so stock up on water, wine, beer, etc. to save some $$. We had a 2 bedroom villa with full kitchen. Will definitely stay here again. Great value. This is a time share too but we don't own here but got great rates through Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in the craziness!”
Reviews.Author: monandeclan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Marriott Grand Chateau that we exchanged into through a time share. The staff is WONDERFUL, the room was great and the lack of casino and NO SMOKING were such a welcome bonus. After a day or night of walking around and through so much stimulation, the Grand Chateau was a haven to return to. The valet staff were wonderful and very helpful with taxis and with the car we rented for one day. The concierges were also very helpful. The location is great, not even a full block back off the strip, right behind the Harley Davidson Cafe and across E. Harmon from the Miracle Mile shops attached to Planet Hollywood. In fact we cut through there many times to go to the Bellagio or that end of the strip. Oyster Bay Seafood and Wine Bar was a great little restaurant located in the Miracle Mile shops. The only detriment to The Grand Chateau is their pool. It's located on the rooftop and therefore very small. There is also no shade, no umbrellas. All in all, not a very welcoming atmosphere. We did have a drink up there a couple of nights. The bar closes at 11PM.

Reviews.Title: “Hurray, no smoking! (almost)”
Reviews.Author: lora-10
Reviews.Content: This is definitely an escape from the noise, smoke, and congestion of the casinos. My mom, sister, and I shared a studio. Fine for the three of us since we were out and about most of the time. The room was clean, but we did need to have our toilet paper holder put back on the wall when we arrived, and had to ask for suitcase stands and coffee filters. Otherwise, the accomodations were nice and comfortable. Although we weren't interested in using the pool, it is pretty small if that's important to you. Check out the view from the rooftop, but be forewarned - they put the only smoking area in the hotel up there where the best views are. Otherwise, the hotel is smoke-free. The only real negative I could find with this hotel was the ick factor of hearing other hotel guests through the vent in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend in Vegas - Marriott was THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: OKCyndi
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the GC and we LOVED it! From the time we walked in the door we were very well taken care of and had a wonderful time. The location is great - just a little off the strip - right across the street from Planet Hollywood. We loved that there is no casino in the hotel - the only people in the hotel are guests and staff - no random wanderers. The beds were SO comfortable, the rooms well appointed - nice bathrooms and kitchens with everything you need. I think one of my fave amenities was the washer & dryer - SO nice to have those while we were there! The only downside I can think of was the size of the pool - its is small - actually TINY. Your pool at home is probably bigger. Other than that this was SUCH an awesome place to stay - would definitely stay again if I could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “The best location and you couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: If you like your space, and you like to be away from the bling bling of non stop slots - this is your place. Suites in excellent condition, with lots of amenities, directly behind the miracle mile shops. Our 2 bedroom suite was clean, the pool and bar area were a great escape and we were centrally located to the strip be it north or south! Good job to all at the Marriott Grand Chateau!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: corpkid
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is the best deal going on the strip. I'm not going to re-hash what others have said, but know that they are correct - the location is perfect, the rooms are wonderful and spacious, the staff is very attentive, and if you didn't know this: They have a "grocery shuttle" that will take you to the local grocery store and you can get stocked up (for us it was wine, hors d'vors, etc.) that you can store in your fully loaded kitchen. It's like staying at your friend's vacation condo! I do love the Marriott Timeshares and this was not a disappointment! I have to give a thumbs up to our concierge who really hooked us up with some amazing tours, dinners, etc. Just a great experience and I will not stay anywhere else (and I've stayed at MGM, Caesars', Paris, etc.). Finally - it is nice to come back to your hotel after being in the mega-casinos and not have to walk though yet another. I would actually be disappointed if there were a casino-lobby in this hotel. It's like a respite from the smoke/crowds and is much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: NanaRose_10
Reviews.Content: Our family, consisting of five adults, three teenagers, and one child, came to Las Vegas for a 50th wedding anniversary celebration. We were totally surprised by the high quality of this hotel. We thought it would be an average motel-like place, but could not believe how nice it was. Everything, from the dual-head showers to the soaking tub, to the kitchen, and the amount of space, was great. The hotel was quiet, the lobby was not crowded, check-in was fast and efficient, service was excellent, and best of all, non-smoking! Our other relatives stayed at the Mirage, and while it is a beautiful hotel, we would not have changed places with them.

Reviews.Title: “if you need a condo on the strip this is your place”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: pay the extra $20 for the 1 bedroom, thats gets you a 800 sf suite with washer and dryer, hot tub, etc. The pool on the roof has the best veiw in vegas onlyh issue is lack of seating. Valet is free but they take their time beaging your car around, you get what you pay for. At the end of the day condo is the way to play, great deal vs. what you would pay for a hotel room at casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay that's very close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: lityerses
Reviews.Content: In September a couple of friends and I stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau in Las Vegas. The place is amazing and comes fully furnished with a stove, microwave, fridge, and even a washer and dryer. The shower has TWO shower heads, one on each side for maximum water pressure. The place is beautiful and is very clean and tidy. The service was great, and they even allow 3 people to stay in one room without extra charges. One thing though is that the hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the strip and about a 10 minute walk from the nearest casino, planet hollywood. This is not bad at all, although the 100 degree weather during our stay was unbearable and we decided not to stay outside very long. Overall this place was amazing and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a quiet place to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “can't believe I own one”
Reviews.Author: 808localresident
Reviews.Content: It has been several years since buying into this time share and we love it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay very close to the strip, recomend it highly”
Reviews.Author: Turbs56
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay was very surprised at the excellence of the hotel, had every convience you could need. No resturant but so close to the strip its not necessary. Does not have a casino so u can get away from the gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and spacious too”
Reviews.Author: busybeemk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with three girlfriends this my third trip to Vegas but first time staying at this hotel,swapping my timeshare credits with Interval. Great location just off the strip but very walkable distance to the strip around the corner from the Harley Davidson Cafe and a nice break from all the hustle and bustle. We had a two bedroom apartment, great full kitchen with all the appliances you need although we didn't use too many of them, washer and dryer were very handy, the washer takes quite a while to do a load but it did not matter to us. I used the Gym daily and it was more than adequate to do a full work out with various weight and cardio equipment. my only complaint was that the second bathrooms shower head was slightly blocked and someone elses garbage was left outside our room door for the day, but was promptly picked up when I mentioned it to the front desk. Otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel, it was clean, modern and spacious and quite but easy accessible to the strip, I plan to return in 3 years with my husband to renew our vows for our 10th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “The Venetian's Little Sister!”
Reviews.Author: enjoyurlilfe
Reviews.Content: This trip was originally a getaway for me and my LA Sisters! Things were not working out well..and I had spoken to a classmate of mind in Jersey, who was having some personal problems including 4th Stage Cancer! So I asked her to meet me in Vegas to getaway and relax, relate and recoup from life's hustles! She did...and I made this a Fantasy Getaway for her to remember! The Valets were perfect and would give you point by point directions to anywhere in Vegas! The lobby was just beautiful and the waterfall was a nice Attraction! The secure elevator key entry was reassuring! We have a private and secure entrance door to our Villa! The Villa was very nice with full kitchen, spacious, W/D, Flat Screen TV's and very plush comfortable beds and linen!! Also a great view of the strip, in which you can walk less than 2 blocks away! They had a lovely Skybar which gave a beautiful view of the Strip with all the amazing colors! So every night we would go out, come back and grab our swimwear and head up to the roof top Skybar! The pool was nice and not to cold and the sauna was just soothing and relaxing! So you can go back to your room... shower and go right to sleep! You just can't beat it! I truly look forward to going back to the Marriott, because it gives you a feel of home away from home! They even had a grocery store for food and snacks! I highly recommend the Marriott because it was outstanding and just a step down from the Venetian, just not as plush...but among the best! Also no smell of cigarettes and no noise, which is a total plus in my book! So come to the Marriott where you can Breath and Sleep easy and walk to The Strip!~,~

Reviews.Title: “This is definitely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: alison11702
Reviews.Content: We were told about this hotel by our travel agent (firesidetravel.com) and i went on and read the reviews and everyone seemed pleased. We are not Vegas people in the first place but had to make the trip for my brother's wedding. We were sooo pleased with this hotel. My brother's wedding was at the Aria and this hotel was literally across the street form it. We were traveling with our two little ones and stayed in the 2 bedroom villa. the room was so spacious. We loved the full kitchen and the washer and dryer. The master bath was beautiful. It was truly a wonderful surprise for the cost. The staff were so nice and it just made our whole trip better. As a mom, I like that there is not a casino and no smoking allowed in the entire hotel. No go go dancers to walk past to get out of the hotel! I do agree the pool is not really much of anything but at least it is water and kids don't care as long as they can be in water! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite in LV”
Reviews.Author: blueswriter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and a few nearby. Although this is primarily a "time share" property, you can book rooms for one or a dozen nights easily through Marriott, and unlike more expensive resorts directly on the strip, this hotel provides PRIVACY and LOTS of Room...especially the 2 and 3 bedroom suites. Perfect for family or a group of friends who just want a nice room to sleep and hang out in between all the other activities on the schedule. There is no casino, no smoking, no retail and no restaurants on site, thus no parade of obnoxious strip zombies wandering through the property day and night as in many other resorts. I used to enjoy the Westin Casuarina as a laid back alternative to the large strip resorts, but this is my new favorite hotel. Unfortunately, and unlike the Westin, the pool at MGC is postage stamp small, and often inhabited by families with young kids--so if you're looking for a poolside retreat to read a book or relax, this is definitely NOT the hotel for you...but the views of City Center from the outdoor rooftop at night are great and the rooftop bar is an added plus. Proximity to City Center and Planet Hollywood are ideal...just a short walk and you have all their restaurants, retail and gaming areas at your disposal. Valet parking at the MGC is exceptional, and you won't get swallowed crossing through the Las Vegas Blvd. traffic getting in and out of the hotel with your car. Overall the hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. There is a convenience store in the lobby for some food and sundries if needed. Suites have full kitchens, whirlpool tubs and washer/dryer units. There is also an ample fitness facility on site for a workout. Just about everything else you may want or need is a short walk away--and to be honest it's easier to get from Las Vegas Blvd. to your room at this hotel (off the strip) than it is to get to from Las Vegas Blvd. to your hotel room at most of the mega resorts, like Caesar's, Aria, Bellagio or Mandalay Bay. I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort and calm I experienced at the MGC.

Reviews.Title: “Worst concierge and customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: TravelingfamSeattle
Reviews.Content: Terrible concierge, sent us to the wrong event on the wrong time and date twice!! Wasted our time and carfare and wouldn't do anything to help us. We wasted two half days of a five day trip. The hotel is also outdated already, pool is tiny and cold, and location is inconvenient. You have to rent a car otherwise cross Harmon, a major road, every time you leave this one and half star hotel. It's not even a good deal, stay at MGM or Luxor for the same price. Or splurge for four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: N7UNN
Reviews.Content: Just a half block off the strip, Mid strip near the Planet Hollywood. No gambling on site, quiet and family atmosphere. Large spacious rooms full kitchens, laundry facilities in some rooms for saving money.

Reviews.Title: “Just off the middle of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: gebell
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel directly off Las Vegas Blvd that provides a calm place to stay in the center of the storm of the Vegas strip. The rooms are nicely decorated, with a large tub and seperate spacious dual-head shower stall. Full kitchen and stacking washer/dryer set in a closet. This hotel has a small roof-top pool, hot-tub and bar, and a small market in the lobby. Although it doesn't have a restaurant or casino, it it located next door to Planet Hollywood and a short block from the Vegas Strip. To the left is New York - New York, MGM, Tropicana, and Luxor. To the right is Ceasar's, Bellagio, Venetian, Paris, the Flamingo, Harrah's and Treasure Island. I recommend buying show tickets at a discounted rate from one of the many vendors after arriving. Although a car isn't needed if you're staying on the strip, we had a car to get out of the immediate area and took a day trip to see the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon. With our week's stay we had complimentary valet parking. Although the hotel has activities for children, it appeared limited. I would recommend this for those traveling as a couple or with other adults.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS I EVER STAYED AT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bucnbee
Reviews.Content: Okay, this hotel was AWSOME. Unfortunately, I am OCD and very particular about my surrondings, but this hotel met all my expectaitons. CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN. I stayed with my mother, husband, 1 teenagers and 2 kids. We loved it so much we stayed an additional night. The views were great and the rooms were grand! I can't stress enough how much I loved this location. Eventhough it wasn't on the strip, it was right behind MGM and eventhough it was a non-gambling facility, I will never stay anywhere else but here. You have to check it out ;o)

Reviews.Title: “At home in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: weezie68
Reviews.Content: A truly enjoyable stay with all the amenities of home. We rented the two bedroom villa, which was spacious enough for four adults, two teens and a baby (There was one king, two doubles and one sofa bed). Impeccably clean, very quiet , and very close to the main strip. Beds were very comfy. It is an ideal situation for extended families to stay reunite. We did our groceries at a Von's not too far away and enjoyed most of our meals at the hotel. The tiny market downstairs is quite pricey. Our only complaints...the pool was very small and our room was not ready until past 4:30 pm, even though we had asked for an early check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Treatsm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their timeshare rooms. I was disappointed that we didn't have a whirlpool tub but we did have a nice bathroom and a washer and dryer. We stayed in a 1 bedroom and we had Plenty of space. The kitchen came stocked with anything/everything you'd need for 1 week.The location is set back from the strip and it was nice to get away from the hustle of the city. My biggest complaint - the pool. What a joke! It was so small and always crowded with kids. Thankfully we had friends who stayed at the MGM and we used their pools.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean and Everything You Need!”
Reviews.Author: sdtovegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days in 2 Room Villa with 3 other friends and there was plenty of room for everyone. Kitchen was very nice and included all amenities. Check in was a breeze no line so it took about 2 minutes, it was about 11:30am. All staff was super friendly and made you feel like they cared. Price for room was a bargain compared to other rooms in Vegas and its just a short walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room and an immaculate accomodation”
Reviews.Author: DizWiz99
Reviews.Content: A Marriott Vacation Club resort, with the usual amenities, kitchen, laundry in your room, etc... Our room appeared to be brand new right out of the box. Great place to finish a vacation to the national parks. Get laundry done, dinner on the Strip and close to the airport... The rooftop pool was way too crowded for our tastes and it was boiling up there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: trtorres
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Chateau is a perfect place to stay for all occasions. Great for those of all ages and any type of vacation. We are Marriott owners and trust in the Marriott name and what it offers it's owners.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Annrod
Reviews.Content: The Marriot Grand is in a great location just of the strip and across the road from Planet Hollywood. Very well appointment self contained apartments. Pool very very small, gym great. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Perfect Location,”
Reviews.Author: lovelytan
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family to Vegas to the first time and I think we picked the best hotel! We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was perfect. The hotel was very clean and the hotel staff was very friendly. I'm really big on cleanliness and the hotel met all my expectations. The hotel only has valet parking but it never took more than a few minutes to get my car. I also like the security feature: after 6pm, you cannot get on the elevators without a room key. Hotel also has free wi-fi. As other posters have said, the hotel is at a great location, just a block from the strip. It's across the street from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Mall, and only a block from the Bellagio, Paris and MGM Grand. We walked through the casino hotels during check-in time and they were like mad houses with so many people!! It made us appreciate the Grand Chateau even more. We walked down the strip and were so tired we couldn't walk back, and when we told the taxi driver where we stayed, he said it was the best hotel in the area. As other posters also said, the pool area is a bit small. However, when we were in Vegas it was 115 degrees and too hot to be in the pool during the day! But the nighttime view from the rooftop pool is amazing! It's a great place to relax at night. I would certainly recommend this hotel to all my friends and I will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best 2 bed/2bath suite in Vegas for the price”
Reviews.Author: Wise_One
Reviews.Content: I got this thru an marriott/interval timeshare exchange so my price is a bit biased. All the amentiies of home with small washer and dryer included (ignore people who mark property down 1 star because they had defective washer or user operator error). Mine worked great in 30 minutes each.Anyway.... Granite counters throughout, jacuzzi tub, double head shower, very comfy beds and ALL within 2 minute walk to "the Strip" between Planet Hollywood and MGM. Living area was awesome and flat screen TV's throughout with fully furnished kitchen. Walk out on the strip in front if Polo Towers (next door) and by that day show tickets for half price. get there early before they sell -out. There was a rooftop pool/jacuzzi and bar but never used them so look at other reviews if looking for this. Best of all...IT IS SUPIER QUIET, no casino to meander thru to find elevators, not slot machines in lobby and no street traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Place to Stay"”
Reviews.Author: CountessCorn
Reviews.Content: Located just off the strip at mid-strip, or the 50 yard line as it is called, this hotel is in a great location. Because it is off the strip it is easy to get in and out of if driving and you take the street that runs parallel to the strip. The valets were attentive, quick and always helpful. It is a VERY short walk to the strip. Views from the rooftop are spectacular! Yes, the pool is small but there seemed to be ample lounge chairs. The rooftop has misters aound the outside wall that can be very helpful to keep cool (or cooler, if that is possible in the Vegas heat!). Staff throughout the building are warm and helpful. We had a one bedrooom villa - plenty of space to spread out and relax. Fitness Center is on the small side. Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile are right across the street and a Starbucks inside was convenient for morning coffee. But being on the Vegas strip, be prepared to pay Vegas strip prices. A little pre-planning and walking may be needed to get off-strip prices on food. Overall, absolutely great location, great service and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: Capemayguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Chateau the week before July 4th in a 3 bedroom villa. As timeshare owners with Marriott, we had exchanged into the location. This was our first trip to Vegas, and we were not disappointed! The Grand Chateau has a great location, set back 1 block from the strip and next door to Planet Hollywood. There are no casinos or restaurants on site and it is a non-smoking hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly during our entire stay and we had no complaints. It was nice to come back from the strip to a quieter, smoke free lobby and environment and enjoy our rooms. Our 3 bedroom villa was actually a 2 bedroom attached to a 1 bedroom and we had plenty of room. As we came with extended family it was nice that everyone had enough space and privacy. The rooms were nicely furnished; we had a flat screen TV in the living room, free wifi, stackable washer/dryer and all the amenities you could think of. Everything was very clean and in working order. The beds were so comfortable and what we have come to expect from the other Marriott's we have stayed at. The only area lacking is the pool, which is very small. We never had a problem finding lounge chairs the few times we went upstairs, and the view from the top floor is beautiful, but the pool is way too small for the amount of units at the Grand Chateau. Parking is done by valet and they were very efficient as there was never a long wait for our rented car. This feature is free, but tips were appreciated by the valets. We all had a great vacation in Vegas. We loved the Grand Chateau and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully maintained Marriott Quality”
Reviews.Author: TheGoodGuy
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Grand Chateau. It is located next to the Planet Hollywood Hotel and Casino, and across the street from the new City Center. It is very well maintained, the rooms are elegantly appointed. We had a two bedroom. The master suite had a luxurious king bed. The other room also had a King plus a pull out sleeper next to it. The main sitting room had an additional pull out. So, if there are two people per bed, you could actually throw 8 people into the place. Free wi-fi and some marginal activities for the kiddies. Valet parking only, no self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Picky Traveler”
Reviews.Author: billylen
Reviews.Content: I can be pretty picky. I like comfort, loaction, cleanliness...and on and on. This hotel (actually a timeshare) exceeded all my expectations! Located one block off the Vegas strip I could not be more thrilled with the location. Also the staff has been fantastic! I traveles with a buddy and got the two bedroom suite and the second bedroom is actually a self contained unit (lock out). The parking is valet and for some that may be a problem (I don't like others to drive my car) but there was something reassuring about the attendants so I felt comfortable. There is a little store and the gym is more than adequate. The only area that may cause some cpncern is the pool area because it is so small. I am not a pool person so that did not matter to me. Last note: I read many reviews before I checked. Most were positive to very positive. They were right, trust me they were (are) very right!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: FMJohn
Reviews.Content: We spent one week here over the 4th of July. The hotel staff was great. The 1 bedroom villa was perfect. The new City Center view and location is new since our last visit. The new view is amazing from our villa and from the rooftop pool. Great location near the miracle mile shops, restaurants, shows and more. The Planet Hollywood casino is next door. Close proximity to many casinos and more. Use the tram if you want to move around town easily. We are time share owners.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE IN A NONSLEEPING CITY”
Reviews.Author: LARCH180
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Marriott and had a great time . The room was perfect and had a lock out but never used the room. The valet guys were great and always helpful. The bellman Cecile, i think that was his name but anyway he told us of a great Mexican rest. out in the district. The pool was really small but did not use it much. The gym they have was very well equipped. The PH next door is not the place to gamble as the tables are high priced and not really a plush place. If you are looking for a fun time off the strip try going to Town Square south of the strip. Pete's Dueling Piano Bar wasa lot of fun. I would go back to the Marriott anytime. The timeshare presentation was really layed back and not pushy at all. We are thinking about selling another timeshare to buy into the Marriott. i would recommend tthis resort to anyone who wants to go Vegas but not spend all their money eating out and wants a quiet vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family right off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: PreferTheBeach
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous place to stay with your family or a group of friends when visiting Las Vegas. The rooms & bathrooms are beautiful and large. We had a 2 bedroom unit and it was very nice. We had plenty of room to stretch out and not feel cramped at all! Perks include refrigerator, dishwasher, washer & dryer and decent cabinet space. There is not a restaurant onsite, but they have a mini convenience store which is stocked with just about everything. Of course, there are plenty of places to eat on & off the strip. The concierge staff is friendly, but they have some things to learn about family-friendly places to eat - they steered us wrong on a couple of occasions. Of course, it is Vegas, so they are not really geared towards serving the little ones. :) The biggest downside of this place is the pool. When you read the reviews about how small it is, it is even smaller than that! It is 3'8" deep and can fit about 4-5 adults it in. It is not deep enough to swim - it is like an infant pool, no kidding. There are places you can go to that are open to the public (RIO is one of them), but it is kind of a hassle to have to drive. Another tidbit is they only have valet parking. While the valet staff is great, if you are in a hurry, you are just going to have to be patient. I would recommend going down early if you have reservations for diner or a show as they do not allow you to call down to get your car. Overall, it is a great place to stay if you can get past the pool thing!

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonMack
Reviews.Content: ...yes, except for the pool. We'll get that out of the way first. The pool is no bigger than what you'd find in a friend's backyard. There ARE lots of deck chairs considering the pool itself is so tiny, so if you're after a happenin' pool scene, this is NOT the place. There is a small bar, but happily you are able to bring your own liquids to the pool deck with no problems (other than they want you to have plastic cups, and will provide if you don't have them). This is quite unlike the $16 for a watered down margarita that melts in 11 seconds at most other places. Pool location is quite good though, on the top floor of the building with a great view. Tiny pool and VERRRRRY dirty windows keep me from giving this 5/5, but it's a VERY high 4/5. Rooms were absolutely fantastic. Full kitchen, giant bathroom and great master bedroom. Stock up on a few supplies and save a whack of dough, especially on breakfast! Location of the resort is even better than our personal (and still) favourite, the Signature. The Grand Chateau is right across Harmon from the PH Miracle Mile Shops. The ABC store, along with a Walgreens helped stock our fridge with 'essentials'. Btw, we traded our resort through Interval International with no problems at all. HIGHLY recommend this resort, and would welcome any questions. Oh, I read somewhere about access to the Planet Hollywood pool, this is no longer in effect.

Reviews.Title: “perfect except the pool”
Reviews.Author: lcf-guy
Reviews.Content: This would be ideal except for the tiny pool. This is very strange for a family type place. The 2 br villa is huge, luxurious, and comfortable for 6+. It has a full kitchen, 3 TVs with 100 channels, DVD, music, ....

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Samiloupepperell
Reviews.Content: An absolutely stunning apartment furnished to a very high standard. It waas great to be able to cook breakfast and make us of the washing machhine etc. It is also in a pretty good location fairly close to "The Strip", but far enough away to be pretty peaceful. A great alternative to the huge "strip" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for groups that want separate Bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: G8RED
Reviews.Content: This hotel/time share is located 1/2 block from the strip. You can either simply walk the half block to the strip or you can go into the Side Mall doors that have the restaurants and shops that are inside the Planet Hollywood Hotel. From there you are on the strip. We got two full bedrooms and a separate living room and full kitchen. Granite counters and the Master Shower was huge/large/nice and the master also had a separate tub from the shower. Our 2 Bedroom was configured with two rooms = the main room had a master bedroom separated from the living room and kitchen and then the second bedroom was open by the double doors (so the second room had its own bathroom and mini-kitchen area too). What you don't get is a room in a hotel where you are DIRECTLY on the strip. So if you want to literally step out of your room and go down an elevator that empties into a casino then this hotel is NOT for you. However in our case the 1/2 block was nothing and we LOVED having the separate rooms = one for the kids and one for us. Since we were traveling from the east coast the time difference made some of us want to get up earlier then others and this configuration was awesome because we could get up early and not wake anyone up. The roof pool area was nice too. From the roof you could see most of the strip and at night it looked nice. The chlorine in the pool and spa was intense and my opinion is whenever a hotel does that they are just being lazy (in other words by adding so much chlorine they do not have to clean it as much). Bottom line is anytime I am with family or a large group this is the hotel we are staying at but anytime I am by myself or with a small group of guys playing poker we will stay at an on the strip hotel. PS We did NOT like the Asian Seafood buffet right next to the hotel (it was the one in Planet Hollywood facing this hotel). It was way overpriced for the quality of food. Two of us got sick for one day from the bad food. Total cost with tip was around a hundred dollars for two adults and two kids and we did not have any alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to end our vacation”
Reviews.Author: ErinPB
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel that we stayed in during our Great Southwest Tour. We actually had a suite that included a full kitchen and laundry room. The room was spacious, and very clean. I was able to get all of the laundry done the last night so that it was ready to be put away when we arrived home. The kids were very disappointed by the size of the pool - it was what they call a "Sunbather's Pool", not much bigger that a personal sized pool and not very deep.

Reviews.Title: “Great time share value, good hotel choice for 3 or more guests”
Reviews.Author: goldcardluke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here through a time share, so the value was excellent. If there are 3 or more of you looking for a hotel then the value would be good also - as you can all stay in one suite. If there are just 2 of you looking for a hotel, you may find a better deal with one of the non time share strip hotels. We stayed in a Guest Room with 1 king bed and 1 sofabed. If you are staying here through a time share there is no cleaning or bed-making without paying extra. When you need fresh bedding you request it, and then make the beds up yourselves. The bed was very comfy, the sofabed not great but OK. It was handy to have the microwave, fridge and the shop in the lobby selling frozen meals, breakfast cereals, and sandwiches - these are features you won't usually get in a strip hotel because they don't want you in the room - they want you in their restaurants and casinos. Being able to get a breakfast of cereal and a banana for $3 helped with keeping costs down. For breakfast eating out, I recommend the nearby Ocean One Bar and Grille in the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. Pancakes and a cranberry juice was about $9 plus tip. We used the small pool most days and sometimes it was empty, but when it was busy you couldn't swim lengths in it - just really for cooling off. There was always space in the hot tub though. All round the edges of the walls and over the bar were cool misters, and a separate smoking terrace has one of the best strip views you will see. You can see from Mandalay Bay all the way up to the Wynn (the Bellagio fountains are not visible though). We never had to wait longer than a couple of minutes for a taxi, and City Center, Planet Hollywood, MGM Grand and Bellagio are all within short walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Family Accomodations Practically on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DestinyNewMexico
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas with a family of eight consisting of a kids ages 2 and 7 and older kids 19, 20 and a young couple and ourselves who are middle aged. We stayed in a 3 bedroom, however it was more like a 2 bedroom with a separate 1 bedroom condo-style, had to have a key to enter each, but also a main keyed door as well. Would not have worked if all of the kids were younger. All rooms are very 'roomy', perfect layout for families - we stay in these types of accomodations often and this hotel seems to have more square footage, ultimately home-like. If we could have wished for anything addtional from this property - it would definitely be a larger pool, the view was amazing from the top floor-38th, but oh my the smallest pool I've seen at a hotel. The Miracle Mile Shops are right across the street and the strip is just as close in walking distance compared to actually staying at a strip hotel. Very clean and friendly service. We stay at smoke-free hotels, absolute abhor smoke. Too bad people that smoke stay at these places and sit outside the doors to accomodate their habit. Inside the hotel is wonderfully fresh, clean air. We did stay at the Hilton Vacation Club for a couple of days also and comparately, the Hilton has a great pool area and the rooms were nice also, a little less square footage however and the locations was not as good. Marriott had free valet, which was great! Hilton charged $13 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of booking through Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: nitpicker101
Reviews.Content: While our stay at the Grand Chateau was fine, we did run into one major problem. We booked our room through Travelocity and booked the "one bedroom room". Upon check-in, we were informed we were being put in a regular hotel room, not a one bedroom. I showed the staff my reservation from Travelocity that specified a one bedroom room but made no progress. I was repeatedly offered the option of paying extra for a one bedroom. Our problem was never resolved. I have no idea if the problem is with Travelocity or Marriott but the hotel has an obligation to rectify it. So, a warning to fellow travellers to be careful about what type of room you think you're booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice suites”
Reviews.Author: sunny92037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Marriott Grand Chateau" for 5 days. We enjoyed the nice 1-bedroom suite with a small kitchen. The location is very convenient, just 1 block east of the Strip. Parking is all valet and free for the guests. The rooms were very clean and the decor was tasteful. Service was excellent and friendly. We also liked the fact that the internet access was free. The only drawback was that the swimming pool was on the roof and too small.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Marriott Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boombah1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our Vegas Vacation. Our room on the 32nd floor over looked Planet Hollywood's Pool and "The Strip" looking north. The hotel staff was wonderful. Our check-in and check-outs were completed in a matter of 2 minutes. We were always greeted with a smile and a hello by the valet staff. This is a Timeshare Resort, however we were never approached by anyone to tour the property for the big sales pitch. We traded our week from another resort to stay here. Marriott Grande Chateau was a great choice. We loved the location right off the strip and across from Planet Hollywood. The one bedroom villa had everything you could possibly need for the week as far as kitchen supplies, washer and dryer, etc....The only thing that would make this resort a little nicer would be a larger pool(Which seems to be in the works). It seems to get pretty crowded mid-day.However the pool area is well maintained. There are always plenty of towels on hand and hotel staff maintaing the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: KevinOhio
Reviews.Content: From the location, the Valets greeting you everytime you return to the Chateau, the front desk staffs friendliness and the Concierge's all being helpfull, this is the place to stay in vegas. one short block (a block in vegas can mean a long walk - this is short) to the strip itself, located near Planet Hollywwod and the new Cit center, this was the ideal place. The swimming pool is still the small tempoary one, but the Polo Towers next door is available for use if you need a big pool. The suites (this is a timeshare facility) are great roomy, clean and if high enough a great view. The Chateau has a free shuttle to the grocery store to stock up. They offer a transportation, dinner and show deal on Thursdays. "The rat Pack is Back" is the show and it is a good value. returning to an glass of ice cold water in the lobby is another nice touch they have for visitors. Oerall a great experience and stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel one block off strip”
Reviews.Author: almostretired42
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet comfortable smoke free hotel one block from the strip. They have a small pantry in the lobby where you can get prepackaged food to heat up in the room's micro and keep in the frig. For any other food you need to walk across the street to the Miracle Mile shopping center or Planet Hollywood where you can find whatever you need. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed and the workout facility is okay, although you can get enough exercise in Vegas by walking the strip and looking at the scenery (hotels and people). But if you want the "excitement" of Vegas stay at a casino property.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTAMember
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at the Marriott Grand Chateu. This is a decent hotel but it has its flaws. First of all, the rooftop pool is very small and there isn't much of a view. Also, the front side of the hotel can be noisy at night, with plenty of siren and motorcyle noises. The location is decent, not on the strip but about 2 blocks away. The staff is friendly and accomodating, especially the valet service. Having stayed at five other Marriott Vacation Club properties, we have to give this one the lowest marks.

Reviews.Title: “My second Stay here and still loved everything about this resort!”
Reviews.Author: CandyCaneCA
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here. This time it was for a girls' weekend getaway. My four friends and I shared a two bedroom villa and there was plenty of room for all of us. It is so nice to walk into the resort after a night on the strip on not have to smell any smoke. This resort is smoke free, except for a small area near the roof top bar. There is always fresh cucumber water waiting when you walk into the lobby as well. All of the bellman were courteous just like my last stay. Roof top bar and pool were awesome as usual. I love this place! I will be back again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “High-Quality Villas (Suites) at a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
