Reviews.Content: I stayed here both in October and in December of 2009. It is in a great location directly across from Planet Hollywood and City Center just off the Strip (literally a 5 minute walk). The construction that blocked the road leading to the hotel has been opened as of December. It is also important to note that this is a timeshare hotel. While Marriott is not pushy about their timeshare sales, this is also not a full service Marriott. Platinum members do not automatically get upgraded and there are minimal services on the premises that you would normally expect like a hotel restaurant. That being said, the free valet parking is an extreme plus for the hotel. The standard room is quite big and the villas are actually suites complete with a full kitchen, separate bathtub, and two headed showers! Views of the new City Center can be requested. The pool is small but the hot tub is nice. If you are looking for a hotel with a wonderful, expansive room and are willing to overlook the other full-service hotel amenities, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet...much recommended”
Reviews.Author: Gillt1
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week of April 12th at the Marriott Grand Chateau for our 10th wedding anniversary. We invited another couple to stay with us and we were very pleased with the room we had with the beautiful master bedroom and the spaciousness of the guest bedroom. Having our own doors to enter the split condo was a plus. We really liked the pool/spa and bar area on the roof of the hotel. The scenery is unreal from up there. Even with the hotel to capacity we never ran into noise or crowding problems. The staff was always courteous and took good care of us. The location of the Grand Chateau is very close to the strip and is nice that it in a quiet location traffic wise. We have stayed at the Mirage and the New York New York hotel before and really like how well kept this hotel is. 5 stars in our book! We will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Autum07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Marriott Grand Chateau the week of his sister's wedding in Las Vegas. My in laws are vacation club owners, so they had a room as did we. The 2/2 was spacious and the views from the hotel windows were breathtaking. We avoided paying too much in the Marriott shop and headed to the local Albertson's grocery store for supplies. However, besides breakfast and occasional snacking we ate out. The restaurants at the Planet Hollywood were all amazing, which made it very convenient! We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and it was nice to come back to the Grand Chateau instead of a normal hotel room since we stayed for 7 days. Made it feel like home. Oh and we brought my netbook and took advantage of the free WiFi - it was great for looking up things to do or places to eat last minute without having to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Grand Chateau!”
Reviews.Author: nwb
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners and this is the second time we have exchanged to the Grand Chateau. The location is excellent, the 2-bedroom villa is very spacious and comfortable. So nice to return and not have to walk through a casino to get to the room. What a treat to have no parking fees and free valet service for the car. The service was very prompt! It was the week before Easter and the Grand Chateau was full but we never heard any other guests!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fun Filled Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Retiredteacher58
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau in February and found the accommodations to be perfect for our group of five! We loved the size of the 2 bedroom unit and all of the features that it offered! The kitchen had all of the tools that we needed for our breakfast and lunches. We did not have any housekeeping services ,other than towel deliveries. They were very accommodating and generous with the towels! I found the location to be absolutely perfect! I initially had a concern about valet parking,but I soon discovered that the parking attendants were very prompt and courteous! We truly enjoyed our stay at The Marriott Grand Chateau and we're looking forward to staying here again in the future! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again, great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: AJHughes
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect, the bed was super comfortable, the bathroom was magnificent nice and large. Small kitchen with all of the utensils so that cut down on meals costs. The room had the kitchen, living room, bedroom and seperate bathroom. We were not disappointed at all ! We will stay there again for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Extremeley Pleased!!”
Reviews.Author: Ranshaw31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Chateau to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. It was our 1st vacation together and Vegas was a 1st for us both as well. The resort was perfect. As soon as we reached the front door, we knew we had picked the right place. The lobby was beautiful and checking in was a breeze. We tried the famous cucumber water in the lobby and liked it so much, we are going to try to make it for our 1st BBQ of the season. Every detail of this resort was impressive. We got one of the one bedroom suites and it was just what the pictures showed. The bed was very comfortable and the nearby large garden tub was the first thing my wife wanted to try out. The double headed shower was awesome! We had a full kitchen fully stocked with any utensil or cookware you could ever need. Flat screen TV's in the living room and bedroom made it hard to leave. On the 38th floor is where we got the best view of Vegas...on the sky...especially at night. The location of the resort was perfect, right off the strip but close enough to get to everything you needed to by foot. Oh, and make sure you check out the Love Brothers at the nearby Hawaiian Marketplace. They sounded real good and it's a nice place to shop and hang out and have a few drinks that you can even bring yourself. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: adamax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott's Grand Chateau for a week to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The place if fabulous! We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was like being at home, very spacious, a kitchen equipped with everything you would need. The best think is it's on the strip, walking distance to everything. Ther is nothing negative I can say about it, the accomodations are absolutely superb and clean. Excellent place to stay when visiting Las Vegas. The parking is valet complimentary, no hassel, free internet. Absolutely wonderful! Because of the great accomodations, we didn't have to run away from the room, but take our time in the morning, have breakfast, leave and come and go as if we were at home. Also, they have a complimentary shuttle to a grocery store Sun-Tuesday for those who do not have a car, and for those who would rather not use the car. Do stay there, highly recommend! Oh, yes, and the bedding is fabulous, clean white sheets and pillows and a comfortable mattress!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: panzer03
Reviews.Content: Right off the strip. Across from Planet Hollywood. The one bedrooms are great with the kitchen, washer dryer. Staff is very helpful. Upscale. It is nice not to have a casino on site. Pool is very small.Try Ellis Island . It is walkable and is a great rib and brewery.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venue”
Reviews.Author: acdc_10
Reviews.Content: For a trip to Las Vegas this venue has it all. Located one block off the strip between MGM and The Bellagio, it is central for most things, but far enough away from the strip itself not to be bothered by noise - great combination! Accommodation was clean, roomy and the staff were friendly, attentive and professional. Parking is all via the valet service who were consistently efficient and friendly when returning the car.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas felt like home at the Grand Chateau!”
Reviews.Author: sjmatuska
Reviews.Content: Took a gamble and decided to spend a full week in Vegas with my husband and in-laws. They have a timeshare through Marriott and invited us to join them in the two-bedroom condo. The room was great! Beautiful views (we were on the 25th floor facing the strip), spacious and all the amenities you need for a long stay. Loved having laundry and a dishwasher and the 2nd bedroom even had its own kitchenette. Service was wonderful, the staff was very helpful and we LOVED our poolbar bartenders! Speaking of - we got VERY lucky with the weather for early February and they opened the rooftop pool and Sky Bar. Sadly after the first day they started some renovations, but kept the loungers open to take in some sun, as well as the bar. We were able to use our room keys at both Planet Holleywood and Polo Tower's pools, however and spent a day doing so. By the end of the week they were done with renovations and we enjoyed one last day of luxery. The bar is great - open til 7 and the bloody mary's are to die for! The view from the roof is incredible as well overlooking the new city center and Aria. Valet was great - lots of recommendations and never had to wait for a cab. Marketplace has all you should need, but they do have a daily shuttle to the grocery store. Location was perfect - just off the strip but close enough that you aren't killing your feet with a long walk. Miracle Mile shops are right across the street. We had an incredible week and probably couldn'd have lasted 7 days without the Grand Chateau!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: G-father_06
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, away from all the fuss of most of the Vegas strip hotels. Convenient location, across from PH and close to many restaurants. Didn't realize that this was a timeshare property until I got there. No room service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location & Service - Light on Amenities”
Reviews.Author: huntmkdm
Reviews.Content: We went for a 2 night stay. It was close to the Miracle Mile. We walked to a couple of places on the Strip. We had to attend a time-share presentation which isn't ever what I want to do. Staff was nice but no restaurant. Room was clean but smaller than we expected. Road work was a pain. All valet parking which was quite nice except for the last younger guy with a sense of entitlement but not helpfulness. Based on location I might stay there again, but I'd probably try to find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: NOsnow-gottago
Reviews.Content: Loved it. We stayed in the 2 bedroom- the double shower was elegant and the rooms appeared brand new. Great views of the strip and city center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: apdarmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice from the time you walk into the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was a two bedroom villa. The room was very nice and clean. A large flat screen t.v. was mounted on the wall. It had all of the amenities you needed. The only things that kept it from getting a five star from me were the following: The shower in the master bath had dual heads. One of the heads would not put out any hot water. Maintenance was called three times but could not fix the problem. Also the dryer did not work right and it took about 3 hours to dry clothes. We took the clothes to one of the many free full size dryers located on various floors and dried the clothes rather quickly. Lots of noise from the hallway when people stumbled in at daybreak. The location was awesome! The strip was within walking distance and Planet Hollywood Casino and Miracle Mile Shops were across the street. Overall I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation away from the Snow”
Reviews.Author: redgeton2
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip away from the madness but right in the middle of everything. Great views. Wonderful and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from Marriott VC”
Reviews.Author: JB33
Reviews.Content: This was the 5th Marriott Vacation Club I have stayed at and I am a Hyatt Vacation Club owner (stayed at several). That said, I was extremely shocked at the room size (1 br villa), layout and amenities. If I did not have the experience or knowledge of what a typical vacation club property is like, I think it would have been great (my friends thought it was). When we walked into our room we saw our view was of the roof, with the Crystal Mall (beautiful) beyond that. It was my sister's first time to Vegas, so I had hoped for an unobstructed view. Given I also was not satisfied with our room layout (see below) I immediately asked for a room change, but was told the hotel was to capacity. There was absolutely no way that was possible. Our flight in was half full, the lobby was desolate and in the evening most of the lights were off. Our kitchen did not have a bar counter, instead it was all against one wall. We had very little counter space, which was a problem for food prep, being the three of us all wanted to pitch in. Our bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom, not what I saw in other traveler's photos, or the hotel photos. In other words, we did not have the nice jacuzzi tub or the beautiful shower I saw in so many pictures. With three females, it was difficult to get ready, since we only had one sink with limited counter space and the one mirror (no other mirrors anywhere, not even a full length). I was also surprised they do not supply conditioner or lotion. I never pack these items so that I can carry on for short trips. We did not trade through the timeshare, so we were supposed to receive daily housekeeping service. We were out by 10 am and came back at 5 to a room not cleaned. I called the front desk who stated we should have received cleaning, but service was no longer available for the day. I asked for clean towels to be sent up which never came. I figured I would call again in the morning, but instead took them off the maid cart in the morning. Wireless internet is complimentary in rooms (personal laptops) and you can print boarding passes in the lobby. Internet service is available in the lobby for a ridiculous fee of 35 cents per minute. Okay, let me throw in some positives. Friendly valets and bell service (not great front desk staff). Right across the street from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops, which have great lunch specials at their restaurants and ABC stores which are great for drinks, souvenirs, pharmacy items, and some grocery items. The rooftop pool area is great for a southern strip view. The pool was warm and the hot tub perfect. The bar was closed (it had been raining, don't know if that made a difference), but heat lamps were on near the tables and nice music was playing (this was in the evening). I think I would have been happy here if we had been given the room I expected, but since it appears to be luck of the draw on room layout (I'm also a Marriott Rewards Gold member....Usually receive upgrades and the better rooms), I don't think I would take the chance. By the way, if you read my other reviews I think you will find I'm not usually so negative! This place just rubbed me the wrong way right off the bat.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: tiff0807
Reviews.Content: We are interval international members and booked this week as an additional "getaway" vacation. The issue started there. This hotel has many floorplans.....different types of one bedrooms and different types of two bedrooms. Interval international's system can not differentiate between the different types of floorplans. It makes a huge difference. We thought we would be staying in the larger one bedroom, but we ended up in a "mini" one bedroom.....losing out on a huge soaking tub and a ton of sq footage....and a ended up with a tiny kitchen. I had called interval to confirm that we had the room with the big tub as pictured online....they said yes we did....and this was not the case. After noticing we were in the wrong room....the hotel manager said she could not move us because she could only use what was in intervals inventory....so we decided to stay and just remain in the tiny little room. The first night our room began to smell like dead rotting fish....we called down to the front desk and they said they could give us air freshener to spray....hmmmm we had a 10 month old baby in the room so this would only mask the odors with chemicals, which i didn't want to do. We asked if we could be moved, and she said no because once again they can only pull from interval's inventory and there was nothing available. The second night we called again...the smell was getting worse...they said they only had one engineer on duty and if they sent him to my room to come take a look at it then they wouldn't have him available for other needs in the hotel. At this point I became very frustrated and told her to send the engineer that this is not my problem. He indeed smelled the fishy smell but could not figure out where it was coming from so he walkie talkied the front desk and told the dumb girl to move us (after stating we'll just move you we have a ton of empty rooms). She refused and stated that there was no vacancy! Lets keep in mind we were here in Jan. Las Vegas itself was dead....and the hotel was dead.....there was vacancy she was just stubborn. At this point my husband said forget it....well just go home. It was 2 am and we began to pack our stuff....we called her again at the front desk and asked if there was ANYTHING she could do for us bc if not we were going to go home.....yes drive back to Orange County at 2 am with a 10 month old baby because we can't stand the rotting fish smell in our room! She said they could bring in some "Ionizing machine" but that we would have to leave the room for 2 hrs. So we decided out of complete exhuastion to leave our room with our baby and go drive around for 2 hrs until our room was done. When we returned, our room smelled like a gas station...a mixture of gas and oil....and we were too tired to deal with it anymore. We went to bed and woke up the next morning and called down to tell them our room still reeks and that we want to be moved. The day manager was on duty and he said, "oh no problem" I see here that you had this issue for days, lets move you! He called back and had sent a bell hop and new keys up within 20 minutes. The other girl had apparantly lied! He also moved us into the bigger one bedroom where we thought we had been staying anyways. From then on our trip was better although we never unpacked all the way after being moved twice and moving an entire kitchen of food/baby supplies not to mention pack and play's high chairs and all of our luggage. So as far as the rooms go....they are nicely decorated....nice TV's, furniture, and seem to be clean...the big bath tub can hold about 4 people, and really makes the room worth it....Do not waste your time in one of their "mini" rooms......it's like any ordinary hotel room with a kitchenette. If you have an issue at this hotel....LET GOD BE WITH YOU!!! It will depend entirely on the management staff that is working that day/night as to whether they will help you. The pool is not very kid friendly....it is a small simple rectangle pool but almost everyone around it is smoking and hanging out at the bar. The kids room is a nothing to brag about....they do not provide "cribs" as they will confirm for you over the phone....they are pack and plays....we specifically called to see if it was a crib or a pack and play...we were told a crib....but it was a pack and play....which if we had known we would have brought our own from home. They do provide high chairs. The only reason why i would recomend this hotel is because it is in a prime location....accross the street from the city and in between planet hollywood and the MGM. It is clean.....you don't have to deal with walking through a casino everytime you go in and out if you have children. Its up to date....except there is no desk in the room....so if you plan on taking a computer or working from the room (as my husband needed to) you will need to work on the dining room table or bring a folding table. Parking is ONLY Vallet also...so if you prefer to self park...this is not the place. Also there is no room service or resturaunt...but Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops are accross the street and within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Attactive, spacious, comfortable, near the action.”
Reviews.Author: RalphSchmitt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traded several days of our time share for 4 nights at Marriott's Grand Chateau. The one-bedroom suite was excellent: attractive, spacious, comfortable. I was surprised that there wasn't any maid service without paying for it, but that wasn't a problem. The staff was universally pleasant and helpful, especially the concierges in the lobby. The hotel was a short walk from the Strip, very close to City Center, Bellagio, etc. Cab rides elsewhere were short and inexpensive (~ $7-15). We also appreciated that we declined a timeshare presentation via email before our visit and weren't approached or pressured during our visit. Nicely done!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great stay (Non-smoking, No Casino)”
Reviews.Author: Azarius74
Reviews.Content: January 15th-20th A very nice, non-smoking hotel (without casino) located 1/2 block from the Strip, right across from Planet Hollywood and the shoping mall. Construction on Harmon avenue was nearly 100% complete at this time, and getting in/out of the hotel property was of no issue. The Rooms: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for the duration of our stay. Be Advised: A 2 bedroom villa is actually a king suite connected to a regular king room via the double locking doors. Opening the doors creates the "2 bedroom villa". The king room (with pull-out) was nicely appointed, clean and had a kitchenette unit. Bathroom was large and clean. No issues at all. The king suite part was very nice. There was a large living area which included a full kitchen (completly stocked with all appliances and cutlery, bowls etc), a 6 person round table, pull out sofa and large screen LCD. The stand up washer/dryer was in a small closet in the kitchen. Everything was spotless and everything worked without issue. The king bedroom was gorgeous. Extremely comfy king bed with a large 2 person tub hilighted the room. It also had its own LCD tv and a separate sink/mirror area for getting ready. The room had an attached bathroom (also accessible through the kitchen). The bathroom was large and included a walk-in, 2 shower head shower. Loved it! No lack of pressure or hot water. Overall, very clean, VERY quiet stay with no issues at all. The Pool: Yes, it is small. 3.5' deep. The hot tub seats about 12 and there is a nice bar area on the roof as well. We went during the slow period and had it mostly to ourselves. I can see how it would become easily crowded during peak times. Location: Perfect! Right across from PH and in the middle of the Strip. A short walked to MGM, Luxor, Belaggio/Caesars etc. $12/cab ride from the airport on average. Check-in: No issues.... In fact, one room was ready for us when we got there at 1300hrs, great for dropping off our bags. 2 bedroom villa was available at the regular check in time of 1600hrs. The ice cold cucumber water in the lobby was a nice touch - we relied on it heavily. If you're looking for a non-smoking hotel with no casino attached (it was VERY quiet) right by the Strip for a decent price - you really can't go wrong with this hotel. Very happy camper!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel with the fabulous view of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ionagrad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Grand Chateau. Our one bedroom unit was on the 28th floor with a magnificent view of the strip. We found the apartment to be immaculate and the staff to be friendly and responsive. (The ice maker in our freezer wasn't working and we received a maintenance call within minutes) The pool is small but we relaxed on the lounge chairs and had access to the bar at happy hour. After a long day on the strip we were welcomed in the lobby with iced cold cucumber water--a nice treat at the end of the day! We would return to the Marriott for our next trip to Vegas--it was the best time-share exchange that we've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ningen
Reviews.Content: We are members of the Interval International timeshares. When I checked the review for this hotel it looks very promising. Upon arriving, check in was easy. We have a very huge 2 bedroom suites with a really great view of the city and the airport. Valet parking is free, and free wifi with really good signal in our suite. The hotel is convieniently located 1 away to the strip. Everything is within walking distance. Its just across from the Planet Holywood hotel. Guest of the hotel can have access to the amenities of the planet hollywood hotel. We like the fact that its not a casino hotel. My parents (65 and 60 years old) want the excitement of walking around on the street with crowds, the entertainments and restaurants, minus the noisy casino lobby. We cook all our own breakfast since they have a full kitchen; and also, there were washer and dryer in the unit. Whatever we need for a simple meal or snacks, they sell it at the lobby conviencience store.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and price”
Reviews.Author: Jockdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau for 3 days in November for my birthday. With our 1 year olds, we wanted to have a hotel with a refrigerator, microwave and washer and dryer. We had previously stayed at the Wyndham Grand Desert and enjoyed it. However, it wasn't available for our stay, so we decided to try the Marriott. Overall, it was a good experience. The staff, from front desk to housekeeping to the valets were very accomodating and helpful. We needed three cribs and though they didn't have them in the room on arrival, they brought them up quickly. The hotel was clean. The rooms were more than enough space for us. We were able to shop and bring some simple snacks for the kids. We were even able to bring home leftovers from a restaurant and had it for lunch the next day while the kids were napping. Two minor quibble s: 1. the combo washer and dryer doesn't seem to dry as well as it should when we washed the kids clothing, and 2. while it was nice to have valet parking, it was not as convenient if you're in a hurry and have to wait for other cars to be pulled before you. At the time of our stay, there was construction going on at the corner of Harmon and Las Vegas Boulevard, so you cannot turn into Harmon from Southbound direction of Las Vegas Boulevard. Once that's completed, it should be even more convenient for people to access. Overall, we would stay there again if the price point was right. We stayed for $149/night when the hotel had an anniversary discount.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & High End Villas”
Reviews.Author: ladyjadegd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott's Grand Chateau for New Years Week and loved it. This is our 4th stay at the Grand Chateau and our first in a two bedroom villa. First, The Grand Chateau is a time share property, but you can also rent room s like you do a hotel if there are rooms not being used by the owners. They do have hotel style rooms that are a single room with a Queen bed, couch bed, and small kitchenette and they have one bedroom, two bedroom and three bedroom villas (read: condo style room). Each has a master bedroom with a King bed and giant bathtub and each has a living room, dining room, and full kitchen stocked with cooking and dining supplies. This time we actually used the small washer and dryer provided, as well. It worked, but wasn't the best washer and dryer we ever used. This was the first time that we went with a group of people. We had a two bedroom villa, which has a second bedroom that is the same as the standard one room hotel room. The bedrooms are on each side of the living area. We had 8 people with us and it was a little tight for that many people. we each had a bed, but when we were up and about, the living/dining area was a little small for that many people. But we had an amazing view of the strip and fully took advantage of the full kitchen by preparing many full meals right there in the room. We all had laptops with us, though, and the free wireless Internet was soooooo slow that we didn't use it much because it was quite frustrating. We love that the property is non-smoking, but are not happy that the rooftop pool/bar area has set aside the best part of the roof for smoking. That is a bit of a disappointment. The pool is one negative of the Grand Chateau. Its on the roof and quite small, but it and the jacuzzi are open all year unlike many of the hotels there and its open late, also unlike many Vegas hotels. Once they add the third tower, a larger pool will be put in between the 2nd and 3rd towers. We're looking forward to that! For parking, it is ALL valet, so you cannot self park, however the valet is complimentary and you can choose to tip or not when picking up your vehicle. We have never had a problem any of the times we have stayed at the Grand Chateau, but our friends this time has a 6 speed manual transmission in their vehicle and felt that the valet did not know how to properly use that transmission. The location is fantastic, you're close to the center of the Strip, between the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood casinos and directly across the street from teh new City Center. TIP: If you have a chance, take a tour of the property andp ick up some free dinner, rooms or cash!

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TripsPA
Reviews.Content: This place is literally ½ block from the strip! As our family is not gamblers we still found so much to do in Las Vegas. This is pretty smack in the middle of everything and within walking distance to so many places. The hotel only shuttles to the Fashion Mall. The public transportation is terrible BUT cabs are everywhere (usually ~ $15.00 one way to most places on the strip). The rooms are well maintained / nice and the front desk people are helpful. My only complaint is with the housekeeping BANGING the doors open and closed each time they go in and out to clean a room! This is very noticeable on Friday when people begin checking out for the week (so don’t expect to EVER sleep in on cleaning days!). Be aware - the pool is small and there is NO balcony (they should invest in window cleaning).

Reviews.Title: “The service here is equivalant to a high schooler at a fast food restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaJ63
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight...no valet, no bellman. My husband went to check in, I got out to look at the new city center right in front of the hotel, then someone took the car! We didn'y know if it was valet or a thief...no one said anything. It was valet...and took them a half an hour to return it! They appologized for the "mistake". Then in the room, there were animal crackers on the floor, the couch was ripped, dust on the tv and headboard. I even wrote "dust" on the tv to see if the maid would see it...nope. There is no restaurant in this hotel. Not even continental breakfast. Note: This is a timeshare property that is not all sold and obviously rented rooms out for the holiday. The worst Marriot I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: scraft001
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms ... excellent service ... I really enjoyed this hotel and will return the next time I am in Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome luxury Marriott Boutique hotel with Italian decor--great value!”
Reviews.Author: MOTHERLOAD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a Marriott timeshare that also rents available rooms by the night. It has studios with a queen bed/ mini kitchen/ and sleeper sofa. 1 bedrooms include a private master bedroom with large bath, full kitchen with washer/dryer, dishwasher, etc., dining room, and living room with a large sleeper sofa. When you rent a 2 bedroom unit, you get both the studio & the 1 bedroom, so a total of 2 bathrooms, & it will sleep up to 8 people. There are also limited 3 bedroom units. The front of the hotel has a pull thru area where you check in & give your car to the valets to park in the garage for you. There is no self parking. Be prepared to empty your vehicle and get a luggage cart yourself, or have the bellman do it. Check in was great -- staff are very helpful. There is always free icewater in the lobby (with fruit in it). There is a small marketplace for snacks in the lobby. For owners, there is an owners lounge. They have weekly donut & coffee breakfasts for the owners to hear about local activities. These are for Marriott timeshare owners only. We stayed 3 nights on the Marriott timeshare presentation package. I paid extra & upgraded from a studio to a 1 bedroom & really glad I did. For 2 people the studios are great, but for a family of 4, with older kids 12 & 22, we needed more space. The kids both slept in the sleeper sofa which is king size I think. Maybe queen. The timeshare presentation is painless with Marriott, by their policies they don't pressure you. You spend about 2 hours getting a tour & hearing about all the awesome resorts they have & then get a choice of $75.00 Visa card, 10,000 Marriott reward points, or other rewards like helicopter rides or show tickets. We already own 2 Marriott timeshares, both 2 bedrooms, so we really appreciate the consistency of Marriott hotels and resorts, and also their food when there is a restaurant on property. The location is very close to the corner of the strip next to Planet Hollywood, so it is just about on the strip. A block south is MGM grand, and across the street is the new development with Aria Casino hotel, Vdara boutique hotel, Crystal shopping mall, many restaurants, etc. The location is perfect. We had a room with a view of the MGM grand. They have about 8 elevators, so you usually have no trouble getting to your room. The entire hotel is decorated in beautiful Italian decor including the rooms, which are just lovely. The living room TV's also have a DVD player so you can bring movies, or Netflix. The front desk will mail your Netflix back for you. After check in, go to the concerige and pick up your discount card for a few local area restaurants, etc. Be sure to visit the best kept secret in Las Vegas. This is not part of a tour group, so you won't hear about it from Marriott or anyone else. The Springs Preserve Las Vegas. It was opened in 2007. Here is the website to check it out. It is not far from the hotel. www.springspreserve.org If you are taking a couple kids, and are not from Nevada, get the membership instead of tickets. Out of state tickets are more costly & with the membership it is nearly the same cost, it is tax deductible, good for 1 year & you get discounts on the Wolfgang Puck restaurant & the gift shop. Also, go over to Henderson & tour the Ethel M Chocolate Factory. Best on weekdays when they are making candy. The place is open every day though. Outside is an awesome desert botanical garden on an accessible concrete pathway. They treat all the waste water from the factory on site in a large pond in the back that uses natural methods to destroy the waste. My other two favorite destinations are Valley of Fire State Park -- this is like Disneyland in the world of nature -- my favorite place anywhere. Also, Red Rock Canyon -- go on the driving tour & stop a few places for hikes. Red Rock is BLM land. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment for families”
Reviews.Author: LGPerth
Reviews.Content: For a family with 3 young girls this place was fantastic. The 2 bedroom apartment with separate lounge and kitchen and a laundry cupboard - was exactly what we needed. The 2 bathrooms were large and clean as were the bedrooms and the washer and dryer in the apartment made life very easy for doing the laundry. The location just across from Miracle Mile shops was great and made finding somewhere to eat very easy. The free shuttle to places down the Strip was also handy and the concierge staff were very helpful. I would definitely recommend this place to families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Richardf100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and had a great time. Ideally situated just off the strip in central location so makes the hotel nice and quiet. Staff excellent and accommodation superb. Be sure to chat to concierge who gives great advice on shows, restaurants etc and also discount coupons. Pool and bar on the roof offered fantastic views day and night. Whilst pretty small there were not that many people using it so didn't find this a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - a little bit of walking needed”
Reviews.Author: km12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overall very nice. The rooms were immaculate and quiet. The pool and hot tub (on the roof) are a bit small - but lets face it - who goes to Vegas to spend time in a pool. The staff were great and eager to help, on the few times we needed assistance (additional blankets, etc...). The small market on the 1st floor was well stocked but WAY over-priced - you would be better off to find a local Walmart as we did. They do have a shuttle that goes to the supermarket a couple of days a week if you don't have a rental car. The beds were wonderful and perhaps more comfortable than what I have at home. The only problems I had were with the location and our room overlooking the airport. They are located off a side-street next to Plant Hollywood. You have a good solid block to get to the strip. Not a big deal for us, but when you are used to walking out your door and being in the center of it all - it is something to be aware of. The other issue was we didn't check in until mid-week and the only rooms available were in the back facing the airport. The only time it was an issues was the stream of 6:30 am take-offs and landings. Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone looking to have nice lodging in Vegas. A few other tips: avoid valet if you are going back out that same day - park in the back of the hotel (we did do valet at night); the view from the roof at night is nice on a warm night; avoid the lobby market; the showers use full shower-heads - not those whimpy water-conserving ones :)

Reviews.Title: “first time in vegas”
Reviews.Author: miami_is_here
Reviews.Content: this was an awesome resort with a great location. not much to do at the resort but the pool has an amazing view and the place is beautiful. i would definately recommend this resort to any family or people who want to go to vegas and still be able to enjoy your time there and still have a relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Position "A" on the Strip but forget about sleeping in.”
Reviews.Author: cpl5938
Reviews.Content: Great place and a good position next to the strip. The only problem we incountered is that in the morning starting at 7am the valet staff and the people parking their car there have to blow their horn as the move through the parking garage. This continues until 2pm making it impossible to sleep. I'm not sure why they need to keep blowing the car horns all morning long but they need to find a different way.

Reviews.Title: “Here is how to get around construction”
Reviews.Author: gerininamo
Reviews.Content: Yes, the construction is a pain. The first connecting street behind(east) the resort is Audrie. This street connects with Tropicana by going through the MGM property. There are lots of speed bumps and make sure you don't get in the right taxi lane. It comes out on Tropicana and you can go either east or west(towards the strip) depending on which side of the exit you are in. If you choose to go the next street east of Audrie which is Koval, be aware that they are tearing up the intersection and Koval between Harmon and Tropicana is down to one lane both ways. Unless you are in the very slow time of the day I would NOT risk it-take Audrie. In any case, allow for more travel time and yes it is an inconvenience but I do not consider it a major reason to not stay at the Marriott. The resort itself is very nice-as someone else said it is not pretentious. I would not consider it to be 5 Star either in ambience or accomodations. Certainly upscale, comfortable, clean, convenient and blissfully quiet. Great views of the strip. I can't imagine someone would be dissatisfied unless they are looking for a) Excitement b) A great pool scene or c) Over the top luxury. The pool as others have stated is small but there was no fight over lounges as I have had in other locations. Expect to see children in what essentially is a kids wading pool. This is a place where families will spend a week with children in tow. Depending on the price, I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hopson
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in a 1 bedroom suite. It is a great location next door to the Planet Hollywood Casino. The staff went out of their way to help and the rooms were modern with all the amenities. The best thing is being close to the action but not having to put up with all the casino traffic in your hote.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff, good location except for the huge construction project!”
Reviews.Author: jtcarguy
Reviews.Content: This is also a timeshare and our friends are owners in the network. The rooftop pool area is small and fills up quickly but is clean and nice. There is a nice little bar there too. Drink prices were a bit high. ($5 for a can of beer, $9 for a daquiri) The rooms are clean and nicely appointed. Ours was a one bedroom with a pull out sofa, one bathroom but a great two person shower. The sleeper sofa wasn't the most comfortable thing in the world but I knew that I would be sleeping on one before I got there. The bed in the bedroom was great just like all marriott properties. We took the "Tour" which is a sales pitch and tour of the timeshares. We didn't buy but we received 4 passes for a helicopter ride up and down the strip which were "valued" at $110/ea. The whole ride was 9 minutes long and it was great but had I paid for it I would have been peeved. The room had a nice kitchen with full size oven and fridge, blender, toaster, coffee maker, etc. very comfortable. It was an easy walk to the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, and many others, we always felt safe walking around. There is no restaurant or casino in the hotel which was actually kinda nice. They also had complimentary valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Road construction !!!”
Reviews.Author: randykay10
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday., Oct. 2, 2009. The Studio room is not nearly large enough for 3 people. Just trying to get to this place was a nightmare because of the road construction on both Harmon and Las Vegas Blvd. We missed the turn twice and had to go around the block - took forever. Incidentally, they talk about free Valet parking but Valet is the ONLY method of parking. No self-parking permitted. We turned in our rental car on Sat. evening at 7:00pm and when we picked it up on Sunday morning at 10:00am, the passenger side was covered with blood spatter. Not at all sure what this car was involved in overnight. If you give the Valets your car, be sure to write down the mileage and check it again when you pick it up.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cayman408
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in LV and found it a great place to visit. Stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau, a timeshare with great location just a block off the strip. Staff there were the most pleasant and helpful we have found at timeshares around the US. Saw four shows in six nights with the best being O by Cirque and Terry Fator. Any of the Cirque shows in town would be great and Fator was beyond our expectations. Best restaurants at reasonable prices are Mon Ami Gabi on the strip, French in Paris; and Red Velvet off the strip in Summerlin. Desert viewings included Red Rock Canyon then a trip to the Hoover Dam, both worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet right off the strip”
Reviews.Author: donralz
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was fantastic. The hotel is literally right off the strip... only a 3 minute walk from the lobby and you're already in the shops at Planet Hollywood! But since there's no casino and it's not actually on the strip, it's fairly quiet and you can get some peaceful rest. Right now, there's construction going on Harmon which makes it hard to get to in and out, but they're promising it'll be finished soon, which will make access really nice because Harmon will be a fairly major street. The Hilton has a really nice kids zone although we didn't use it, it seemed like it was fairly packed with different activities and games. Also, they have a little 24 hour market where you can buy food snacks and other convenient items. 24 hours means you don't have to go anywhere if you need something!! There's a pool and jacuzzi on the room, fairly tame by Vegas standards and the wall around the roof prevents you from seeing everything (and prevents drunk people from falling off...) but I heard the pool bar has very reasonable prices for drinks, although I can't say how good they were. The rooms were fantastic! We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite... full kitchen and washer dryer in room. The master bedroom had a jacuzzi tub and a huge shower with two shower heads. The second bathroom had it's own refrigerator, sitting area, and standard bathroom. When we ran out of towels, we called the front desk, someone brought them up, and they even called 15 minutes later to make sure the towels made it and see if we needed anything else. Excellent service. They didn't lobby very hard to get us into timeshare presentations, which was very much appreciated. I don't know how much it costs, but it seems pretty expensive... we used a timeshare exchange to get it so it was well worth it. All in all, a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but construction makes it a challenge to get to”
Reviews.Author: gintsfan1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days without our 2yr old daughter and made accommodation at the Marriott Grand Chateau. Very nice place walking distance from Planet Hollywood, Miracle Mile shops etc. We really liked that the hotel is a non-smoking facility except for the rooftop pool area. Staff attentive and rooms are clean and spacious. We would definitely stay here again! Only con, is construction. Noise wasn't too bad, but would recommend not having a car and just take taxi's and shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: spoilme0315
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice...I really enjoyed my stay it was the best time I had in Vegas,,,the staff was nice, the hotel was great and clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Resorty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: umetax
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 bedroom with my husband and my parents for a 4 day weekend, the rooms were separated by the kitchen and living room. Very spacious, there was even a smaller kitchenette in our bedroom. The TV resolution could have been better but I think that's my only complaint. The beds and linens were amazing! and it's very close to PH and it will be just a few steps to the new city center. They have a swimming pool and jacuzzi up top, not too big but enough for a quick plunge! with a bar that makes awesome daiquiries with an awesome view of Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and location were excellent”
Reviews.Author: CVKT
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved staying at the Marriott Grand Chateau on our first visit to Vegas. The room was great. Good size, small kitchen area, very comfortable, and decent view. It was easy to zip into the hotel and get to our room quickly. Nice and quiet on the 25th floor, despite all the construction to widen the strip. The roof top pool and hot tub were nice. The pool was small, but did the trick to cool us off. And you can't beat the view up there. The concierge was very helpful planning some excursions for us and answering questions. The location of the hotel was fantastic; it was in the middle of everything so we could walk to most places we wanted to go. Would stay at the Marriott Grand Chateau again in a heartbeat. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, super spacious, fantastic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: luvyrlife
Reviews.Content: As 2 kiwis first time in Vegas and no car, we booked a two bedroom apartment and could not have picked a better place to stay. 40" LCD TV in the living area and a TV in each bedroom, a bathroom each. The larger bedroom also had a bath and a full vanity and make up mirror in the bedroom, in addition to a full size bathroom.You could walk everywhere - and when it was too hot a cab fare to the end of the strip was around $9. The location is excellent - pretty much in the middle of the strip, set half a block back, opposite planet hollywood and the miracle mile shops (around 170 shops that are a mix of cafes, restaurants, amenities, clothes, accessories etc). If you are feeling lazy you only have to walk across the road and you are at the cafes - and they were good value and good quality. Walgreens is a ten minute walk away, you are surrounded by casinos either side of you. If you want to make use of apartment facilities (large fridge, oven, microwave, coffeemaker) you can easily do so. Fabulous spacious rooms, very clean, lovely beds, very very quiet, good little mini-mart onsite. Pick up for grand canyon tour that we took was across the road at planet hollywood (great tour, fly to grand canyon, helicopter through the canyon and land on the floor of the canyon, then boat trip for 20 mins up the colorado river, different route back by helicopter). Service at the Marriott was excellent, concierge very helpful and made reservations for us at Joe's Seafood Restaurant (part of Caesars Palace, located in the Forum Shops) on the night we went to the Bette Midler show - both were fantastic. We aren't gamblers but we totally loved Vegas. it is very impressive - from fantastic theatre, singers, bands, entertainment available - and there is a lot of choice, to high quality cafes and restaurants, to superb shopping (best of France, Italy, European and US shops) this is a great place to stay. Would definitely go back and stay at the Marriott again - fantastic value for money and top notch apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location, and Really Nice Too!”
Reviews.Author: PGinNC
Reviews.Content: Far enough off the strip to be quiet, close enough to the best part of the strip to be super convenient, this is a great place to stay in Vegas! The unit we had was a little small, and the "neighbors" we had the first night were loud, but when they left, everything was super. We especially liked the pleasant and helpful staff and the delightful roof-top bar. We'd do this one again!

Reviews.Title: “Good place near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: NickBkk
Reviews.Content: A good option in LV if you want to have a central location near the strip and not being in a Casino. Rooms are very big and fully fitted (like an apartment), although upon check in there was not coffee maker or coffee cups that we need to ask housekeeping to send. Then the first coffee maker was faulty and also we have to change 2 times the hair drier in the bathroom, so it seems that the people in charge of equipment in the property were not doing their job very efficiently. Besides that the room was very good and comfortable. Service was fast and efficient besides the problems mentioned earlier. The shop downstairs, although convenient, extremely expensive, so we ended buying thing in the ABC Store at the Hollywood Planet across the street. Another problem was the road construction outside the hotel, but no so serious, except taxis needed to make a bit of round coming from the airport. We used their afternoon shuttle to go to Fashion Mall as it was very convenient. Distance to Paris LV was 15-20 minutes on foot and a bit more to Bellagio, so you may not need a car or take a taxi if you want to move nearby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definately 5*”
Reviews.Author: Lucie_World94
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of accomodation, we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. It was huge with everything you could want. Hotel staff very friendly. View from pool at night very good. Pool quite small although never saw that many people in it. It has water misters that spray out constantly onto the sunbed area which is nice. Valet parking was very efficient but at times would have liked self parking as when coming back with shopping felt pressured empying the car out of the front of the hotel. Valet staff very polite. Hotel just off of the strip which was handy, alot of building work going on across the road from the hotel so you have to walk across a dusty area to get to strip, not that big a deal but not nice when hotel is so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: melsasmadasahatter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott's Grand Chateau in January and we had a lovely time in this smashing little gem, the only real problem i had was with the pull out sofa!! We travelled as a group of four and used the Hotel as part of my Sister-in-laws timeshare vacation allowance, however upon arrival they put us in a one bedroom apartment (or villa as they called it). We tried to get a bigger apartment but were not allowed due to the conditions of her timeshare agreement, so this obviously meant that my husband and i would have to sleep on the pull out sofa that was situated in the lounge/kitchen area of the apartment. This sofa bed was the most uncomfortable thing i have ever slept on in my life!! i even had to go to the linen room and "borrow" two duvets to pad out the mattress because it was so awfull and we had to sleep on it for a week.!!. So beware if you a sharing and if you have existing back problems... you will need to over indulge on alcoholic beverages to ensure a good nights sleep (would recommend frozen margarita's from the Casino Royale yum yum!!). Other than that the Grand Chateau was lovely.. set back off the strip behind the Harley Davison Cafe and across the road from Planet Hollywood hotel. It has great views of the strip and the desert, it has a small roof pool and a bar (although it wasnt open when we were there) a small shop (expensive though) and very well equiped apartments with excellant kitchen facilities and a fantastic two person shower and a huge bath!! we always stuck to walking on the main road to the strip for safety (there is a dark alley way off the strip to the hotel) and usually cut throught the shopping mall at Planet Hollywood to get to the strip. Vegas itself is amazing!! wow, wow, wow, Disneyland for grown ups!! I you are looking for accomadation in vegas and you want to be where all the action is then this may not be the place for you..... and try The Bellagio, Caesars Palace, The Mirage, The Palazzo and Venitian etc, but if you dont mind staying in a quiet hotel/timeshare apartment with no rowdy collage kids - in a quiet area off the strip and you enjoy walking - then the Marriott Grand Chateau is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, quiet oasis among the hustle & bustle.”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Z_221b
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent timeshare hotel. You can get a three bedroom unit with kitchen and living room, a two bedroom with same, a one bedroom with same, or a typical hotel room layout. Great location across the street from Planet Hollywood and just off the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, some issues”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like most Marriotts. Its clean, nicely appointed, with nice rooms and wonderful bedding. But this is a vacation club resort, and there is no restaurant, no casino, and no swimming pool. I can live without the casino, because even though we like to play it really is close to the strip. But no restaurant/no room service - is not for me. Yes you can walk over to Planet Hollywood but who wants to have to? And they have no plans for a restaurant. They are getting a pool when they build the next towers but that could be as far away as 2011. We did become members of the vacation club because its an awesome deal, but we probably wouldn't stay at this spot. It does have a fridge and other conveniences - and would be great for families. Except for the lack of pool. Also, road construction is really annoying, means taxis can't get there easily etc. So I will say I would recommend this location, but only for certain people and under certain circumstances. Nice friendly staff and all that - but just these small issues to deal withl

Reviews.Title: “Road construction severely restricts hotel access”
Reviews.Author: rather_be
Reviews.Content: I give the hotel five stars, but beware of road construction that impedes hotel access horribly. We stayed Aug 23-25. Cab fares were about $2 higher because of detours, and walking was extremely dangerous because sidewalks and crosswalks have been removed. The two handicapped people in our party had a very difficult time crossing the street. The city of Las Vegas could have done better for their visitors on this project. Marriott, however, did an outstanding job! All staff were top notch and the room was to die for. Free wi-fi was also much appreciated, and this hotel is the only one I know of on the strip that offers it free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family.”
Reviews.Author: jmjtg
Reviews.Content: Service at this place is great! We travelled with three young kids, and being casino-free and smoke-free, this is a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with children”
Reviews.Author: HoangCheng
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay with young children since it's smoke-free and casino-free. This is an absolute RARITY in Vegas. It was our most relaxing Vegas trip yet. We were able to walk the strip and enjoy Vegas events (Cirque du Soleil, Excalibur show) without the "Vegas" feel. We even took a hiking trip in the Red Rock Canyon with a great personal tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: soonerlaw
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas over the 4th of July and stayed in a 2 bedroom Vill at the Grand Chateau. The hotel is just off the Las Vegas Strip and is just across the street from the Magical Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. The hotel does not have a any casino or gaming, which makes it a quiet, family friendly place. The rooms were clean and had all the amenities. The Villas had a full kitchen as well as a washer/dryer. We just bought food and cooked for breakfast and lunch, and then went out to dinner every evening. The pool is very small, but you have access to the pools at Planet Hollywood and the Polo Towers, so it was not too big of a deal. Also, the rooms did not have balconies. Other than those two minor issues, the place was very nice. Valet parking is complimentary and the valets are very fast and sincere. The rest of the staff is very attentative and helpful. Also, the pullout couches are not really too comfortable, so if you are going with a group of family members like I did, try to get the bed instead of getting stuck with the pullout. But overall, the 2bd Villa is huge. We knew some other people who stayed in a 1bd Villa, and that was very roomy as well.

Reviews.Title: “Now this is the way to stay on vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cadmandan
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Vegas, so it was time to go. We did an exchange and booked a flight. The resort is about 250 feet off of the strip and across from Planet Hollywood. A real nice central location. The resort was very nice - check -in was a breeze, everyone was very nice and the room was WOW! The room was a very large one bedroom on the 26th floor and what a view of the area. The room was approx. 800 sq, ft. with a nice kitchen, livingroom, 1 1/2 private bathrooms and big bedroom with a large whirlpool They had a free shuttle that in the am would take you to a grocery store and in the pm to the shopping mall. We found the "duce" to be the best transportation - public transportation $7 all day up and down the strip. There is a pool on the top of the building that was nice, but a bit small and crowded. There was also a nice bar by the pool so what the heck, drink and be mary. Do not take the day trip to the Grand Canyon - Not enough time at the canyon - too much time riding. Do go to see Hoover Dam.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T BE HAPPIER!! Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyKouple
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners at this resort, but this is the first time we have actually stayed there. If you are exchanging a timeshare to stay here or paying for it, it is easily one of the best places we have ever stayed in. We own a two bedroom unit but only used the one bedroom villa part of it and even that was more than enough room for us. The decor was gorgeous, clean, elegant and top end all the way through. The full kitchen, dining room and UNBELIEVABLE view were all part of what made this awesome. The two person shower, great king sized bed and oversized soaking tub were truly elegant as well! The people who work there look after your every detail and I actually found it was great to have valet parking to make the trip even better. It's right across the street from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shopping and also has a great view of the new City Center project and within walking distance of the Paris and Bellagio. I can't recommend this place higher.....made for a perfect 10th anniversary t rip. Great job Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Las Vegas for a terrific family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MsMargRat
Reviews.Content: I'm just posting a quick review for this hotel while I'm still sitting here enjoying my view of the Luxor, MGM Grand and the Monte Carlo. We came to Las Vegas for a week stay as a quick family vacation. We usually spend a week or two in a beach location in Mexico, but are taking two other major trips this year, so this summer trip is short and close to home (Los Angeles). We knew Las Vegas had enough to offer our kids, but this resort was a surprise. The rooftop pool is perfect. Not too big but plenty of views, chairs and towels. Not to mention the nice rooftop bar. You can see both ends of The Strip from this vantage point. The rooms are well equipped. Full kitchen means full kitchen! Nice bathrooms and great beds. Even though we only got a one bedroom for the five of us, it was big enough. We spent more time than expected here, and it actually worked for us. It's so nice not to have a casino in the hotel, yet everything so close. We are literally half a block off The Strip. The only drawback is not having a restaurant in- ouse. However, right across the street is the Miracle Mile with plenty of reasonable options and then everything from expensive fare to McDonald's and Fatburger less than a block away. It probably made for a more reasonable vacation for us, since we just ended up buying pasta, cereal and eggs at the Walgreens (block and a half) and at the store downstairs (expensive as expected, but well-stocked). Also, the hotel offers a free shuttle to the local Vons at a few different times during the mornings. They also have a kids club that offers quite a range of activities for ALL young ages. I believe they started at 2 yrs old. Finally, the staff is wonderful. From the valet to the bellman to the store cashier, we felt very appreciated. Oh, and free Internet acceess!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly Clean. Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: kirstifl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Chateau for two nights in a two bedroom unit. We were on the 19th floor and had three seperate views from our room. The children's room (with two queen beds) faced the MGM Grand, the living room faced the MGM Grand, NYNY and Luxor and the master bath faced the new city center and Planet Hollywood. Since we traveled with two children (ages 11 and 14) I will try to recount what made this hotel outstanding for a family stay. First of all it is spotlessly clean. I am an admitted germ freak and very particular about the cleanliess of a hotel room. When we walked in our unit it blew me away. It was so pristine and clean you would have thought we were the first to ever use the room. The kitchen was well stocked and had a front loading washer/dryer, full size fridge, microwave stove/oven and dishwasher. The children's room had two queen beds, a flat screen TV and sitting area. The living room had a comfortable couch, two chairs and a flat screen. The master had a very comfortable king size bed, flat screen and chair. The closets throughout the unit were very large. The master bath was beautiful with double vanity sinks, soaking tub and a huge shower. The best thing is the triple bedsheeting. NO disgusting bedspreads to deal with, so you know it's clean. It was nice to walk about 2 minutes off the strip to such a serene and smoke free building. You must valet park your car. They do not allow you to self park in the garage. However, the valet parking is free and the service to retreive the car was very quick. We did walk to the other hotels. I can say they are nice to see....but I'm not sure about staying there. They are so crowded. Just like the old saying..nice to vist but I wouldn't want to stay there. I just can't say enough about this hotel. The hotel staff treated us so well. This should be the standard that all other hotels strive to meet. Thanks Marriott Grand Chateau for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 Star Resort, WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: northcarolinatravler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days and what a great place this is. It is a 4 minute walk to the strip, it is right beside Planet Hollywood and you can walk to the side entrance of Plant Hollywood in 2 minutes. They have valet parking that is very fast. There is not a casino here and that is nice as it is peacefull and quiet. They have free ice water in the lobby. In the gift shop you can buy a mug for $15 that gives you unlimited refills of soft drinks. That was nice to have. We made out on that deal as there is no telling how many times we filled it up. We were on the 32 floor in a 2 bedroom unit and what a unit it was. It had 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, a dining room, a den and 2 big bedrooms. It was super clean and the view was a 5 star view. You would not belive how nice this room was, it was the nicest we have ever stayed in. On the top of the building is a pool and a jacuzzi and what a view. You could see for miles. Las Vegas was swamped, there were people everywhere and the traffic was a nightmare. I would rather drive in New York City. We had a rental car and we drove out of town alot, Lake Mead is neat, and Red Rock is nice. But dont drive on the strip, it would take forever to get from one place to another. Ethel M Chocolate factory tour is boring, and then they try to sell you high dollar chocolate, at the airport there is a place you can park and watch planes land, that was fun and you would be surprised how neat it is to watch that. I could have stayed there for hours. If you like crowds and lots of traffic you will love Las Vegas. Go see Carrot Top at Luxor and Ka at MGM both good shows. We saw Price is Right Live Game Show, it was just okay, I would not go again. Did I mention how bad the traffic was in Las Vegas. Dont eat at Terribles Casino, it really is Terrible. There is a $7.77 gamblers speical at Mr. Luckys at Hard Rock Casino, it is not on the menu so ask your waiter, it has steak, shrimp, potatoes, and salad for $7.77. Oh, by the way the traffic in Las Vegas is unreal. At this resort they will ask you to take a 90 minute sales tour. It was the easiest $75 dollars I have ever made. No pressure at all. They show you the units and the cost and there is no pressure at all. If not interested just say no. Las Vegas is growing like you would not belive, and by the way the TRAFFIC IS TERRIBLE. My next vacation I am going somewhere there are no people and no traffic.

Reviews.Title: “There are reasons why this hotel is in the Top Ten hotels in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: NOLACreole
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights in a two bedroom villa and I can't imagine being anywhere else. Our room was on the 19th floor and faced the Planet Hollywood by Westgate tower and the city of vegas, and beyond that the beautiful mountains. Even though our room wasn't exactly facing the Strip, we could see Paris and Bellagio to our left and to our right at night we saw the city lights and then- nothing because of the mountains. It was very interesting to see that. The beds were super comfortable and we had more than enough room. The shuttle to the grocery store only runs saturday thru tuesday or so and only until about 10am. Which worked out well because of our east coast internal clock! It was wonderful to prepare our own meals during the day and then go out for dinner. We spent quite a bit of time at Planet Hollywood since it was so close. We were able to walk everywhere and the valets were very helpful in securing cabs for us. The hotel offers various activites for $5 or less. (i.e. scrapbooking workshop, milkshake making, video game contests) I never once was offered a timeshare which was really nice. In the lobby, they have strawberry water that you can drink. It became kind of a tradition to stop and get some every time we came in from walking. They have free wireless internet and if you need anything printed you can just email it to the front desk and they will print it for free. The pool was quite small but it was never overcrowded while we were there. However, you can go to Planet Hollywood or Polo Towers and use their pool according to the front desk. We never took advantage of that so I'm not sure how that goes but its nice to have the option. They did allow a little early check-in for us but they do not offer late checkout. At the very latest, you're allowed to be there until 11 but the valet will hold your bags for free until you come get them. If you're even vaguely considering the Chateau you should go ahead and book a room!

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Gigi028
Reviews.Content: What we liked the most about this hotel was the location. Since is not in the strip itself, you won't have to park two miles away to get to your room and being with young children walk past the casino area as most hotels in Las Vegas. We stayed at a lock off villa, which was big enough for 8 people, gorgeous kitchen and beautifully decorated. Free valet service made a big difference from when we have stayed in other Vegas hotels. This is a great Marriott property that I would recommend to all my family and friends. Swimming pool was extremely small for the hotel size, but who wants to be in an outdoor pool on a 100+ degree weather?

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort, we will definitely return again!”
Reviews.Author: Dbrown1085
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort. We stayed on the 21st floor with a view of Las Vegas Boulevard (the Strip). This was a very enjoyable vacation. The location was about a half a block away from the strip, which made things easy if we chose to walk. This resort was well maintained with a fally equipped kitchen with granite counter tops. We stayed in a two bedroom unit, with one of the units being a lock off unit, so there was plenty of privacy. The unit came with a stackable washer and dryer and also a large tub to soak it. How wonderful it was to take a nice hot bubble bath while listening to the stereo and look out the large windows at the view of the strip. The units are nicely decorated and also were equipped with a dvd player and a 42 inch plasma screen television in the living room. The shower was equipped with a dual shower head, for those who would like to take a shower with your mate. The free valet parking was also an extra perk. The valet parking lot attendants were very curtious and accomodating and so were the staff in the lobby. Each time we would pull up in front of the building the attendants would say "Welcome Home." which I thought was cute. This place definitely feels like a home away from home, only better because they have all the updated amenities. Those that are into fitness and health will really enjoy the fitness center and there is also a roof top swimming pool and sauna with a breathtaking view of the strip. There is also a bar on the roof if you would like to have a nice pool side drink. After staying at the Marriott Grand Chateu, I would never want to stay in a regular hotel room again. I have been spoiled by this lovely resort. Words can not

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, close to Strip, good rate”
Reviews.Author: MizzRita
Reviews.Content: Although this is a Marriott vacation club, hotel rooms are available. The one bedroom was large, clean and quite comfortable. It's about l/2 block off the Strip and walking distance to all the large hotels and casinos. Price is great for a one-bedroom suite. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: trentmister
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-day trip. We loved everything about the Grand Chateau - the location is great, an easy walk to the strip. Our 2-bedroom suite was beautiful and spotless. The staff was all very courteous and friendly. We've stayed at different locations on the Strip over the years - this was one of our favorites. Much quieter than the casino hotels, and the fact that it is a non-smoking hotel is a definite plus. So nice to be able to ease into the day with our coffee and comfortable living room. The full-size kitchen is a big plus, even if only using for beverages and snacks. There is a convenience market by the lobby with lots to offer. Also a shuttle that goes several times daily to the Fashion Show Mall and also to the grocery store. The resort offered many activities, although we were too busy to partake in them.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAY”
Reviews.Author: DallasTexasRea
Reviews.Content: If you like the Marriott brand stay here. I was very impressed with the room amenities and the availability of services. The pool is extremely small...more like a backyard pool at home. I stayed over memorial weekend. The hotel seemed full but never crowded. Its not nearly as big as some of the hotels in Vegas. No casino or restaurant on property...so if you are looking for that stay somewhere else. I stayed in a one bedroom villa. Just be careful when you book these though. The hotel has some rooms on their website that state "one bedroom villa" but they are actually studios. The studios are cute, but no full kitchen and no large separate tub...so if you are expecting that and you accidentally book a studio you will be dissapointed. Just make sure that you check the room descriptions to be certain to get what you want. The location is fine..but expect to do alot of walking in general. There is a shuttle that will take you to the supermarket and the fashion mall. The shuttle for the supermarket only runs from Sat through Tues..but if you miss it no worries...there is a fully stocked market in the lobby. They carry everything from bread to first aid items. The shuttle to the mall is great because it basically carts you to the other end of the strip...and if you have ever walked it you understand why thats a good thing. I was not so impressed with the front desk staff for numerous reasons. I had a few questions during my stay and they were not at all helpful. Its a good thing that im not the type of person that expects top notch service because you certainly wont get that here. I basically just received a room key and was sent on my way. Its like being in a ritz carlton with motel trained staff if you can imagine that. Beautiful place, lousy employees. Free valet service, but the valet staff was not much better. The hotel was quiet and clean. No rowdy twenty somethings smoking and smelling up the place with their cigarettes and cheap liquor. By the way, the entire property is smoke free..so if you smoke stay somewhere else. Im not kidding. There are no smoking areas in the hotel and no exceptions..and if housekeeping finds as much as a speck of ash or whiff of smoke in the room expect to pay a hefty "cleaning" charge...upwards of 200 bucks in some cases. Some places you can book a smoke free room and get away with smoking. Not here. Trust me. All in all, my stay was pretty good. Minimal complaints. I am a big fan of Marriott properties..so I will stay in one again. This place is a timeshare property..and I did sit through the sales pitch but decided not to buy. Its still pretty new and in good shape but who knows what it will look like in 10 years? Also, only 2 of the 4 quads are up...so when construction begins on quads 3 and 4 I dont think i would want to stay here for the construction noise. City center is going up across the street. HUGE. I counted 10 buildings...its going to be ridiculous when its finished. I didnt hear any construction noise..maybe a truck or two early am but nothing major. Millions of people will be added to the strip. I'm not so sure it's going to be pleasant since they have no plans to widen the sidewalks. Overall, I thought it was an okay place allthough, if I return to Vegas anytime soon I may try somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JonsTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was gorgeous and we had a great view of the strip . . . The huge tub in the bedroom and the shower built for two made it a very romantic place to stay. The view of the strip from the roof is superb. The rooftop bar area is a great place to relax . . . when its not too windy. We were able to enjoy the best of Vegas without having a casino at the bottom of the stairs . . . but the casinos were glose enought that we could enjoy their amenities with ease.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: Whenever I come to Las Vegas I stay here. Two blocks off the strip means a nice getaway from the maddening crowd. A short walk through the mall across the street brings you to one of my favorite Japanese restaurants - Koi in Planet Holllywood. Staff at the Marriott always helpful. If you want the glitz of Vegas then you should stay in one of the casino hotels. Calm = Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “NICE!”
Reviews.Author: BostonProper
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fine experience at the Chateau. Convenient, clean , spacious, relaxing (if you can relax in Vegas!), etc.,etc., etc., ....Stayed for a week....loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - wanted to stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: tkvu
Reviews.Content: This Apartment-Hotel is really amazing. We had a two-bedroom suite with large living-room with a large flat tv, fully equipped kitchen and two luxurious bathrooms. There was a washing machine and a dryer also which was very useful. The location of the building is perfect, as it is a little bit off the Strip to be quiet, but still close enough to walk to all the hotels/casinos. Internet & valet parking was free!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: Tree_and_Me
