Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the 2BR, 2Bath Villa for one week. The hotel was very clean. Having a smoke-free hotel was a big plus in our opinion considering all the smoke in most casinos. It was quiet. The location was excellent. We considered the room to be high quality and luxurious. The room was stocked with everything you need. We ordered groceries from Albertson's which worked out very well for getting food and liquor to our room inexpensively. The double glass shower was great with fabulous water pressure. The tub was also nice. We had a strip view from the room. The rooftop bar was great too with fabulous views of the strip and beyond. The Wi-Fi worked great. And we have to mention the staff which was very responsive and professional at all times. All-in-all a classy, high-quality place to stay in Las Vegas that should continue to be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: OlyFoodie
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you love Vegas but love a good night's sleep as well. Very quiet at night and no noisy revelers wandering the halls unlike the other hotels on the Strip. Great location next to Planet Hollywood. The rooms are spotless and have all the amenities of a Marriott Hotel (except a restaurant and room service!). A 2 bedroom unit will very comfortably sleep 6-7. The staff was helpful and pleasant, and the free shuttle to the grocery store was convenient. The rooftop pool has a beautiful view during the day and at night.

Reviews.Title: “Dynamite !!!! Loved this place......”
Reviews.Author: BarneysMom1
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat..... close enough to the LAS VEGAS STRIP to walk but yet far enough from the smoke and craziness that comes with Las Vegas...........We had a 2 BR 2 BA suite which was impeccably clean, the beds super comfy and the construction of the buildg was superb.... we couldn't hear a thing. The front desk staff was wonderful..... when we couldn't figure out how to work the DVD late one night..... the front desk people sent up a "technician" who couldn't have been nicer.........upon leaving he left us his card and a piece of chocolate !!! We were treated like royalty........Wow..... I think that I should work for the Marriott...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that doesn't feel like dirty conventiony vegas”
Reviews.Author: wanderman22
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the Marriott. I stay in Marriotts frequently and this one was great! the rooms are huge..maybe we got a suite i am not sure. Double Headed showers, kitchen area, living and dining area. Quiet too..did not hear construction once. Great Staff, from the valet (female sorry misser her name)-to the front desk (Nick maybe), to the engineers who actually engaged you in conversation and acknowleded you. Loved the fact that it did not reek of smoke. Pool...eh crowded and small but i wasn't there for that... we were there to visit with friends, watch some games, and hit some casinos. It is right across the street from Planet Hollywood Hotel and Mile Shops.

Reviews.Title: “A great location at the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in the middle of january of 2009. The weather was really great for the time of year. Usually it is not so wonderfull. So many short sleeved people. The Marriott is not on bat at the Strip. With a 1 to 2 minute walk you're on the Strip. It is located behind the Harley Davidson restaurant. This Marriott is one of the Vacationclub resorts from Marriott, but with a few different detaild. First of all: the location: it is probably located better then most vacationclub resorts. Often they are away from the city centers or places of interest, so you need a car. (Well, some are on the beach, which can be a good location if you just want to relax). Here the parking is valet parking, which works very well. And it can be handy to use a car to get around (shopping malls or even other hotels on the strip... the strip is long...). We were with friends and stayed in a two bedroom apartment. The views are nice. The two bedroom appartment a bit smaller then in an average vacationclub (the kitchen and living room area for instance), but you get all you need, as always. The rooms look nice, the kitchen is handy (for some shopping and taking breakfast and a late night snack). What we enjoyed in Vegas? Premium Outlet, O by Cirque du Soleil, V the Variety show (the show, not the theatre...), the strip: Wynn, Venetian, Bellagio, Attraction on the Stratosphere, Rollercoaster at New York New York, Vic and Anthony steakhouse, the great january 2009 weather... Grand Canyon What we did not enjoy so much in Vegas? the older hotels: such as: Luxor, Excalibur (at a certain moment all those casinos look the same: in which hotel did we just enter?) , the fact we got hit by a car on our way back to the airport and had to stay in a hospital and the insane hospital bills we get since (let's abuse the tourist!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and lodging.”
Reviews.Author: Drewsgrammy8
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby, attentive staff and cleanliness of the room made this an excellent choice. My husband and I shared a studio with a king-size bed, large closet, easy-to-use safe and kitchen area with small refrigerator, microwave and an assortment of dishes and glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: crbncrsr
Reviews.Content: We spent one week here on an Interval International exchange. We traveled with our two small children age 5 and 8. We were very pleased with the resort but were concerned about the pool after reading the reviews about how small it was. It is small, but we had a blast. The pool is located on the roof, with a great view, a bar, a hot tub and the pool. There were plenty of other kids for our kids to play with and we could keep an eye on them from our lounges. If you've been on a cruise, it's similar to a pool environment on a cruise ship. There were fun people to visit with and a bar a few steps away. The one bedroom was large. While we w ould have liked a two bedroom, we had plenty of room. The staff was great and there were plenty of activities in the kids center ( art's and crafts, movies, treasure hunts, ect.) The only addition I'd like to see is some self parking. Currently there is only valet. While the valet is free, we were pretty active coming and going so after a week the tips paid to the valet's started to add up. I'd set aside a stash of $1 bills for this. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: arlene123
Reviews.Content: Our apartment at the Marriott Grand Chateau was fabulous. The apartment is large, beautiful and spotlessly clean. The beds were comfortable with luxurious linens. The enormous soaking tub and two-person shower were delightful. The kitchen was very well equipped. Hotel staff was helpful, friendly and honest. Anytime we needed something for the apartment, it was delivered quickly. Once, I asked for extra towels, then left the apartment without realizing my cash and credit cards were laying on the kitchen counter. They were never touched! And when I had trouble connecting to the free wi-fi, the front desk connected me to a free IBM help desk that solved my problem. The store downstairs is well stocked, and there's also an ABC store in the Planet Hollywood mall across the street. I swam in the rooftop pool almost every day. Incredible view and location: close to the strip, yet quiet. We look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and all the amenities you could want in a suite”
Reviews.Author: jenna5671
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite for a week in February 2009 and were very pleased! We've always stayed at hotels (MGM, TheHotel, Rio, Luxor, TI, Excalibur, even Stratosphere once to check it out) so were hesitant at what my timeshare could offer us in Vegas. A great big space with everything we needed in a perfect location is what we got! The entire suite is decorated in brand new, clean sunny modern sort of country french design (don't worry, it's not frilly or flowered). The kitchen is fully stocked for all your needs - I made dinner for two and even breakfast for six one morning. Special note - if you are making bacon do it in the microwave. There's no real exhaust for smoke which resulted in us setting off the really loud smoke alarm but hotel staff responded IMMEDIATELY with friendly and very nice assistance. The dining room seats 6 comfortably. The living room has a comfortable couch, two chairs, and tables and a flat screen TV with a ton of cable channels. We actually stayed in once or twice to relax and watched a movie or two - very nice. The entire hotel has free WiFi - a nice touch that really came in handy. The bedroom is huge, with another big tv, comfortable bed with nice linens and good pillows, well lighted vanity area, and a really big two person jacuzzi. The separate bathroom has a two person, two shower head shower that was awesome. Our view out the bedroom and living room was of City Center on the strip and the side of Planet Hollywood and beyond - including a slice of the Bellagio fountains. My only gripe is that there is no full length mirror - come on, it's a must for getting dressed up for a night out in Vegas! The rooftop has a bar (open 11am to 6pm) with several tables and chairs, and 6-8 person hot tub and a small but fine sized pool (open from something like 7am to 11pm) with lounge chairs. We liked the day and night view from the roof - you can bring up your own wine and chill out while watching most of the Strip lights, from Mandalay Bay up to Caesar's and beyond. There's also a 24-hour fitness center but between Vegas fun and the ultra comfort of our suite, we never quite got there to check it out. As for location - this place is right behind the Harley Davidson Restaurant & parking lot located on the corner of Harmon and the Strip, across from the new City Center. Unless you cannot walk 90 seconds of a block, there is no reason to call this hotel "off the strip." Think of it this way - if you are staying "on the strip" at the MGM, you enter on the strip and then have to walk to the back of the hotel to check in or get to elevators so you've just walked 2 blocks indoors. At the Marriott, you are simply not walking through a casino. And if you chose not to walk the short block up to the Strip, but instead to cross Harmon Ave, you can enter Planet Hollywood & the shops through a side door located directly across (i.e., about 50 feet) from the Marriott's entrance. Marriott guests can use Planet Hollywood's pools and gym for free too. Check out Planet Hollywood's players club - when you join you get a ridiculous amount of free drink & $$ off the buffet coupons as well as free food and retail coupons. With the free drink coupons alone, we saved over $100! Also check out Planet Hollywood's buffet (since the Marriott does not have any restaurants). We were pleasantly surprised by how good the PH buffet was - the dessert bar even has cotton candy! Overally, Marriott Service was friendly and professional. Valet parking attendants and bellhops were great. One of them even gave us the name and number of a nightclub hostess who hooked us up with VIP service and a private table at Ghostbar at the Palms later that week. Score!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at an excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: ParamedicHoneycutt
Reviews.Content: I am writing this as I am looking out the window at the strip. The Marriott Grand Chateau is a great place to stay while in Vegas. This is our 5th time in Vegas and our first stay at MGC. We are staying in a one bedroom unit which has a full kitchen. Overall the MGC is in a very convenient location, close to most everything including transportation options. I like the free wireless internet service. There is no room service or housecleaning but we really do not miss that at all. When we needed extra towels we called for them and they were delivered within 30 minutes. Albertsons will deliver groceries plus there is a store downstairs next to the lobby. We ate breakfast and lunch in the room most days so we could splurge on dinner. The roof top pool offers great views of the city. Like I said this is an excellent place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, 2 min walk to strip”
Reviews.Author: AlaskansNeedtotravel
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The beds are very comfortable. The room is spotless and I am hard to please in that category. Located next to Planet Holywood's Miracle Mile which has incredible shopping and lots of choices in affordable dining. We will stay here if we ever come again. Only drawback-no daily maid service. Free wireless in the room, free toll free calling and free valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort just off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Hooksett_NH
Reviews.Content: Resort was just off the strip but within walking distance. The room was very clean and the service was great. The room was very comfortable with every ammenity (washer & dryer, flat screen tv's in all the rooms, microwave etc...) The master bathroom had a double headed shower and a large tub in the master bedroom, but did not have a jacuzzi :( Valet parking is the only way in and out with a car. The staff hustled to get your vehicle promptly. Only had to wait more than 5 minutes once during the entire week. The resort offers great views of the strip from the pool that is located on the roof. The pool was small and the sky bar is only open til 6pm :( The resort has activities for younger kids, but not for teenagers. This resort offers a smoke free environment with no casino and no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share with Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: First off, this property is a Marriott Timeshare so dont expect full service amenities such as a restaurant, room service, etc. However this property does offer complimentary valet and bell service and has a small marketplace with goodies and Starbucks coffee and Concierges to help you with your vacation activities. We had a guest unit/studio. This was alright for us for just 2 nights. The unit had a small frig, microwave, sink, plates, glasses, and coffee maker. The guest unit has a king bed. We found the unit to be really clean and comfortable. The guest unit has an ordinary shower. Not the "his and hers" shower heads in the Master Villa. Valet service was quick despite the long line of people checking out after a Presidents Day weekend. They worked their hardest to get our vehicle. The property has a shuttle which can take you to the Fashion Show Mall on the north end of the strip near Treasure Island and Wynn/Encore. Shuttle driver knew all the shortcuts to get around the parking lot that is the Strip. Used the concierge service and never once was asked to attend a timeshare presentation. Thank goodness! We already own at Marriott Canyon Villas in Phoenix and dont need another week. The property had a gym with treadmills, weights, elliptical machines, and bikes. Steam rooms in the locker rooms. Nice equipment. Internet service is wireless. For tickets to shows, I recommend going to "Tickets 4 Tonight" which has various store fronts on the Strip. Actually there is one about a block away from this property. Ask the concierge where the closest location is. We used this to get 2 for 1 tickets to see Louie Anderson stand up comedy. We also saw that they sold discounted tickets to "O", Elton John, Love, Cris Angel, Blue Man Group, Excalibur Knights of the Round Table, etc. The only problem is that they give you a voucher and you have to run over to the box office for the show that you are seeing to get a seat assignment. They also sell discounted passes to buffets. I recommend that you stop here if you come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Getawaygal43
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was good....just a short walk from the strip. Rooms were very nice as was the hotel overall. The pool was nothing to talk about and there was no restaurant but we weren't there for the pool and there are so many restaurants around we really didn't miss one not being on the property. Overall we had a wonderful experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies weekend in Las Vegas - GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Dawn868
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Marriott Grand Chateau via timeshare swap thru Marriott. The resort is about 50% complete in construction - but please do not let this push you off. The rooms are top-notch with all employees/concierge services VERY ATTENTIVE & ACCOMIDATING. We stayed on the 25th floor with great views - Bar and Pool on the roof for evening drinks ...BYOB your own bottle of wine saving a few dollrs from hitting the clubs on tthe strip later in the evening. This resot is nice for no SLOT MACHINES in the hotel - but just 1/2 block away at the Plant Hollywodd with all gambeling amenities. The Mircle Mile of Shops are across the street - allowing easy acess to resturants/shopping. There are kids activities MAIZE - adults too in painting your own wine and shot-glasses - and resort is very clean with great security - 24-Hr free valet parking a real plus. Overall I would say this is great for a group/family to relax with 1,2,3-Bedroom suites and full kitchen for entertaining - and allowing a home base for everyone to partake in the Las Vegas experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest Marriott Timeshares in the system. This is however a timeshare with no restaurant or room service. Located next to Planet Hollywood Casino you are just minutes from the miracle mile shops. One of the best equipped timeshares we have stayed at as far as the room goes. There are no barbeque grills at the property, this being the only downfall for us. The pool is very small but located on the roof, great place to have coffee in the morning. Taxis are always ready out front, and valet parking is free and fast. Staff was great, front desk was always ready to serve. A nice way to go to vegas and not be in the casinos the whole trip. Again a timeshare not a full service Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Villa on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom was large and very comfortable and the pool on the roof was terrific and not very crowded. The prperty itself was disappointing int hat it did nto have any restuarants and a very limtied market. It is possible they willa dd services but nothing much was open. For a hotel/timeshare this large there was very little acitvities or options.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay. Loved the double head shower!”
Reviews.Author: wmn9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traded our week in the Grand Vista in Orlando for a week at the Grand Chateau. We really enjoyed it. While the room is not as big as other Marriott "Grand" Timeshares, this was still much nicer than most rooms on the strip. Our 1 bedroom unit had a functional kitchen, a European washer and dryer and very nice furnishings. They have full size washer and dryers in the building if your need them. The property has free Wi-Fi. The property is expanding and there is construction at the Planet Hollywood (across the street) so ask for a quiet room. The roof top pool is a bit small, but the view at night is great. You can use the Planet Hollywood pool, but that pool is only open till Oct 31. Everyone we dealt with at the Marriott was great as always. Suggestions…. They have a shuttle bus to take you food shopping. I forget the name of the food store chain, but while the prices were much better than on the strip, they are a bit higher than normal. Nonetheless, we stocked up on food and adult beverages to enjoy in the room. If you plan on gambling at places other than Planet Hollywood (across the street) or MGM (10 min), I suggest you get a small rental car and park at the casinos free lots. Cabs will be $10 at least each way. We found it hard to get a cab at certain times due to a big conference. There is a monorail that appears to be close, but it really is a 10-15 min walk to the station and will cost $5 per ride or $15 for an unlimited day pass. We spent most of this trip at some of the older casinos- Gold Coast, O’sheas, Golden Nugget, Casino Royal (our favorite place to play black jack and craps due to the low limits). We also went to the Red Rock Canyon a nice day trip.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED, RUDE SERVICE!!”
Reviews.Author: RobinAustin21
Reviews.Content: I haven't been this disappointed with one of the properties ever, and we stay at Marriott hotels around the world more than 75 nights per year. The hotel wasn't even close to being ready to open, staff wasn't trained properly, incomplete room furnishings/amenties, major construction during peak check-in times, etc. It wasn't what was advertised, and we could have stayed at the Bellagio for much less!! We walked in to find the main fountain in the lobby undergoing major construction, where the dust was flying all over us, not to mention it was very noisy. We had just finished a six hour drive and were looking forward to a glass of wine, but there was NO service available (restaurant or bar), due to rain. At that point, we asked if we could be transfered to another Marriott and the assistant front desk clerk, Sang Han became quite arrogant and said we'd be charged for the night in each hotel, due to their cancellation policy. When we asked to speak to his manager (Tom), he told us we'd have to wait until the Monday following Thanksgiving (5 days). It got worse from there. We had a 7am flight the next morning and never received our wake up call. Basic amenities weren't available: no glasses in room, no full length mirror, can't call ahead to valet for car, and cheap, tacky decor. Doesn't do the other Vegas Marriott's any justice. Waste of $$$!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chadlerbing25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice I would very much stay there again. It’s a little off the main strip area so you don’t get all the noise and traffic but close enough you can walk to the strip. I had a 1 Bedroom suite and I loved the 2 person shower and the soaking tub. My friends would have to pound on the door each morning to make sure I didn’t fall asleep in the tub watching the flat screen in the bedroom. They have classes during the week for people staying there like one call was for 20 dollars the bar on the roof teaches you how to make some of your favorite mixed drinks. The little store in the lobby was nice for little things but I would suggest find a normal grocery store and stock up so you don’t spend an arm and a leg each morning for breakfast lunch and dinner. The beds were amazing I slept in all the time. The fully stocked kitchen was great even had a pizza cutter to my surprise. In the lobby they have water with fruit floating in it and it tastes so good. Staff was beyond nice and I always had more towels then I knew what to do with. In all a great stay!!. .FYI. .Vegas is Expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: sarah-toronto
Reviews.Content: loved the Marriott Grand Chateau! we go to Vegas a few times a year (from Canada) and usually stay at the Hilton when exchanging our timeshare, but the hilton is right at the end of the strip so was excited when the Marriott opened. The location is great! its a 1 min walk to the side of the Planet Hollywood mall which is full of great shops and restaurants. To the actual strip its 3 mins at the most. Seeing as most of the hotels on the strip are massive and set back from the actual road the time from Marriott to strip would be the same as MGM hotel room to strip. The only negative thing would be at night you have to walk down a road to the hotel rather than through a hotel, would not suggest that for women on their own at night...better to go through the planet hollywood mall to the side entrance or take a cab if late at night. Whenever I was walking late at night with my husband down the street there were always people around, but I did think to myself I would not feel comfortable without my hubby there. This is not a huge deal just the only negative thing I could think of about this location. The one bedroom suite was like an apartment, it was amazing to come home to every day and felt more like 'home' than a hotel room. Having a full kitchen saved us money as we went to the grocery store the first day so we didnt have to have every meal out. The room was on-par with any of the rooms Ive stayed in the MGM, Luxor etc. but obviously way bigger! Theres a large TV in the living room area and a smaller one in the master. Nice large tub that fits 2 in the master. Shower has a 2 shower head either side! The hotel has a shuttle that goes to the grocery store and to the Fashion Mall opposite the Wynn so very convenient. I would definitely stay here when I come back to Vegas. Unlike other timeshare hotels we were not bothered about going to a presentation at all (just a few phonecalls) and the staff were extremely nice. My hubby needed to send a fax and the front desk guy was so helpful printing it for us for no charge. definitely recommend the Grand Chateau!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: atrach88
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare for the Grand Chateau the week of Sept 21-28. I loved every aspect of this resort and plan to return there next year. The staff was absolutely wonderful, the room was immaculate. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever had and so clean and fresh. The view from the rooftop bar area was gorgeous. The pool was small, but at check in we were told we could make use of larger pools at the Polo Towers and Planet Hollywood if we chose to. No need on our part as we did not come to Las Vegas to swim...lol. They are expanding the property and will have 2 new pools in the next year, so do not count them out if you like to swim. The location is perfect with easy access to the entire strip area. The valet young men were so nice and helpful with directions. I cannot say enough great things about our stay. We did have a one bedroom and so we were really able to spread out and feel at home. The place is very clean, well staffed and just an absolute great place to stay. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Home on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wtmarks
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our Hilton Head week for a week at the Grand Chateau. We could not have been more impressed. The property is located right off the Strip,directly across the street from Planet Hollywood. MGM, New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo and Paris are a very easy walk away. The staff was extremely pleasant. We were asked once - and only once - whether or not we would like to listen to a timeshare presentation. Since we had our days pretty well booked with our guests, we declined and were not asked again. However, we will probably buy at this resort in the future. Currently, two of the four towers are completed and construction on the remaining towers has not begun, so there is no construction noise. We had a two bedroom unit with a full kitchen which was very well appointed. The washer and dryer were small and a full load in the dryer took a long time to dry so I would suggest drying several small loads rather than one large one. The master bedroom is large and had one of Marriott's super comfortable beds. The shower in the master bath had dual shower heads. The living/dining room had a nice table for a meal and a large flat screen tv.There is only a small store with a limited selection of groceries onsite, so if you want to stock up, take advantage of the free shuttle to a nearby grocery store. There is valet parking only, but the valets were incredible. If we called down, the car was always waiting for us. If we didn't call first it took no longer than five minutes to get our car. Don't miss the view at night from the rooftop pool area - and while you're there have a drink at the bar. The pool and hot tub were small but never seemed to be crowded. We plan to return to Vegas in two years and will only stay at the Grand Chateau!

Reviews.Title: “did the time share thing”
Reviews.Author: SherryHa
Reviews.Content: The check in was quick and efficient, and the studio room was nice. I really wanted a 1 bedroom and was told we were getting a 1 bedroom, but oh well, glad I didn't bring my brother and his wife as was planned, there wouldn't have been a place to sleep. There were no washer/dryers in this studio either. Efficiency kitchen was satisfactory. The little store downstairs didn't have much. Walking across the street to the planet holllywood or out 2 blocks to catch a bus were other options. I wasn't impressed. We stayed on the 33rd floor overlooking the strip and all the construction, not a pretty view right now. Didn't like the fact the pool and bar were on the roof. The time share presentation was no pressure and the units are nice that they are showing, and the prices aren't bad. We have Westin timeshare in Maui and Hilton in Las Vegas, so decided we didn't need another one.

Reviews.Title: “comfort convenience and a touch of home”
Reviews.Author: samurai4q
Reviews.Content: my wife and i just concluded a week long stay at the chateau as we traded in on an interval exchange and we were quite satisfied with all the place had to offer. we generally stay at the hilton and generally go to vegas 2-3 times a year but opted for a change as we like the home style amenities a timeshare can offer. in general timeshare properties in vegas are well off the strip. this is just right. the side door to the miracle mile at planet hollywood is across the street. and yes the current pool is small and if travelling during a peak family period it could get interesting for space, but there is a larger one on the way over the garage, when i'm not sure. the view from the rooftop pool/bar at nite is what u travelled there for...if u are a photo taker there is a view of the south strip which is spectacular. a note about slot play...my wife and i are seasoned slot players and lets face it these large hotels are not built by the contributions of winners. we have found the slot play at the casinos on fremont st to be far more generous. so play a bit as u walk through the pyramids of the 21st century but save your money for fitzgeralds or the 4 queens. the rat pack returns and barbara and frank: the concert that never was shows are highly recommended for entertainment versus cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, not a typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: whodman
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I am a devoted Marriott guest. I have stayed in Marriott properties from the JW to the Fairfield Inn and I stay in Marriott properties because of the consistency in quality. However, I will never stay at the Grand Chateau again. I went to the property for a timeshare preview and received a smaller studio room. That was okay by me, although I would have preferred the larger one-bedroom. The property has some positives. It's hard to beat the location, although there is some construction noise during the day, it is not overbearing. You can easily walk across the street to Planet Hollywood and there are several casinos in walking distance. The rooms themselves are nice and the bathrooms are more than acceptable. My problem stems with the service. Maybe Vegas hotels can afford to be a little less than accomodating because people will always go there to visit and they are still building hotels left and right so if one properties doesn't get your business somebody else will certainly follow, especially on weekends. But I had a major problem with housekeeping in my room. I went out and when I came back the carpet around my kitchenette was soaked and the water seeped into my closet. Housekeeping left towels on the floor to soak up the water, but no explanation followed. We complained and the hotel moved us to a similar room (another studio) paid for cleaning the wet clothes in the closet. We were late for a dinner appointment because of the problem and were disappointed that we didn't get an upgrade in room for our troubles. We did complain to the manager the next morning and we got half off our room rate. That said, in a city known for comps, I don't understand why we didn't get a better room or get the room comped for one night. The night valet service was also lacking and very slow, even though there weren't many cars on a Sunday night. I am still loyal to Marriotts but next time I will go to the JW or Marriott Suites. I believe the management there (and I've stayed in both places over the years) serve their customers better. Also, with everything that happened, I would be very reluctant to buy a timeshare at that Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott Grand Chateau is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: preciouscottoncandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau last week of July and just loved it....the Vacation Club property was beautiful and well run. The help at the front desk is excellent and very accommodating. Our one bedroom with kitchen was awesome...so clean and beds were so comfortable...the kitchen was nicely furnished with dishes, supplies, etc...the washer and dryer was nice to have so that we didn't have to pack such big suitcases.... The lobby was beautiful and nice to sit and relax or wait for family. An added touch was two water coolers with sliced cucumbers....nothing better to drink when you come in from the hot, hot Las Vegas temperatures....nice touch. The location is wonderful....Planet Hollywood is across the street with the wonderful Miracle Mile Shoppes....an ABC Store is there with all the items you could possibly need at a good price...Marriott Grand Chateau also has a store in lobby which was nice but a bit more expensive..... Free valet service which was superb...valets were wonderful and very organized and efficient. Also, a Walgreen's closeby to develop photos or pick up souvenirs, food items, etc.....best Walgreens I have ever been to..... Only negative would be the size of swimming pool...it is on the rooftop and quite breathtaking at night, however, the pool isn't like most found at resorts but does have a nice bar...Marriott will eventually build a pool once all the timeshare towers are complete. We would definitely return as it is in a very convenient location back from the strip but near everything. A great Marriott Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: zooming
Reviews.Content: Myself along with husband, a 25 year old and 21 year old stayed in a 2 bedroom. Could not pick a better location to the strip. Rooms were clean and had everything you could ask for. Beds were comfortable.We had a concern over valet parking but it was never an issue. Tipping wasn't necessary. Fitness centre was fabalous, could not find any fault with it. Marketplace Food store too pricey but shopping centre was close by. Pool was small and too hot without any shade and too many people in the pool. However, you can use the pools at Planet Holloywood, ask at front desk. Overall, great place, great location and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mslibra80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2/2 suite in this resort and absolutely LOVED it! The rooms are very spacious and nicely furnished. The beds feel oh so soft. Both bedrooms have private bathrooms. The master bathroom has a large tub and shower with dual shower heads. Even the towels were above par. We were on the 32nd floor and had a fabulous view of New York New York, MGM Grand, and the Excalibur. The hotel is in a perfect spot... very close to the strip but without the crowds and traffic other hotels on the strip offer. The front desk clerks are superb - we arrived at the hotel a bit early (9am) and even though check in isn’t until 4pm, they let us in our suite. Vegas in July is h.o.t.... and for this the lobby offers refreshing flavored water to keep you cool. Who knew that adding sliced cucumbers to a pitcher of water tasted so good? Lol. There is a lot of construction going on… but it wasn’t an inconvenience at all. We didn’t hear any noise and it was kind of entertaining watching the cranes lift the glass panes on to the buildings. The pool sucked... but I think they are working on building another one... There is not a casino in the resort - which we liked. It makes the place quiet and keeps the place from getting overcrowded. And slots and tables are only steps away on the strip.... Along with some tasty places to eat - including the Spice Market Buffet in PH... very yummy... We will definitely book our next Vegas trip here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: hzeller1
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Some construction however but the management quickly satisfied us by moving us to a different room. The rooms are very cleanin a studio apartment style.

Reviews.Title: “Bought Timeshare!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveler914
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau from Friday, June 27th through Monday, June 30th with my husband. We normally stay at the JW Marriott which is several miles away from the strip. This was the first time we were actually staying on the strip (well, 1 block off) and were quite nervous that it was going to be a bit too crazy for us (I am 5 months pregnant). We stayed at the Grand Chateau after receiving a 3 night/4 day offer as long as we attended the timeshare presentation. We were very relieved when we arrived at the Grand Chateau. It was very close to all the action but tucked away enough that we were not bothered by the crowds. Rooms: We had a 1 bedroom unit which was very clean and large! We really didn't take advantage of the full kitchen or washer and drier but it would be a great thing to have if our stay was a bit longer. There was construction going on at the Planet Hollywood across the street but it really did not bother us at all. Pool: The pool was small but was never too crowded. They did also give us the option to use the pool over at the Planet Hollywood Hotel. They did not volunteer this information but we asked after we overheard someone else asking. We didn't end up checking it out but heard it was nice. Gym: Had a very nice sized gym. Each machine had a TV and it was never too crowded. All new equipment (which I guess would be expected from a new hotel!) We always stay at Marriott properties and decided to purchase the Timeshare during the presention. We probably won't use it to come back to Las Vegas too much (mostly b/c we will have a new baby) but it really was too good of a deal to pass up (for us anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but still major construction happening.”
Reviews.Author: audreyalan
Reviews.Content: The marriott grand chateau is Las Vegas will be a very nice property once it's finished, but right now, they are still working on it, and selling it's timeshare like crazy! Everywhere you go in Vegas, they want to sell you this property. Which is how I ended up there. THe only pool there is the rooftop one, which, with temperatures soaring over 100 degrees and no shade, is not really that great! There is no restaurant, although it's about 1 block from the strip and accross the street from Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops. Room was nice, but I found the service "unpolished". Not up to par to other properties in Vegas, and if I'm going to buy into the place, I want to be treated like I belong there! But it's still a nice property and good with family, since there is no casino traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: YogaGirlOhio
Reviews.Content: I traded my timeshare week for a stay here, and I was very happy with the property. It's new, clean, safe, and relatively quiet, located VERY close to the Strip (Planet Hollywood, Paris, Ballys, etc.). I was awakened one night by the fellow in the next room who decided to sing karoake with a bunch of girls, but other than that, I didn't hear much. I was told that construction was going on and I heard it once and saw it once, but the entire Strip is under construction right now. Be advised: there are different types of one bedrooms. Make sure you know what you're getting. My room was small with an awesome king bed, small pull-out sofa, a roomy, nice bathroom and an efficiency kitchen with a microwave, sink, small fridge, coffee maker, plates, glassware, etc. There were only two of us and we weren't in Vegas for the hotel room, but if you think four adults can stay in that size room comfortably, think again. Two adults and a child could handle it. Oh, and I never actually saw a housekeeper and didn't have housekeeping "tidy up" because it costs extra $. Still, if you need extra towels, shampoo, soap, all you have to do is ask. There's a downstairs Market Place store selling all types of things and yes, it's pricey, but the new Vegas isn't cheap anymore. The days of Prime Rib and Lobster for $9.99 are gone, gone, gone. There are liquor/snack stores across the street in the Miracle Mile Shops, so you can pick up things there or take the shuttle to the local grocery. The hotel staff are nice. They keep ice cold cucumber infused water in the lobby all the time. If you decide to go on a tour, SweetTours offers several. We took one to the Grand Canyon ($130 each). It took 7 hours to get out there because of the stops (Hoover Dam, Route 66, getting gas, etc.) and 5 hours to get back. We were at the canyon for almost three hours. Worth it? Yes, especially if you have the time and don't want to pay $4.33 a gallon and drive almost 600 miles in a day. Actually, the tour was a nice break from the Strip. The pool on the 38th floor was small but well maintained. One gripe: no full-length mirrors anywhere. I "complained" and the concierge said "that's the most common complaint we get here..." (uh, then buy some?). Taxis are easy to get but walk as much as you can. The Strip's traffic jams force long wait times and a trip from the hotel down to the Mirage was $12.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: SandSunandSea
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a four night stay at the Marriott Grand Chateau and must say that both my travelling companions and I were all very satisfied with our stay at the hotel. The greatest asset of the property is its central location close to the strip. Although it is not directly on Las Vegas Blvd, it is a minute from the strip right next to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops. The hotel is new and very well maintained. Although they are presently adding another wing to the hotel, we were never disturbed by the construction noise nor from the construction noise of the other properties going up around the hotel. We booked a two bedroom penthouse suite which consited of two closed bedrooms each with its own washroom, as well as a living room with a large flat screen tv and a large kitchen fully equiped (toaster, coffee machine, glasses, plates, etc) and also included granite counter tops and a washer and dryer. The hotel also provided us with soap and laundry detergent during our stay. As usual within the Marriott chain hotels, the beds were very comfortable and also had quality linens. It is also important to mention that this hotel is a timeshare hotel so if you wish to have someone come clean your room daily, it is for an extra fee. The hotel also has a rooftop pool and bar. The views are wonderful at night. The area is kept very clean and has lounge chairs for sunbathing. Although the pool is quite small, especially when you see the pool areas of the much larger gaming hotels on the strip, it still provides a nice refreshment from the dry heat. There is a convenience store in the lobby which sells coffee, toast, sodas, juices, etc which you can purchase and prepare breakfast in your room. However, located right across the street within the Miracle Mile shops are various restaurants offering breakfast for under $5.00. There is also a Walgreens close to the hotel where you can pick up other items such as water, chips, chocolate, etc for less than the convenience store directly in the hotel. I would strongly recommend the Marriott Grand Chateau to anyone looking for a very clean, quite, safe and well located hotel close to the strip. However, if you are seeking the lights, commotion and casino ambience of the more traditional Las Vegas hotels, then it would be better to reserve at another hotel located directly on Las Vegas Blvd such as the Bellagio, MGM or Treasure Island which offer various dining options, shops, shows and casinos under the same roof.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay but double charged”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation over six months ago. About two months later I had to change the dates and was told there would be no problem. During one of the Eleven, yes Eleven phone calls from the time share sales person (it got really annoying) I found out they had two reservations for me. The reservationist did not change the first reservation she made another one. So I had two reservations over lapping. When I called the hotel directly to let them know there was a problem the girl on the phone kept saying "we require a 7 day cancellation". I explained the situation three times and each time she said the same thing. Why would I need to reservations that over lap two days? Hotel is fine style and amenities wise but it is basically the cookie cutter marriott timeshare product. Nothing overly special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite, great place, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: matguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a promotional gift to attend a Timeshare Presentation. Usually, if you're here for this reason, be prepared to not get a suite, you will likely have an intermediate room (aka "Lock Off" room) which is the second bedroom part of a 2 bedroom suite. As luck would have it, we happened to get the other side, a full 1 bedroom suite. The 1 bedroom suites are very nice. Not that I stay in a lot of luxury places, but I was very impressed. The room was comfortable in all ways. Being not attached to a casino, they're not trying to get you out of the room, so they have nice freebies not un-common in most cities, but not usually seen in Vegas hotels, such as free premium channels (such as HBO) and free WiFi. The Big Plasma screen was nice (the channel guide didn't work though) as well as the mini-stereo. The double shower was nice as well as the big soaking tub (was odd draining though, which could be the plumbing issues other people have mentioned.) The place was quiet, we didn't hear any construction or plumbing noise, but the AC was a bit noisy, no less than the AC units in other "mainstream" hotels though. As much as it was nice to have the kitchen, and as much as we planned on using it, we just didn't, but it was nice to have the option. We did use the fridge, it worked (shrug.) The pillows on the bed were a bit flat, but the front desk sent up a replacement (although we found out there were more in the closet for the pull out bed.) It was also nice to have the extra blankets in the closet since the comforter on the bed was thick and hot, the thinner blanket was perfect. We were on the 7th floor, facing the strip. No view to speak of, we could see the MGM sign, the Polo Club, construction, and part of the Belagio sign. At night though the construction view wasn't as bad, just twinkling lights and purple neon from the Polo Club. Short elevator ride though. From the roof pool though, that was a nice view. The weather was not so great (may 21st to 24th) when we were there, so the pool was closed the first day due to wind, which is probably the main down-side to a roof pool, but other things were closed in the area as well (Belagio fountains, Sirens of TI.) The lobby and exterior were nice; the mini-store was handy, although a bit expensive, but you pay for convenience. Von's (general supermarket) wasn't that far away if you have a car, we passed by it on the way to the Pinball Museum on Tropicana. There is no self parking, the Valet is the only thing to park on site, but they are fast and plenty courteous (they lost someone's keys while we were there, but took care of them well by paying for the locksmith and taxi's while they searched the area and videos to find the keys.) If you're going for a Timeshare presentation, be prepared for the presentation. I've been to a few and this one is on the nice side, but it's still sales. Plan on at least 2 hours, closer to 2.5 when you include waiting for them. The sales person we had was very personable and easy to talk to; they'll show you lots of options. (We didn't buy, but it looks like a decent deal, choose for yourself.) Checkout is a bit early for us at 10AM (well, early when you're in Vegas) but you may be able to get a late checkout, call early to find out or check the night before, they didn't have any available at 8:3AM when we called. This is a great location, fine with a car or not. We didn't have our car the first day, PH was right next door, simply across the street. It'll be even nicer when the City Center is done and when the other 2 towers are finished (another pool, larger, on top of the garage is planned.)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TaranakiHolidayLover
Reviews.Content: We were travelling as a family group of 5 and had trouble finding accommodation to suit a groups needs. I booked this apartment style hotel after researching on the Net and we were all very pleased with this choice. The Hotel was not part of a casino but was very conveniently situated very centrally next to the busy Strip, and we enjoyed the peacefulness this hotel offered. The minute you enter this hotel you see its style and the rooms are equally superb. We had booked a 3 bedroom apartment and it was excellent value for money and much more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Worked GREAT for this guy!”
Reviews.Author: RoyWally
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Chateau May 5 - May 9 in a King room on the 27th floor facing the Polo Towers and Strip, booked through the Marriott website. Location is very nice, just a very short walk up Harmon to S Las Vegas Blvd. And across Harmon is Planet Hollywood, which will pretty much be your "home casino" while staying at the Grand Chateau. For those who are up for walking, you can easily walk to MGM Grand, Monte Carlo, New York-New York, Excalibur, Tropicana, Paris, Bally's, and Bellagio. And once MGM City Center is finished, that'll be right there too! Valet parking was complimentary, but you couldn't tell that by the effort put forth by the crew, as they were on top of everything. Good attitudes, good hustle, good service. No problems at check-in, a few minutes and I was headed to my room. Good bank of elevators, 6 total I believe. Never had to wait more than 30 seconds going up or down. Rooms are nice, with a nice layout and a decent "kitchenette" setup including a fridge, microwave, toaster, sink, plates, utensils, etc. Most important for me were the wine glasses and corkscrew. The dresser/armoire setup was good, the sleeper sofa decent, and the bed.. I love Marriott's beds at this hotel level. So comfy. Bathroom is spacious, with a nice counter top surrounding the sink so there's ample room for stuff. The shower isn't fancy, but does the job. Most importantly, shower head was tall enough for me at 6'2". And yes, the water got to SCALDING hot very easily, so watch out! But I'll take that over NO hot water any day! The construction at the PH and City Center sites was not enough to wake me up in the morning, and I didn't notice it much at all while in the room at different times of the day. For anyone wanting to be near the strip but not wanting to deal with the craziness that goes with casino hotels, this place is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dooley4556
Reviews.Content: We Stayed on the 28th floor the first weekend of May. It was a wonderful experience. Our room was neat and clean, and exactly how the pictures show it. We had a one bedroom suite and had 4 people staying in it, and there was plenty of room. Our view was of the airport not the strip, but we can't complain. There was a little construction noise in the middle of the day, but it wasn't bothersome. Planet Hollywood is right next door and that is where we ended up spending most of our time since it has shows, shops, food, and casinos. I know the grande chateau is a timeshare property but I would have liked there to be some sort of restaurant in the building. All it has is a convenient type store in the lobby. $6 for a little salad. So we didnt really get much from there. The pool on the roof was nice. Small, but adequate. Got quite busy on really sunny days. The concierge was very helpful helping me and my sister-in-law book a spa treatment elsewhere. All in all, great quiet place a block from the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Warning - All 1 bedroom are not the same”
Reviews.Author: mjljjl
Reviews.Content: We're Marriott owners in the first 24 hours of our stay, and so far are extremely disappointed. The Chateau knows they have a problem with Interval and has done nothing to remedy it. We came expecting a one bedroom as described on their website and in the reviews above. Turns out there are two classes of one bedrooms. If you get stuck with a one bedroom which is the lockoff portion of a three bedroom suite you end up with a room half the size of the normal rooms, a bathroom with one single vanity and one mirror. This room is supposed to accommodate up to four people and every other Marriott one bedroom we've stayed in does - they may be tight but they are workable. At the Chateau its tough to have two people in this room. There isn't even a second mirror in the whole place. The area only accommodates a two person dining table but they squeezed in four chairs. We had to stack up two of the dining room chairs in a corner as they blocked the entrance door and the kitchen area. The Chateau itself does not call this a one-bedoom, but they allow Interval to keep booking this as a one-bedroom. If you know what a junior suite is at a Residence Inn, that is what it is. We are here for a week and supposedly they are working with Interval to try and get us moved. Lots of talk from them about how Marriott can't do anything; however, Marriott owners are supposed to have priority. I'll post again in a couple of days and let you know if Marriott comes through and remedies the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Chateau”
Reviews.Author: Fox_Valley_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau for a couple nights. Overall an excellent facility with a great location as described in several other recent reviews. We stayed in a 1 bedroom timeshare unit and the unit is accurately depicted in the hotel photos. The experience is what you would typically expect from a Marriott timeshare. Note that construction is an issue, but not that bad. There is construction on the new tower for the Grand Chateau as well as across the street at Planet Hollywood. It does get a bit noisy in the morning when they start work at 5:30am. The rooftop pool is small, but nice. The pool bar has happy hour prices for a couple hours on weekdays. The Grand Chateau also offers free wireless internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to Traditional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmydogsam
Reviews.Content: I was able to stay here as part of my timeshare exchange. It is a lovely location and the roof top pool and view is awesome. It seems a bit small, but every time I was up there I always found a seat. Maybe if they build the other 2 towers and don't add another pool there will be a problem. Everything is new and beds are super comfortable. Gym was nice and included too (I hate paying extra to workout). Certainly a place I would recommend and stay at again if I ever return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Suites!! Great location, off strip close to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: lovebirdsonthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a timeshare property and is simply fabulous!!! The suites come with fully equipped kitchens with washer and dryers. There is an awesome flat screen TV in the main family room and a separate TV in the bedroom. There was also a jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom. The bathroom was simply gorgeous with a marble shower with 3 shower heads. This changed our entire LV experience and I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: biotechwriter
Reviews.Content: - Location – Having been to Vegas several times before, location is indeed everything since everything else is so far away! MGC has a great location right next to Planet Hollywood (going by the lower case ‘ph’) which is almost done with the redecorating from the old Aladdin although the mall part still needs much work. There was no trouble getting a cab (my preferred means of transit) which was a big plus over other non-casino lodging. I could also walk to MGM but it was quite a walk and past some of the cheap trinket shops and a 24 hr Walgreens (also nice to have close by). - Room – First let me say that while I knew in advance that this was a timeshare/suite hotel, that did not prepare me for the size of the room. It was quite spacious! Fully stocked kitchen (I don’t cook in Vegas when Chef Puck has so many choices for me!) along with a washer/dryer unit in the closet. King bed was very comfy. Double shower heads were fantastic and water pressure was good. Soaking tub was a great option on the last night when I wanted to wash all the Vegas dust off and prepare to return to the “real” world. There was some plumbing noise and the AC unit was louder than most. The outside of the windows were really dirty because of the construction outside. The windows blocked most of the construction noise from the ph tower that was being erected not 250 feet from my room! - Service – I only had my room cleaned once while I was there. Standard care, nothing extraordinary. The valets and bellmen were all really friendly and appreciated being tipped (who doesn’t) but weren’t as pushy as some can be in sin city! - “timeshare” – I thought I was going to be overwhelmed with pushy sales people trying to get me to “take the tour” and “experience the difference of ownership” but that just didn’t happen. I was offered to come to one meeting and that was it. The staff never asked me again and I was treated no differently than anyone else in the place. Although there was an owners’ lounge which I did not try to use…they need their perks! - The Roof – This is only place I have stayed in Vegas to date that offered guests access to the roof. I enjoyed this and would consider it a true plus to staying here. There is something about getting a panoramic view of the strip that gives it a whole different appearance (see photos).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean / brand new. No amenities.”
Reviews.Author: TommyBoy2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days during Feb 08 for a business conference. Definitely not a bad place to stay for a business event, if you want to have a nice clean room that has plenty of taxicabs out front and you can be to a conference in a few minutes. The hotel room was nice - great layout for a hotel room with a king bed, pullout sofa, nice decor and great bath. Of course, it's brand new, so that's sort of what I expected, but it did meet expectations. One thing to be alerted to: there are no restaurants on site. They have built only 1 of 3 towers to be located on this site, and presumably there will be a full complement of restaurant choices when complete, but not now. Only a 24 hr convenience shop with outrageous prices, even for Vegas (can you say $80 for a generic sweatshirt and a marriott logo, or $3 for a coke?). So if you have plans to get work done in the hotel itself, don't count on ordering room service. Nor is there any place in the lobby to pop open a laptop for an hour - just FYI. Same goes for families with small kids- there is nothing really for them to do IN the hotel (there is some kids program but it looked sort of weak to me - I did not have my kids with me to try it out though). Can't have them walk around the lobby with you for 1/2 hour looking at shops or toys etc - there's just nothing there that would be of any interest to them. Otherwise, the service was fantastic, the location right off the strip and next to the shopping mall was very convenient, and you're getting a good night's rest for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Noisy nights”
Reviews.Author: MsGodmother
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed for Christmas Week. Great location, new, well stocked. Only real problem was at 2:30 in the morning the room above us would fill the tub and we would be abruptly awakened by the water noises. Staff was great, room was clean. Would stay again but request a really high floor and hope no one is above me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chateau”
Reviews.Author: bbaby1976
Reviews.Content: We only had one night at the Chateau after having stayed at the Wynn. We were very happy with the facilities and the location, one block off the strip and right next to great shopping at the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. The rooftop pool had great views- also free water with sliced citrus fruit in the lobby was very welcoming sight after walking the hot dusty strip. We loved the atmosphere at the hotel, we just regret not having more time to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant week in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jyoung3381
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Marriott Grand Chateau. We came to Vegas to visit family and friends. It has been easy to access the property and get across town with our rental car by using Koval and Hacienda instead of Las Vegas Blvd. The free valet parking works very well. A couple of dollar tip every time you pick up your car is well worth it to have your car parked in the Grand Chateau parking garage. Front desk people are responsive and accomodating. We needed two extra place settings for a meal we were serving and all arrived within 15 minutes after the request. The elevators are very prompt. The room was without fault. We had a room on the 30th floor on the Harmon St side. The noise we heard was NOT from the Marriott construction, but from other new construction. It was not offensive but be aware that construction noise is a way of life on the strip. At times even during the night. All in all, the Grand Chateau meets and/or exceeds the Marriott Customer Service expectations expected.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: BillableBarbie
Reviews.Content: My parents own a Marriott timeshare in another location, which I exchanged for the Grand Chateau. Usually my husband and I stay at the Bellagio, and I was expecting a downgrade. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. The rooms (1 bedroom, living room with sofabed, full kitchen) were immaculate. The kitchen was very well stocked in terms of appliances, paper towels, soap, etc. The two-headed shower was a great touch, as was the tub in the bedroom big enough for two. The flat-panel TVs were also a plus. The location was great; less than five minutes to get to Planet Hollywood, about ten minutes to the Bellagio. The only downsides are that 1) the convenience store is WAY overpriced; and 2) they charge exorbitant fees for maid service, so we passed. Note: We managed to dodge the timeshare presentation, but be warned; Marriott timeshare folks are right there with the rest of them in the malls (although they're less pushy than the average timeshare folk!). All in all, a very nice experience (especially since it was free), and not too much of a step down from the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas View”
Reviews.Author: babsdisney
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at our timeshare at the Marriott Grand Chateau in Las Vegas. January was a little too cold for us but we managed to use the wonderful hot tub on the top floor of the hotel every day. The view is magnificent and so worth a trip up to see. There is also a heated pool and a bar up there as well. There is a Market Place for necessary items such as milk, bread, cereal, sodas, snacks. There is also hot coffee and a beverage fountain in the Market Place. There is an owner's lounge that came in handy when we had to check out and our flight did not leave for a couple of hours. There are couches and a nice TV as well as computers you can use for $ .35 per minute. The staff is very helpful and courteous. We stayed in our lock off room which had refrig,coffee,toaster,microwave, dishes and silverware. The only downfall or may be a good thing is that there is no casino in the hotel, however you have Planet Hollywood and MGM right next door within walking distance. The other casino's depending on the weather are also within walking distance. We would definitely recommend this hotel especially if you are staying for a week or longer.

Reviews.Title: “Under Development, but a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SouthPasRef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Marriott Grand Chateau in mid January 2008. Although we enjoy Las Vegas, we do not smoke or gamble, and therefore, this was a great place for us. This is a time share property, not a hotel, so you can expect what a time share, particularly a Marriott time share offers, i.e., a non-smoking facility, no casino, a family friendly environment (e.g., iced water with lemon or orange always available in the lobby, cookies in the afternoon, MAZE kids club on site, etc.). The rooms are large and well appointed; we enjoyed watching the sunsets from our room as the lights came up on the city. Also, the living room featured a 42" LCD television with 95 channels and a DVD player. The place is new and in some areas still under construction, so it looks great, and it is very clean and nice. But don't expect daily maid service unless you want to pay extra, and don't expect many of the usual hotel features, like a spa or restaurants, as neither are on site. But, you do get complimentary valet parking that is fast, friendly and efficient, and the location, 1 block off the Strip across the street from Planet Hollywood, and 2 blocks from the Bellagio, is great. There is a workout facility on site, a roof-top pool and hot tub (we did not use them as it was cold and windy while we were there, but the view from the roof, 37 stories above the desert, is not to be missed), and a roof top bar that is open during the warm months. And, with a friendly and efficient staff that takes care of your needs consistent with the location (i.e., concierge service is available on site, but room service is not), this is a great place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - I will return!”
Reviews.Author: sanjoseskater
Reviews.Content: First off, the Hotel is brand new and located about 200 yards from the Strip (Las Vegas Boulevard). I have stayed at many great hotels in Las Vegas before and this place was great. The service was top notch with friendly personnel at the front desk/valet/belldesk, etc... The Lobby is very clean and smoke free with NO casino! This was a bonus since you do need some down time from all the noise and excitement of the Strip. Valet parking is also free. The room was huge. I had a Villa Suite. It was perfect and very clean. Plasma TV on the wall in the family room, a large kitchen with all the cabinets stocked, a full size fridge, oven, stove, microwave, double headed shower, and a sink and massive bathtub in the bed area. I had a guest that slept on the sofa which converted into a bed. He said it was one of the best nights sleep he had ever had. He could not believe that a sofa bed could be so comfortable, and I tried it and it was quite nice. The King size bed in the main room was also very comfortable and also included its own TV. Both rooms also had DVD players and you can rent movies down in the Lobby. They did a great job cleaning the rooms and even made up the sofa bed after the first night of using it. My favorite thing to do at Hotels is to use the fitness center and pool area. Let me tell you about the fitness center. It had all the equipment you could ever need and it was very clean. Plenty of TVs to watch on the treadmills and other equipment. The best part was the Locker room which included a huge steam room. I have never been in a steam room that was as efficient as this one. You could hardly see your hand if front of your face. It was magnificient! To top it off (no pun intended) , the Hotel decided to put a Pool, Hot Tub and Bar on the top of the Hotel. It was January, so I did not see anyone using the Heated Pool or Hottub. Well, I had a few friends join me at the pool. We enjoyed the Hot Tub for about an hour. It was so nice. Not one person bothered us because they were not there (and the hotel was completely booked!). The view was amazing. You could see the whole Strip from end to end. There were heating lamps out on a patio in front of the bar to keep you warm and smoking was allowed in a small area. The bar was closed because it was winter, but in the summer time it will be perfect. I really enjoyed myself at this hotel and I plan on staying here every year when I return for the Consumer Electronics Show in January. Regarding the construction going on at nearby properties and at the Marriott property, I did not hear a single thing realted to construction. In fact I could not hear anything outside at all. The room is sealed very well. Keep in mind my room was facing the strip. If you face the opposite direction (towards the airport) you may hear something but I can not attest to that. I only have one complaint and this is because I am a technology enthusiast. They have beautiful HD Sony Plasma TV's in every room, however they are only delivering analog programming to every room. This blows me away. What a waste of a TV. There is no reason to have these TV's if they are not going to deliver High Definition content. In fact, this is not dificult to do either and would cost the hotel $0 since all the local TV stations broadcast Over the Air (received with an antenna) in High Definition and is FREE. If anyone from the hotel reads this review, please make an upgrade to the TV service. IOther than my one issue with the TVs I HIGHLY recommend staying here. You will be treated nicely and will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Beautiful, Well Built, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: REALdutchessMom
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel... Well actually it's more like a residence. My boyfriend and I get a week time share from his parents so I think most of the rooms here are time shares though they do rent it out as a regular hotel. We absolutely loved our room - a one bedroom suite, kitchen, dining table, two flat screens, hot tub and double shower. Literally after the first night in Vegas we didn't leave the room! Service is extremely friendly. I left my cell phone in my car and they went and got it and brought in up to me right away. There is no room service or daily maid service so that's the only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars. But I guess that's normal for time shares. Of course you can always get fresh towels or sheets anytime. And the concierge is more than happy to reccommend some restaurants that deliver. Anyway, the location is extremely convenient right off the strip. They have a free shuttle that goes to the Fashion Mall. There is a little gift shop that has all kinds of food to make in your room. I really liked staying in a place without a casino and all that mayem. It was nice to retreat back here after a late night of clubs and gambling. There is also a complimentary gym (somehow the elevator has been skipping that floor haha :) Also a pool and bar on the roof which I haven't seen cause it's cold this time of year. All in all I would definitely reccomment this place.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: chobhamlass
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our Marriott Timeshare for a week in Vegas over Christmas. The property is an oasis of calm on the Strip (well, just off the strip but closer than parts of the big hotels because they are so ...well....big). First off, construction noise. They have yet to build two more towers on this property so noise will be an on-going issue, but when we were there they were doing internal work on an existing tower so we heard no noise from our property. However the whole of Vegas is a construction zone and there was early morning noise (5am onwards) from a huge site across the Strip. Guests at areas of Bellagio, Polo Towers, ph , and Monte Carlo would have been more affected than us however. Grand Chateau is very nicely decorated and the suites are spacious. The pool is tiny but it was too cold to swim anyway! There is no restaurant on site but many within easy walking distance. We walked nearly everywhere because the traffic on the Strip made walking just about quicker than a cab! GC has a shuttle bus to and from the Fashion Show Mall several times a day and to a local supermarket once a day friday-tues I think (ie. the mornings after check-in days). We tried the Deuce bus once when we wanted to go downtown. Maybe we were unlucky but we found that we had to wait 20 minutes for a very crowded bus, and we got a cab back( after a lovely meal at Hugo's)! Also had a wonderful (traditional) Christmas lunch at The Verandah restaurant at the Four Seasons. Best turkey I've had (but don't tell my mother). As for shows, we loved Ka and Spamalot, and found Mac King (free if we bought a $9 drink, no-brainer!) side-achingly funny! We got most of our tickets through Tix4tonite(5 mins from GC) Best tip though: Before you go print out a VIP line voucher from the Tix4Tonite website and this will save you maybe a half hour or more in line. I printed out a few but they let us use the same one for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: martireese
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let anyone who is interested that the Marriott Grand Chateau was great. We arrived late on December 16th and the front desk staff was very helpful. Check in was quick and painless. We had been given a week of timeshare by a friend for our anniversary. The one bedroom villa was very nice. It was located in a good area with everything within a 10 min. drive. Yes, the maid service is extra but we made out fine with just getting towels and clean sheets with no problem. I know when you are on vacation you feel you should not have to clean up but I enjoyed my privacy. We did not have to worry about having someone come in our room everyday and distrub us if we just wanted to stay in. I love the Grand Chateau and would recommend it to anyone who inquired. Oh, and even though we did not have to do the timeshare presentation when they ask we decided to see what it was about. They were not pushy after we told them we did not think it was for us. Hope this helps anyone interested in staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SheTimesThree
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my timeshare week for a week at the Marriott Grand Chateau and what a wonderful experience it was! The staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. Although my daughters and I pulled up with our jeep full of bags, coolers and personal items, the complimentary valet parking and bell hops took care of everything. I'm sure I looked a mess when we arrived after the 4 hour drive, but everyone made us feel very welcome. The hotel itself is only a 1/2 block off of the strip and within walking distance to many of the casinos. Our room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable. We had the one bedroom suite, and the four of us were very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for the location”
Reviews.Author: Travelfunfamily
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about staying here after reading the reviews, but I was plesently surprised. The hotel is very clean and new. They are still working out a few kinks, including the air ducts in the bedroom (they sound like a train coming through the ducts when they turn on). You can keep the heat/air down and minimize how much you hear. This was the worst thing and not even bad. The time share thing is a joke. It could be for someone else, but we are trying to buy a house before we buy a vacation home. It you must go for your stay just act really uninterested and they will leave you alone. Over all is was a good stay. The location was perfect. Very clean and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Update - no worries”
Reviews.Author: MarkG604
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay in a one bedroom suite at the Grand Chateau. I was a bit worried after reading all those reviews about construction noise, but my fears proved groundless. For at least the next few months they will be working on the interior finishings of the second tower suites (17th floor and up). I stayed in the second tower on the 9th floor and never heard a thing. In fact, I might have been the first person to stay in my suite, as it was spotless and nothing looked used. I thoroughly enjoyed the room and the hotel. Others have written in depth about this hotel so I won't go into too much more detail. The location is great, just across the street from a major shopping mall which has several good restaurants and leads directly to the Planet Hollywood casino. Bellagio is only a 15 minute walk as is Paris, MGM Grand, and New York New York and others. The Marriott is non-smoking which is great especially after hanging around all those smoky casinos. Yes, the pool on the roof is extremely small - they will build a bigger one off the lobby next year. The Owner's Lounge is very handy as there are two internet stations for 35 cents a minute, plus a very relaxing massage chair and TV. Can't think of anything bad about this hotel and will definitely return. The location and amenities are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fortier2024
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - it's away from the strip and is completely non smoking. The decor is modern and the staff are very friendly and attentive. Our room was called a villa with a king bed and kitchenette. It was a very comfortable and quiet room - sole exception was our amorous neighbors next door. Not a big deal. We got a great rate from the Marriott website so look for specials. You also get a welcome pack with coffee and niceties which was great. I would suggest this place to anyone who wants to be a bit away from the strip but still in walking distance. It's right across from the Miracle Mile Shops where you can buy breakfast or dinner and close to Planet Hollywood. I would also definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Chateau: A weeks vacation, but we didn't buy into the timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: AprilC73
Reviews.Content: In truth the Marriott Grand Chateau was a nice place to stay, and the ammenities were a little above average. However the price was also a little above average. We had a 1 bedroom villa which included a measter bedroom with king bed, a sofa sleeper in the living room (where the kids slept), a small but full kitchen, and a dining table. The extra nice things were: The entire property is 100% total non-smoking!
