Great for a non-smoking family that does not wish to smell smoke filled rooms, or smoke permeated carpet, furniture or linens, pillows, etc. The bathroom has 2 vanities, each with it's own sink. Also, there is a large soaking tub (our kids loved taking baths), and a seperate shower with 2 shower heads. On the down side: During a 6 night stay we only had the daily towel exchange, and the beds made -- which was include in "the daily tidy-up service" -- that was free of charge. Our bed linens were not changed once! The floor was not swept nor vaccummed. The bath tub and shower not cleaned once. To have the room cleaned once we would have had to pay over $100. for the basic cleaning that usually included free of charge at every other hotel I've ever stayed in. Since this was my vacation I was not going to clean the room myself. Why we decided not to buy into the timeshare program: Simple, we figured out that it was a scam. We had paid $1,295. months in advance for a 6 nigh 7 day vacation. Thats a little over $200. a night. Over $200. a night was a bit pricey for Las Vegas during the "off season - work week" Sunday - Friday stay. Other places had much better deals for the money. Everything was over priced! My husband bought a cheap brand "trial-sized" can of shave crream that actually read "not for resale" from the store next to the lobby for $5. What was really alarming and made us decide NOT to buy was the outrageous prices added (not included) for a basic cleaning service(s) that was charged to vacation club owners every day. Combine the excessive yearly maintenance fees + daily cleaning fees + $25,000 (with interest) = rip off scam! As if the $25,000 wasn't enough, by the time you add the daily cleaning fees together with the yearly maintenance fees you'd be paying well over $100. a day for a vacation you already paid for in advance. In the long run you save no money buying into a timeshare with Marriott. The Marriott Grand - Chateau was nice, but not nice enough for the price per night.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!! Love It!! Love It!!”
Reviews.Author: mooshu01
Reviews.Content: All i have to say is that I love this place and would come back here all the time from now on. My friends and i had a great time even at the pool in the middle of december. the bar up top was fun to be at and to look at all the lights a places from 38 floors high was the best view ever! the people that work there i felt were very nice and friendly. I will always plan on staying there from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Chateau.....Swanky”
Reviews.Author: w4559
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Chateau with friends for two nights in late October. Being hicks from Indiana, I doesn't take much to impress us, and the Grand Chateau does. The Grand Chateau is about a five minute walk behind The Planet Hollywood and the Harley Davidson Restaurant. From that approximate area you are basically in the middle of everything on the strip. The rooms are plush, clean and nice. People complain sometimes about the pool and hot tub on the 38th floor, I say, is the one at your house nicer, because we don't have a pool, and anything's better than nothing. While staying at the GrandChat, you must go eat a Fatburger just down the road on the strip, it's delicious. Also, you got to go see Big Elvis Monday through Friday at Bill'S Gambling Hall beside the Flamingo and Bally's. The show is the next best thing to seeing the King. He is the greatest 500 pound Elvis Impersonator on the face of the earth. And the best part is that it is FREE!!! Overall, the Grand Chateau is nice and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MONTES
Reviews.Content: the Gran Chateu is very nice, and non smoking, which in las vegas is a plus. Customer service very efficient, and the rooms very clean and all have a nice view. The hotel is about two blocks from P.H planet hollywood hotel and casino, and the MGM and so on forh on the strip. The only thing about the Chateu that really needs to go is the pool, horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy in Boston
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott timeshare owners in Aruba, so we exchanged our lockoff unit to stay here. The entire place is beautiful and very elegant. I think the unit we were in (3310) might be even nicer than the Aruba Surf Club units. The unit was huge, with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, soaking tub, walk in shower with double shower heads, 42" plasma TV in the living room, and an amazingly comfortable king bed. While it is not "convenient" to stay at a place w/o a casino, it is very nice to be able to walk in here after a night on the strip and be at a clean, smoke free, quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: vavalou
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't my 1st choice, but it's what was available as an exchange through my timeshare company. For Vegas, it's considered small. The location was actually great - right around the corner from the strip, so it was accessible to everything, and right across from the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops. I know most people that go to Vegas, spend very little time at the hotel, but when you want a little down time, there needs to be something to make you want to stick around. Unfortunately, there wasn't anything here like that. The pool (located on the roof on the 38th floor) was very small - about 12 feet long only 3 feet deep. It had a bar, but no snacks, so if you were hungry, you needed to leave the hotel to get food, as the hotel itself had no restaurant either. Thank goodness there was music piped in from a radio (at the pool, that is), otherwise there was no other atmosphere. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The room wasn't bad, although a bit small. I don't know what their actual prices are, so I can't say if it's worth the money, but as I said, if you want location, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with beautiful rooms and a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Shayce
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 30th-July 7th, 2007. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and our room was gorgeous. We noticed a minimal amount of noise from the construction, but it did not bother us at all (although we have 2 small children so our tolerance level might be higher than some - lol). The staff was so friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Anytime we asked for something, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and had everything we could ask for in it. The rooftop pool was a bit small and always filled with kids, but our kids enjoyed it and as the building expands, another pool/pools will be added. The only downside was that the bar on the roof was extremely overpriced for purchasing drinks. If you plan to drink, go to the 7-11 a few blocks away on the Strip or just go gamble at one of the casinos and get them for free! My family and I loved this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, rooms & location - and no noise!”
Reviews.Author: jcroft44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jul 29 - Aug 5 in a 1 bedroom suite - full kitchen, separate bedroom. The room was nicely decorated and everything looked new and shiny! The lobby/common areas were also very nice, although the rooftop pool is small and there is no shade. Staff was very polite and attentive. Location is great - one block away from the masses on the Strip. There is construction going on all around: this property and Plant Hollywood across the street. We stayed on the 31st floor, facing Harmon St. (even-numbered rooms) and barely heard a thing - our sleep was never interrupted. The rooms that face the other side (odd-numbers) are right next to the construction of the new tower, and might have more of a noise problem. So, to recap, aim for a high floor and an even-numbered room.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: BengalNut
Reviews.Content: The resort is under construction (like the rest of the city) but they do a good job in keeping the lobby and guest areas clean and quiet. The lobby and rooms are top notch. The pool is inadequate for a resort of this type...no shade, very few chairs and a small area. Go next door to the Planet Hollywood hotel (there is reciprocity). They have two large pools and a huge sunbathing patio. It is also a better location to people watch. The best part about this resort is the location. You are only a half block from the strip and located next to Planet Hollywood (formerly Aladdin). You are very close to NYNY, MGM, Bellagio and Paris. The best bit of advice we picked up on this site was regarding show tickets. Do not buy in advance. Just up the street from the Marriott in the Hawaiian square shopping area is a kiosk that sells 2 for 1 show tickets. They open everyday at 11:00am and have a monitor which lists the available shows and prices. Most are 1/2 price, but some of the more popular shows are available at 1/3 off. All of the shows were available when we were there...Carrot Top, Mamma Mia, Zumanity, etc. Unless you are not flexible or are absolutely set on one particular show, you should definitely buy tickets from the kiosk. The only complainants other than the pool would be with the lack of a restaurant in the hotel. Other than overpriced food from the gift shop, there were no choices. Again though, because of the location you can walk across the street to the Miracle Mile shops and choose from 8-10 restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good for group getaways!”
Reviews.Author: BridgetJones77
Reviews.Content: Only a few drawbacks: our plasma screen bummed out and the management did nothing to compensate us (it was during March Madness, and it mattered!); the hotel provided no hair conditioner or lotion which we found odd; and the maid service was "light" as advertised. The great? Location, location, location; cleanliness; comfort of beds; spaciousness of bathrooms; amenities that included a dishwasher and laundry in our suite as well as a full kitchen and all utensils, blender, dishes, etc., and with a big group, the per person price was reasonable for such a new place. The pool was small, but the setting pleasurable with a good view and more than ample amenities.

Reviews.Title: “awesome facility”
Reviews.Author: gratefulLakewood
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lockout unit for one week over the christmas holiday. I was a bit concerned that it would be a long time to spend in a hotel room but was very surprised. The room was spacious and provided you with a full size microwave and small fridge. We made coffee in the room everyday and had a place to put some beer and wine. The staff was great and the room was very well appointed. We did hear a bit of construction noise but it came from the surrounding area. They are building a W resort next door and this was some of the noise we heard. Only complaint was the pillows were flat so we bought some at Costco. We rented from an owner and if we wanted housekeeping service which included changing the sheets it was 42.00 which is a bit high. They will give you fresh towels whenever you need them. I would atay at this hotel again the location is great we walked accross the street to the Aladin hotel which was in the middle of the strip. As mentioned the pool on the roof was tiny but the view is awesome. I would stay here again in a minute.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Grand Chateau
HotelInfo.Address: 75 East Harmon Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89109
